story:
ABOUT ME and MY BOOK:

 

After such amazing and adventurous 2 years art journey I finally decided it's time to turn my photos into unique thing - a beautiful art book. And I need your help to realise the photo book.

My name is Yevgen Romanenko. I am a self-taught professional photographer.

I'm an award winning photographer. I live in Odessa but originally comes from Budapest. My artistic skills developed quite early, since childhood i has been fascinated with fine art. My adventure with photography began at the end of 2010 and in a short time from a hobby developed into a true passion and a professional occupation. I specialize in beauty, fashion, advertising and fine art nudes photography. My eye for capturing authentic human characteristics and expressions is revealed in a unique, painterly style. I'm known for my perfectionism and my photographs are delicate, yet at the same time bright and vivid.

 

More about my work: www.romanenko.org

If you have any questions, don't hesitate to ask me via my email: yevgen and romanenko.org

WHAT I NEED TO PUBLISH THE BOOK ?

My goal is to publish a limited edition book. To do this I need to raise at least 10,000 $. The more money I raise the nicer the book can be. Many details during printing and binding separate a good book from a great book and I want this to be a great book. I am setting a goal of 10,000 $ because this is what I think I am capable of raising.

HOW CAN YOU DONATE and GET YOUR OWN BOOK ?

You can donate with your typical credit cards (Visa and Mastercard) or with PayPal account. So it is so easy for everyone :-) The Perks you get for your contribution are on the right side (7 grey rectangles).

WHAT WILL YOU GET FOR YOUR CONTRIBUTION ?

While the book itself will be the main goal and the reward for the $ 49 and higher levels, medium paper prints and beautiful museum archival grand prints up to 100x150cm from my portfolio, personally signed and numbered (edition of 28). Read more about each of these rewards to the right. All books will be sent immediately after publishing the book (during the fourth quarter of the year 2013).

THE IMAGES:

Below are just a few of the images from the book:

 


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN SUPPORT:

If you can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

Please send this link along to your friends and family on facebook, twitter or just to your email contacts who you think might be interested in supporting me.

The Indiegogo share tools on this site can help get the word out!

story:
the beginning of a creative journey

My dream of opening an art studio began 14 years ago. In 1997 my dad passed away unexpectedly. Our family was devastated. In an effort to fill her time and lonliness, my mom left her corporate job and bought a paint your own pottery studio. I decided to leave my job too and help her with this new endeavor. From there a passion for small business, pottery and art grew. The studio was our retreat from the reality of losing my dad. When she decided to sell the store-front business, I created a mobile pottery and ceramics company called Studio2You taking art to local schools, community centers, hosting birthday parties and other events. I ran the mobile pottery business for over 12 years on a part time basis so that I could also be at home with our two young children.

the next step 

Three years ago I decided what our Rainier Valley neighborhood needed was an art studio and I was going to be the one to make it happen!  There are no art studios like ours in the area. In fact, we live in an area of SE Seattle which is remarkably  underserved. We love living here and wanted to bring to life this working studio so we could offer our services to the most diverse zip code in the country! During this journey I met a woman who was so inspired by my business idea that she offered to be a financial investor and partner in the company. We were on our way.

we did it!

So, after years of planning we opened Emerald City Fired Arts Studio & Gallery a neighborhood storefront pottery studio specializing in paint your own pottery, clay art, mosaics and glass fusion. Every detail of the studio was architecturally designed and carefully executed from the hand-made paint pallets to the colors on the walls. Our team worked tirelessly on every detail to make the space inviting, warm and welcoming for people of all ages and all levels of experience. We want the studio to appeal to the hobby artist as well as the professional and want to foster the idea that everyone is creative. We are also proud to feature local artists work on our gallery walls which as a by-product provides inspiration and joy to all who visit our studio.


indie gogo!

When I found out about IndieGoGo, I was moved. What an amazing concept...that others would invest their money in people's projects just because they can or that they believe in the idea. We have exhausted all other traditional avenues for securing funding and have used all our personal savings. We have investors and others counting on me to make this business a success. I am asking for $15,000 to help us get on our feet. Even though our doors are open, we have financial burdens that make it difficult to thrive. This money will help pay for build-out construction costs (which includes an expensive piece of HVAC equipment that the city of Seattle required we have but we didn’t know about prior to construction) and a second kiln that we need in order to grow our business. I am hopeful folks will find it in their hearts to help us out so we can do what we do best which is to offer artistic opportunities to our patrons, collaborate in community-building art projects and foster the idea that art is an important part of our existence as human beings. I sincerely thank you for spending the time to read this and considering donating to our project. I am confident our studio will have a positive impact on people's lives and our community.

Sincerely,

Sarah Rankin

story:
What is ‘The Hand of Inspiration’?

The art piece is designed in the image of a ‘hamsa’. The double-thumbed hand design is a cross-cultural and cross-religious symbol that is a trademark of the middle-eastern region. The “Hand’ will stand at just over 6 meters tall (that’s about 20 feet) and will rest upon a large circular stage that is intended to naturally form a circle of participants as they gather around the structure during the Burning Man event. There will be music and lights, there will be engagement and with the help of a few sparks here and there, inspiration will burn brightly.

 

Why we need your support and what we'll do with the money:

Getting ‘The Hand of Inspiration’ to Black Rock City, Nevada is expensive, yet possible. Most of the team, obviously, lives in Israel. This means that we have very little equipment or resources at hand.

We’ve already received the support of many amazing people from the Reno and San Francisco areas such as kitchen equipment and shade structures so that we can build the ‘Hand’ on the Playa before the event. We’ve also got a fundraising event planned for August here in Israel.

Still, we have to basically buy everything - like a ton of wood, power tools and  electronics - because we’re coming from the other side of the planet and giant electric saws don’t exactly fit in the overhead compartment and besides, can you imagine trying to get a compound miter saw through airport security?

 

The rewards are awesome!

Participatory experience is key - which is why we’re putting it into the gifts for Backers of the project. As much as possible, we want the gifts to be something you can use, play with or experience.

The success of the project means that you will be able to interact with the 'Hand'', to create your own musical and light-filled experience, together with others.

 

What is Midburn?

‘Midburn’ is the Israeli Burning Man regional. Hundreds of Israelis who have been to Burning Man in Nevada. Hundreds more have been to Midburn events in Israel. The events are as diverse as their participants.

 

The creative process and design:

There were a lot of ideas at first and everyone has been really passionate and curious about what it would look like and how it would feel when we finally got it onto the Playa.

The final design follows three basic concepts: simplicity, tribe and inspiration.

  • Simplicity - the design itself has a simple, yet beautiful geometry. The interactive lights and drums have a simple interface. The message is simple.

  • Tribe - the base of the ‘Hand’ is a circular stage that participants can gather around as a tribe, playing the drums, dancing, collaborating.

  • Inspiration - we want to create an inspiring experience that would be our gift to Black Rock City’s citizens.

Simplicity + Inspiration X Tribe = ‘The Hand of Inspiration’

 

Burning Man and the Cargo Cult art theme:

The Burning Man event is an experiment in temporary community. 'The Hand of Inspiration' is an experiment in temporary tribe.

“Cargo Cult”, this year’s art theme at Burning Man, is a mixture of the old and the new. The old culture can no longer protect or sustain itself because the new culture defies the nature of the old - just as a new science can defy the nature of an old religious belief. In order to preserve and protect the heart of the old culture, ‘Cargo Cult’ is embraced.

 

What is a ‘Hamsa’?

The “Hamsa” is an ancient cross-cultural symbol in the middle-east. The major monotheistic religions believe that it represents protection from evil

In Israel, the symbol is hung on the walls and doors of homes, carried on keychains and it’s even tied to rearview mirrors in cars. Since it is so common, it mixes our everyday life - the new culture - with that amorphic, spiritual place from the old culture.

 

 

What stage is the project at now?

So, now we have a 1/4 model with working electronics for the interactive drums and light display. The blueprints for the construction of the real thing are ready. A lot of amazing people from all over the world are bringing their skills and love into the project.
story_txt:
What is ‘The Hand of Inspiration’?
The art piece is designed in the image of a ‘hamsa’. The double-thumbed hand design is a cross-cultural and cross-religious symbol that is a trademark of the middle-eastern region. The “Hand’ will stand at just over 6 meters tall (that’s about 20 feet) and will rest upon a large circular stage that is intended to naturally form a circle of participants as they gather around the structure during the Burning Man event. There will be music and lights, there will be engagement and with the help of a few sparks here and there, inspiration will burn brightly.
 
Why we need your support and what we'll do with the money:
Getting ‘The Hand of Inspiration’ to Black Rock City, Nevada is expensive, yet possible. Most of the team, obviously, lives in Israel. This means that we have very little equipment or resources at hand.
We’ve already received the support of many amazing people from the Reno and San Francisco areas such as kitchen equipment and shade structures so that we can build the ‘Hand’ on the Playa before the event. We’ve also got a fundraising event planned for August here in Israel.
Still, we have to basically buy everything - like a ton of wood, power tools and  electronics - because we’re coming from the other side of the planet and giant electric saws don’t exactly fit in the overhead compartment and besides, can you imagine trying to get a compound miter saw through airport security?
 
The rewards are awesome!
Participatory experience is key - which is why we’re putting it into the gifts for Backers of the project. As much as possible, we want the gifts to be something you can use, play with or experience.
The success of the project means that you will be able to interact with the 'Hand'', to create your own musical and light-filled experience, together with others.
 
What is Midburn?
‘Midburn’ is the Israeli Burning Man regional. Hundreds of Israelis who have been to Burning Man in Nevada. Hundreds more have been to Midburn events in Israel. The events are as diverse as their participants.
 
The creative process and design:
There were a lot of ideas at first and everyone has been really passionate and curious about what it would look like and how it would feel when we finally got it onto the Playa.
The final design follows three basic concepts: simplicity, tribe and inspiration.


Simplicity - the design itself has a simple, yet beautiful geometry. The interactive lights and drums have a simple interface. The message is simple.


Tribe - the base of the ‘Hand’ is a circular stage that participants can gather around as a tribe, playing the drums, dancing, collaborating.


Inspiration - we want to create an inspiring experience that would be our gift to Black Rock City’s citizens.

Simplicity + Inspiration X Tribe = ‘The Hand of Inspiration’
 
Burning Man and the Cargo Cult art theme:
The Burning Man event is an experiment in temporary community. 'The Hand of Inspiration' is an experiment in temporary tribe.
“Cargo Cult”, this year’s art theme at Burning Man, is a mixture of the old and the new. The old culture can no longer protect or sustain itself because the new culture defies the nature of the old - just as a new science can defy the nature of an old religious belief. In order to preserve and protect the heart of the old culture, ‘Cargo Cult’ is embraced.
 
What is a ‘Hamsa’?
The “Hamsa” is an ancient cross-cultural symbol in the middle-east. The major monotheistic religions believe that it represents protection from evil
In Israel, the symbol is hung on the walls and doors of homes, carried on keychains and it’s even tied to rearview mirrors in cars. Since it is so common, it mixes our everyday life - the new culture - with that amorphic, spiritual place from the old culture.
 
 
What stage is the project at now?
So, now we have a 1/4 model with working electronics for the interactive drums and light display. The blueprints for the construction of the real thing are ready. A lot of amazing people from all over the world are bringing their skills and love into the project.

story:
Who is House of Toast?

We are a collective of folks who run the House of Toast room party at CONvergence, a science fiction/fantasy convention in Bloomington, MN. We've been slinging toast with over 100 various toppings (both ordinary and strange) for the masses at CON for 12 years.

In the past, we have funded our party primarily with money from our contributing core group of volunteers, supplemented by tips from our awesome party guests. This year, we really want to take steps to improve the flow of the line, and take our party to the next level! So we need YOUR help.

What We Need

What we will be using this fundraising money for:

  • Our main goal for the fundraiser is a new belt-drive toaster to make toasting faster and more efficient, thus getting you toast more quickly. The model which we have picked will be around $600 plus shipping.

  • Our main fundraising goal is to raise enough money to purchase the toaster, Anything over that first goal, we will put towards future HoT room party improvements -- purchasing wall panels for faster setup, a second digital toppings menu board, improved topping stations, a washing station, etc. If we exceed our $1700 goal, we will also level up our incentives by adding new, shiny rewards to those who donate! Some improvements will have to wait until 2015 to implement, but we want to get as many in this year as we can.

What You Get

All incentives can be shipped or picked up from Noon-3pm on Thursday, Friday, or Saturday of the convention. Please indicate which you would prefer during the checkout process. If you are an international supporter, please add $5 to your donation for shipping.

Awesome incentives!

  • All donors will have their name printed on our “Toaster of Fame”, to commemorate your fabulous support of House of Toast. If you don’t want your name on the Toaster, please let us know.

  • All donors at $5 and above will get a fabulous "Piece of Toast" badge ribbon to adorn your CON badge! 

  • $15 donors get an orange “House of Toast” lanyard to proudly display their CON badge.

  • $30 donors will get a tan "House of Toast" t-shirt, printed with our logo.

             Curvy, tight cut sizes available: S-2XL (aka “women’s” cut)

             Standard t-shirt cut sizes available: S-4XL. (aka “men’s” cut)

  • If a t-shirt is not your style, for $30 you could get a stylish polar fleece toast hat! (limit 8)

  • $40 donors receive a fabulous handmade, collectible +1 Toaster Pin of Awesomeness. What does it give you +1 of? Why, an extra topping of course! (limit 15)

  • $50 donors get our +1 Pin of Awesomeness that LIGHTS UP with a red LED! (limit 15)

  • $100+ donors will get 2 badge ribbons, their picture or likeness on one of our advertisement posters and get to pick 2 of these incentives packs:

    • 2 toaster pins

    • 2 lanyards

    • 2 t-shirts

    • or 2 fleece hats

(Limit 20)

  • Donors $100 and above plus one guest are cordially invited to one of our private donor parties at House of Toast: Thursday July 3rd or Friday July 4th at 5:45pm-6:45pm. We will make you all the toast you want, you'll get to try SUPER SPECIAL toppings that will only be available to donors, and we won’t limit your toppings! (Limit 20)

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate financially, please consider helping us by:

  • Getting the word out, sharing this link on your social networks and making some noise for us!

  • Consider volunteering for House of Toast before/during/after CONvergence! We could always use fun, energetic people to do everything from helping with load in/load out to slinging toast. Please email toastievolunteers@gmail.com to sign up!

Thank you all!

Our homepage: http://www.houseoftoast.org/

Our Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/houseoftoast

HoT 2014 Facebook event page: https://www.facebook.com/events/277816662379876

HoT 2014 Volunteer event page: https://www.facebook.com/events/799774860041155/

story:
Our "art" is a spiritual journey.

"Every Single Soul is a Poem, written on the back of God's hand" -- Michael Franti

For 26 years, I've been on a path of focusing, every day, on the planetary positions, in the astrological night sky, geometrically, energetically, and experientially, through observation of self and others in syncronicity with planetary cycles.

"Treasure Map 4 Your Soul," is my giant box, in which to place the "gems" of my time with the stars, to better share them with you. I am turning a seemingly complicated system, of many, into a simple mapping system, guiding anyone and everyone to find "their own treasures," and the treasures of others too!  The greatest gift of the stars--is the treasures it uncovers within, and each day.

Syncronicities light me on fire, and "surfing the stars," increases syncronicity by manyfold.  Through watching the cycles and asking how to master "surfing the archetypal energies," as they change, i have asked, and received answers from mysterious and not-so-mysterious places. Together, box and contents, we each are a plethora of real treasures.

One example of this is my observation and the consistent, stand-by structure in our earth-human time: of the MOON in its lunar cycle. This can be as simple as "looking up," at night and seeing how big the moon is, and noticing if it is growing or shrinking.

As the Moon waxes and wanes; our energy, enthusiasm, sexual arousal, desire to be social, does seem to rise and fall. There are all kinds of mysterious and syncronistic risings and fallings of energy, like the tides, moods, women's breasts and wombs, cellular regeneration, and the cycle of creation of life itself, like the Moon, all things rise and fall.

Our energy and timing seems to move around the Moon's archetypal clock. The Moon is the most simple for us to see visually. Its cycle is see-ably eloquent to us, from the ground--and there are other planets who are more potent, more mysterious, more solid, or more fluid, to surf.

We live in a house of cycles, that live within our house of stars. Above our heads, there lies a light-filled map that seems to reflect my mood each day, and possibly yours?!

  * Azlan White has been practicing and studying the art and science of Astrology for 26 years. "One summer, 15 Years ago, I spent 3 months, (like a Yoda cave experience), speaking with Sirian extra-terrestrial guides for an hour each day. The astrological answers to my star-lit questions, fill my astrology practice to this day."

  * “What you wish for others you get for yourself,” In these times of economic upheaval, old bad system collapse, and intense transition, I ask you for financial support to continue on my journey. Your support reinforces my ability to translate the unusual wisdom I bring, into a tangible share-able form. It also supports all the extra volunteer work: like Oracle Theater, the Women's Congress for Future Generations, and a new Eco-Village-green-tech-based world that is kind to nature and people!

  * Global Relief Resources, the  non-profit, 501.C3 that is serving as the holy grail (cup of vision of abundance), of fundraising for "ending FGM in Africa," will also be upheld by your contribution. By sharing resources with the powerful and amazing women who lead the movement to end FGM, in each country, I am able to fulfill my soul’s call, while publishing a supportive ushering toward your soul’s calls.

I am counting on our mutual service to each other--to support us both through this time! Check out the awesome new gifts i'm offering in this second home stretch campaign! You can try longevity elixirs, head toward regeneration, and dig into your own treasure map for your own soul!!

I and we are in a great transition!

As we reach for mutual service and a freer economy, we reach toward the new era.

 At www.1000Mothers.net, the current project at Global Relief Resources, we are shifting our philosophy and operation strategy at this time. Rather than doing direct fundraising, we are building small eco-businesses that fund the 501.C3 projects through small "for-profit" projects. We invite ideas, and success stories as the 501.C3 transitions its living style. Your support is critical during this transition.

Your support in these times offers a gesture of love to all of the above projects. Treaure Map 4 Your Soul is a very large map, many large maps, for each human being is a poem, filled with treasures to uncover.

  • Your support at this time goes for food water, publishing, and non-profit basic costs, for now and the year ahead.
  • The perks are based on new small businesses that will support the new 501.C3 plan
  • Every little bit helps! And if you only have $2 you can buy a raffle ticket for a growing list of possible prizes!

The last campaign i did here raised $900!! Thank you so much to all those who contributed!

Now i need the rest of your support, for my home stretch! The mutual service opportunities are so much fun!

  • Stay connected to what is new and alive in our newly emerging era!
  • You will support craftspeople like cover artists, style editors, and manuscript checkers. A whole team will be activated as a result of your support! And you'll be a part of something so so cool! Between the gifts, the book and the maps! We are ready to rock the world with soul!

Other Ways You Can Help

You can pass the word, type words of kindness and cheer, and invite others to have readings! I would still so appreciate your support in any way you imagine! Let me know if you see an opportunity for collaboration!
Thank you, Thank you, Thank you, Thank you!
Namaste!

story:
About LA Zine Fest

We at the L.A. Zine Fest (LAZF) are dedicated to promoting zine culture as a means to connect the pre-existing communities in L.A.–artistic and otherwise. We believe that by embracing the urge to create and to share ideas, the local zine community can increase its presence and flourish. Throughout the year, LAZF’s organizers put on zine panels and workshops throughout the city, but it all builds up to the Zine Fest: an opportunity for zinesters local and far-flung to meet and exchange ideas with each other and with all of Los Angeles!

The third annual L.A. Zine Fest will take place on February 16, 2014 at the Helms Bakery complex in Culver City.  We are excited to have a roomy venue that can accommodate our steadily growing numbers--we hope to avoid last year’s lines around the block! LAZF’s organizers are hard at work on the schedule for 2014’s LAZF and are planning incredible workshops, panels, and readings throughout the day.  


Where does your money go?

We break it down in the video, but since filming, we've found out about new expenses that we may have, such as paying for fire marshall visits and for on-site security. Because we have a new venue each year, there are always last-minute expenses popping up--some permit we find out about at the last minute; extra lights we didn’t know we’d need. Every cent goes toward producing this and future events. 

What do you get for donating?

First and foremost, when you donate, you are doing your part to ensure that the L.A. Zine Fest happens this February.  We are not being dramatic: this thing is expensive and we just don’t have all the money. We knocked off a big chunk of the event costs by hustling to get a venue donated, but we’re going to need some help with the rest. For your generosity, you will be rewarded...


...with prizes!  

  • $10 = Your name in the LA Zine Fest Guide To L.A. #3 on the first page of the zine PLUS a heartfelt and deeply grateful thank you featured prominently on our blog

  • $25 = PDFs of the LA Zine Guide To L.A. #1, 2, and 3 (when it comes out) PLUS your name on the first page of Guide To L.A. #3 AND that heartfelt and deeply grateful thank you on our blog

  • $50 = LAZF 2013 T-shirt, 1 LAZF sticker, and a button straight to your mailbox! 

Feeling extra-generous? Just won the lottery? Trying to impress a romantic interest? You'll be glad you spent it here because you get...

  • Admission to our vendor-only preview on February 15 ($100 donation; limit 15) 

  • Host a podcast night on Family Dinner Radio! Invite up to 3 guests; drinks and snacks included. You will be interviewed by the LAZF crew and Brodie Foster Hubbard from Shakeytown Radio. ($150 donation; limit 3) 

  • Be a guest DJ on KXLU 88.9FM! There are a couple of rules you must follow, but apart from that, go nuts. ($500 donation; limit 2) 

 

  • Have a full-on zine workshop and screen printing demo at your house/school/organization for up to 20 people! We'll get the party started for ages 8 and up (no babies, dude). We bring all the materials and THREE DOZEN COOKIES (vegan and gluten-free options are on the table). ($800 donation; limit 3) 


If you would love to contribute to the campaign but just can’t spare the cash, we’d appreciate your sharing this with others. That helps a lot. Thank you!

story:
Bad Parking Cards... 

Have you ever parked next to an inconsiderate jerk who parked so close that you had to squeeze out of your car like a sardine?  Or gone holiday shopping and realized that the last spot available in the entire parking lot is taken up by some oversized truck in the next spot over that clearly couldn't read the "Compact Only" sign directly in front of them? Well so have we, which is why we created "Bad Parking" quote cards!  Next time you feel the need to yell profanities out your window with the kids in the back seat, or key their car while shopping with your grandmother... refrain and take comfort in the fact that you can leave an unrefined card of wisdom on their windshield instead. 


"Bad Parking" Cards are pearls of unrefined wisdom that are straight to the point on a standard size business card (perfect size to fit in your console or purse). Keep these with you to let those who only think of themselves know that others don't appreciate their lack of parking skills. Each pack comes with 40 cards (10 different quotes/pack).

You can also indulge in our other variety packs with a donation of $25 or more!


"Call Me Crazy"       "Government Shutdown Awesomeness"

"Simply Kindness"

story:
Ginger Twist & Tiny D are at it again!

With the 2014 Burlesque Legends Calendar!

Last year's calendar was a success thanks to all who were involved. And this year we want to make it bigger and better, but we need your help to get it off the ground and get these Legends to Vegas for the Burlesque Hall of Fame 2014! 

We'll use a portion of the money to print the calendars and the rest will go to getting the Legends to Vegas for BHoF 2014!

This year we are tributing: Marinka, Haji, Kitten Natividad, Bic Carrol, Judith Stein, Velvet Ice, Val Valentine, Ezi Rider, Tammi True, Ellion Ness, Dixie Evans & Viva La Fever

With the help of performers: Amber Ray, Jo Weldon, Bunny Buxom, Sizzle Dizzle, Brief Sweat, Burgundy Brixx, Roxi D'Lite, Grace Gotham, Dottie Dynamo, Sydni Deveraux, Doctor Lucky & Minnie Tonka

Special thanks to our NYC photographer & designer David L Byrd who donated his time and talents to the legends.

There will also be a show on January 4th at Le Poisson Rouge in NYC Hosted by World Famous BOB. Performers will tribute their legends and we'll have calendars for sale & several amazing raffle prizes donated by members of the Burlesque community!

Everyone is donating their time and efforts for this project and we are very appreciative!

If you can't donate monetarily at this time, we understand, help us get the word out on social media! Or let us know if you'd like to contribute to our raffle, or volunteer your time helping out.

story:
Who We Are

Strange Coupling is student-run event that pairs current University of Washington, Seattle students (of anymajor)with local professional artists to create new, meaningful relationships and to build a bridge between students and the local arts community.  

The artist-student "couples" are given two months to connect and collaborate on new works of art to be shown in the final, celebratory gallery exhibition.  For students this is an opportunity to expand their practice beyond school, exhibit their work to the public, and above all to build relationships within their local art community.  

What We Need 

As a student run endeavor, Strange Coupling is completely funded by public donations and support from the local community.  All funding received will go towards providing a space to show the couples' work, supplies for the final gallery exhibition, and towards helping the couples fund their collaborations through a stipend.  

It is a StrangeCo tradition to have the year's participating students take over and organize the next year's event, so a portion of the funds will be passed on to next year's student organizers to help carry on the event.  

What You Get

As students who got to participate in StrangeCo last year, we can all agree that it's an unforgettable experience.  This year, in exchange for your thoughtful donations, we'll be providing you with limited edition 12th annual Strange Coupling tokens of appreciation, hand-assembled with love in thanks for helping us keep the tradition alive!

Goodie Bags: A handmade bag of treats including small art and other StrangeCo items!

StrangeCo Posters: One of two collectible posters made specifically for this campaign printed beautifully on archival paper!

StrangeCo Shirts: An aesthetically pleasing T-Shirt with a graphic also made specifically for this campaign!

Mixtape: We've got a crush on you and will be making you a mixtape!  Not only that, we'll also write and record a song on it for you!

Art Piece: A member of the Strange Coupling family, past or present, will create a work of art just for you!  Beautiful!

What Else You Can Do

If you are a University of Washington student, head to strangecoupling.tumblr.com to learn more about the event and how you can participate!  Applications are open until Feb. 1st!

If you or someone you know is interested in hosting either the StrangeCo exhibition or an event in support of the project, please contact us at: strangecoupling2014@gmail.com

If you'd like to feature or cover any aspect of StrangeCo for a blog or other type of media, please contact us at: strangecoupling2014@gmail.com

For more information and to keep updated with all things Strange Coupling, head to our facebook or blog to see what's happening!

Thank you all so much for your time, consideration, and help in keeping this wonderful tradition alive!

story:
A Tarathon in Memory of Carly Jean Ferro, Sept. 26

Purple Angel Foundation Background:
  • Ellen Miller of Rutland started the Purple Angle Foundation in the memory of her daughter, Carly Jean Ferro, whose life was cut incredibly short by an inebriated driver two years ago, when she was just 17.  The non-profit organization keeps the light that Carly brought to her community shining through charitable, community, and educational projects in Rutland. 
The Tarathon:
  • This year, as I turn 26 on the 26th of September, I wanted to use my "Golden Birthday" to do something memorable. I love running, and decided that running 26.26 miles on my birthday would be fitting, and a fun challenge. As a muralist who loves working with non-profits, I decided that this would be a great opportunity to fundraise for a mural project. Friends have dubbed this the Tarathon, because I will be making my way along the Lake Champlain waterfront as a solitary runner.
The significance September 26th:
  • Ellen and I had been talking about a memorial mural that would brighten up the discount food storefront, where Carly was struck by a car while leaving work, for a few months now. Recently, as I was looking for a recipient for Tarathon donations, I learned that the 26th of September is also the anniversary of Carly's death, and I felt unwaveringly that this was the right project to be supporting.

What We Need & What You Get

  • I am hoping to raise anything I can. However, in keeping with my theme of 26s, I decided that 2,626.26 would be a good place to start! This would cover roughly half the cost of a 25x14' exterior mural, allowing more Purple Angel Foundation funds to be spent on other great projects, such as little free libraries, purple benches, and golf scholarships (Carly was an avid golfer).
  • Other than the shared joy of honoring a wonderful individual with a piece of public art, I will gift each donor a 8.5x11" print of the finished mural (to be completed next spring).
  • Any funds will be helpful to this cause. Because the Purple Angel Foundation is a non-profit with all sorts of wonderful ambitions, the more funds the merrier!

The Impact

Any funds will be helpful to this cause! Because the Purple Angel Foundation is a non-profit with all sorts of wonderful ambitions, the less that comes out of the coffers for a mural, the more money can be spent on other great projects that the Purple Angel Foundation is supporting, such as:

    • Little Free Libraries around Rutland City
    • Purple Benches back in Depot Park and in other areas of the city
    • Golf scholarship for college bound senior
    • Citizenship award to a senior, nominated by teachers at Rutland High School
    • Rutland Free Library annual fundraiser by a sponsorship
    • Mural to be painted on the side of the Discount Food Store in Rutland 
  • Public Art is such a great tool to build and brighten community in places that need it most, and I am so grateful and humbled every time I am asked to paint a wall in VT. If I can make it easier, financially, for a non-profit (short of working for free), I will do what I can!
  • "Be Kinder than Necessary" is the slogan for The Purple Angel Foundation, and it is a good mantra to keep in mind. Be kind (in any way, not just by donating...) and keep Carly's positive energy flowing in VT!

Risks & Challenges

  • As with any long-distance run, there are physical and mental challenges to overcome. I am working through a few physical challenges right now, but my goal is to complete the Tarathon, be it at a 8:30 min/mile pace, or a 20:00 min/mile hobble! (don't worry, it will be scenic:

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't contribute, or don't feel compelled to, please take a moment to think about the Purple Angel Foundation's main message: Be Kinder Than Necessary. If you can act on this idea in any way, please do it! The kindness will spread and eventually come right back to you. :)

story:
What is Front Porch? What is Potluck?

Front Porch Arts Collective provides a home for creating and experiencing multi-disciplinary art inspired by the voices of the Southeast.

In December 2013, Front Porch staff asked one another, what would it take to make Greenville, SC a center for the arts? And not just any kind of arts, but multi-disciplinary, community-based, collaboratively-created art? The kind of art that is innovative, local, and of the highest quality possible? 

Our short answer is Potluck. Here's what to look forward to:

  • Wednesday, August 6 @ 6pm: Kickoff Party

    A family friendly night of live music, visual art, and fellowship. Come hear the electronic R&B of Rich Engli$h and the sweet feisty soul folk of Rachel Kate, surrounded by photographs of the West Greenville community curated by David Bram of Fraction Magazine. Food and drink provided with ticket cost.

  • Thursday, August 7 @ 7pm: Porch Light Playwrights

    An ensemble of Greenville actors present staged readings penned by Upstate playwrights Travis Ballenger, Breanna Foister, Bryson Howard, Cortney McEniry, Jacob Perkins, and Abby Rosebrock at the historic Taylors Mill-turned-artisan-coffee-shop. Share your thoughts with the playwrights over coffee and dessert after the presentations.

  • Friday, August 8 @ 7pm: The Mill Project

    An evening of old stories and new performances. South Carolina musicians Daniel Machado of the acclaimed band The Restoration, Alexa Woodward, and Mel Washington team up with Front Porch to present a brand new multidisciplinary work combining Greenville’s mill village history with original music, film, and live choreography.

  • Saturday, August 9 @ 6pm: Open House

    Join your neighbors and Front Porch for a night of creativity, collaboration, and community. Attendees will connect with local artists, make art onsite, and dream alongside Front Porch as we cast vision for the years to come. Bring your art, bring your heart.

Help us make it happen. 

We need your support to get Potluck off the ground. Your contribution will also raise our chances of securing institutional funding. Greenville’s Metropolitan Arts Council believes in Front Porch: if we raise $6,000, they will award us a $3,000 grant to support Potluck!

Here's how your gift will be used:


    Other Ways You Can Help

    We want to see you and yours at Potluck! In the meantime, here are some other ways you can help bring this festival to life: 

    • Share this campaign on your social media
    • Like us, follow us, get on our email list.
    • Are you an artist in or around Greenville? Let us know! 
    • We're also grateful for non-monetary donations: food, beverages, space, materials. Feel free to get in touch.
    • Check out www.frontporchartscollective.com for all things Front Porch.
    • Tell your family, friends, neighbors, and coworkers about Potluck.

    Do It For Greenville. 

    Potluck and its audiences will re-invest an estimated $25,000 back into Greenville’s economy. Thank you for your support, and we can't wait to see you in August. 


    Front Porch Arts Collective is a sponsored project on Fractured Atlas, a non-profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of Front Porch Arts Collective are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

story:
In the early 1900's, Big Timber was the largest wool producer in the nation.  I am trying to preserve this history in a mural on McLeod street.  The money raised in this campaign will fund the completion of this historical mural. 

You can be an important part in helping to pass on the history of our town to future generations.  Press the "Contribute Now" button to make your contribution. If you don't see a Perk you like, you are welcome to enter any amount starting at $1 without selecting a Perk.

Thank you!

Suz

story:
My dears,


My name is Cristina Tamas (google "cristina tamas art", please, on img.) and I am a passionate artist from a “corner” of this world. I followed Art High-School and the Academy of Fine Arts in Cluj-Napoca, Transylvania, Romania. I also learned computer graphics. After graduation I slowly gave up painting. For about 10 years I made computer graphics and advertising. But life and responsibilities begun to take their toll. And, as a form of relaxation, I slowly begun to start painting and drawing again. For me it was JOY, THERAPY, FRESH AIR…HAPPINESS. I was painting for my soul and also was giving my conclusions, thoughts, ideas and frustrations a shape... All that was happening was motivating me, but I still had some doubts if this is my calling. Until I was stopped! Immobilized for 3 months, I painted, painted and painted again. I posted everything on-line and I just realize that what I paint inspires others: to paint, to make poems, to transform everything in sounds and feelings. I then knew this was my way. I had been a traveler, but returned to my `home`.

So: I am offering you my home, the house our family built with our own hands,. It's walls are imprinted with wishes come true. There, I started to see with my open mind something which is not a dream, it's an atmosphere felt in my heart from over one year already. Now is the time for it to see the light!

The place where my heart is, calls others to start feeling, practicing, learning, sharing, experimenting ART at any level we wish. I will be the host, a mediator between us and ourselves. It will be a place where anyone can rediscover himself, telling others how great it is to create something, despite it’s `size`.

I am deeply convinced that THE HOUSE is needed because I recall the times when I was a stressed businesswoman, busy and worried about a lot of things and feeling that I was slowly losing myself. My refugee and sanity were the moments when I “stole” time (late at nights usually) to paint and draw... Everywhere around me, now, I see stressed people, feeling the same burning desire....

 

Here is my proposition:

A WEEK away from the usual routine, stress and daily responsibilities, connected with other creative souls. A WEEK to thrive in a place suited for meet, connect, share, create, practice art, unleash creativity, free the spirit.

Included:

  1. Accommodation and restaurant in the hotel just nearby THE HOUSE (approx. 40 meters)

  2. Full day (from 9 to 18 with a break of 1 hr to eat at the restaurant) to release your creativity at (RE)CREATIVE – THE HOUSE OF (HE)ART

  3. All the materials needed, space and all means for drawing, painting, modeling, digital drawing and painting and much more, indoor or outdoor (garden gazebo)

  4. Connection on-line to share with your loved ones the FEELING, live web-cam to share the pulse

  5. Buffet (coffee, tea, snacks etc. included)

  6. The hotel has: sauna, fitness centre, solarium, spa and wellness centre, children's playground, table tennis, darts, hot tub, BBQ facilities, indoor heated pool, (as requested)

  7. I (as a host) have the ability to see the skills, to guide, to listen, to show. I will be there all day, happy to create and share all I know with you (draw&paint traditionally or digitally, modelling, making music, discuss themes, knitting, etc.)

  8. The artworks made in THE HOUSE will be transformed in memories on the walls of the creators. Just to remember the freedom, the value, the experience and the treasure they've learned to find in themselves during the sejour on THE HOUSE

  9. Annual vernisage with artworks that the creators kindly wants to leave in THE HOUSE

 

My goal is to have 2 sejours/month with limited places (maximum 10 artlovers can join). To do this I need to raise at least 8 000 eur to create the optimum conditions and purchase all the needed art materials.

The major risk for me in this project is not getting funded. Why? Because the risk consists in the fact that the wonder of (RE)CREATIVE-HOUSE OF (HE)ART will be lost. I am starting a fight here for culture and spirituality and an oasis for the ones who need a break of daily stress and routine.

If you can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean you can’t help:
Please share this link to your friends and family on facebook, twitter, google+ or just to your email contacts who you think might be interested in THE HOUSE and ART.

 

You can choose the wallpapers from:
www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.462915943780142.1073741828.439894912748912&type=3
www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.464550273616709.1073741829.439894912748912&type=3

The prints from here:
www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.465232413548495.1073741830.439894912748912&type=3

The drawings from here:
www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.465244263547310.1073741831.439894912748912&type=3

The paintings from here:
www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.465363693535367.1073741832.439894912748912&type=3

 

All perks will be delivered shortly after the campaign is over.

For about 10 years I made computer graphics and advertising. But life and responsibilities begun to take their toll. And, as a form of relaxation, I slowly begun to start painting and drawing again. For me it was JOY, THERAPY, FRESH AIR…HAPPINESS. I was painting for my soul and also was giving my conclusions, thoughts, ideas and frustrations a shape... All that was happening was motivating me, but I still had some doubts if this is my calling. Until I was stopped! Immobilized for 3 months, I painted, painted and painted again. I posted everything on-line and I just realize that what I paint inspires others: to paint, to make poems, to transform everything in sounds and feelings. I then knew this was my way. I had been a traveler, but returned to my `home`.
So: I am offering you my home, the house our family built with our own hands,. It's walls are imprinted with wishes come true. There, I started to see with my open mind something which is not a dream, it's an atmosphere felt in my heart from over one year already. Now is the time for it to see the light!
The place where my heart is, calls others to start feeling, practicing, learning, sharing, experimenting ART at any level we wish. I will be the host, a mediator between us and ourselves. It will be a place where anyone can rediscover himself, telling others how great it is to create something, despite it’s `size`.
I am deeply convinced that THE HOUSE is needed because I recall the times when I was a stressed businesswoman, busy and worried about a lot of things and feeling that I was slowly losing myself. My refugee and sanity were the moments when I “stole” time (late at nights usually) to paint and draw... Everywhere around me, now, I see stressed people, feeling the same burning desire....
 
Here is my proposition:
A WEEK away from the usual routine, stress and daily responsibilities, connected with other creative souls. A WEEK to thrive in a place suited for meet, connect, share, create, practice art, unleash creativity, free the spirit.
Included:

Accommodation and restaurant in the hotel just nearby THE HOUSE (approx. 40 meters)

Full day (from 9 to 18 with a break of 1 hr to eat at the restaurant) to release your creativity at (RE)CREATIVE – THE HOUSE OF (HE)ART


All the materials needed, space and all means for drawing, painting, modeling, digital drawing and painting and much more, indoor or outdoor (garden gazebo)


Connection on-line to share with your loved ones the FEELING, live web-cam to share the pulse


Buffet (coffee, tea, snacks etc. included)


The hotel has: sauna, fitness centre, solarium, spa and wellness centre, children's playground, table tennis, darts, hot tub, BBQ facilities, indoor heated pool, (as requested)


I (as a host) have the ability to see the skills, to guide, to listen, to show. I will be there all day, happy to create and share all I know with you (draw&paint traditionally or digitally, modelling, making music, discuss themes, knitting, etc.)


The artworks made in THE HOUSE will be transformed in memories on the walls of the creators. Just to remember the freedom, the value, the experience and the treasure they've learned to find in themselves during the sejour on THE HOUSE

Annual vernisage with artworks that the creators kindly wants to leave in THE HOUSE
 
My goal is to have 2 sejours/month with limited places (maximum 10 artlovers can join). To do this I need to raise at least 8 000 eur to create the optimum conditions and purchase all the needed art materials.
The major risk for me in this project is not getting funded. Why? Because the risk consists in the fact that the wonder of (RE)CREATIVE-HOUSE OF (HE)ART will be lost. I am starting a fight here for culture and spirituality and an oasis for the ones who need a break of daily stress and routine.
If you can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean you can’t help:Please share this link to your friends and family on facebook, twitter, google+ or just to your email contacts who you think might be interested in THE HOUSE and ART.
 
You can choose the wallpapers from: www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.462915943780142.1073741828.439894912748912&type=3www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.464550273616709.1073741829.439894912748912&type=3The prints from here: www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.465232413548495.1073741830.439894912748912&type=3The drawings from here:www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.465244263547310.1073741831.439894912748912&type=3
The paintings from here:www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.465363693535367.1073741832.439894912748912&type=3
 
All perks will be delivered shortly after the campaign is over.

story:
Who are we?

HIMHERANDIT Productions is a non-profit art organization based in Aarhus, Denmark since 2009.

HIMHERANDIT Productions is led by the artists Noelia Mora Solvez and Andreas Constantinou whom to date have performed and exhibited their work nationally and internationally. Since working together in 2009 Noelia and Andreas have been specifically driven to create bold live art, physical theatre and performance installation productions in Denmark. Specifically focusing on contemporary and experimental work that pushes artistic boundaries and tries to further broaden artistic perspectives, communication and culture in Aarhus, Denmark.

About our project:

You are making: is a 6 week Live-Art Laboratory that takes place at Godsbanen in March-April 2014. The laboratory contains 5 brand new interactive live-art installations, 5 Public Forums, Workshops and a concluding Exhibition. The project includes guest artists: Mormor (Visual artist), Kitt Johnson (Performance artist), Jeppe Worning (Designer), Marie Gabrielle Rotie (Butoh/Live artists), Michel Dinesen (Film artist) and Allan Henriksen (Photographer)

About the 5 live-art interactive installations:

These 5 performances are the base of project as a whole. They are specifically related to the cross over of Interactive live-art and how visual art can become an immersive experience for audiences.  There is one simple objective that underpins all of the 5 installations; To interact with art instead of only observing it.

In the live-art installations Andreas and Noelia present situations where spectators encounter their naked bodies in different interactive contexts. The naked bodies display themselves in vulnerable and intimate situations where audiences can paint, cast, play, move, bath or even simply talk to them. By doing so, the work aims to create an environment of sensory-emotional values in which to play. The installations aim to guide people’s intuitive creative processes within a creative playground.

Guest Artists and how they are involved in the laboratory:

Each Performance will involve one renowned guest artist. All the guests come from different artistic backgrounds and will be involved in singular performances as creative leaders alongside the general public. Their roles with in the performances are to play freely in the playground set up for them by Andreas and Noelia.

Forums and LabRats:

As there will be 5 performances as part of the laboratory there will also be 5 artistic forums. The forums aim to create on-going dialogue between artist, cultural figures and the public about the development of Live-Art in Denmark. 

To achieve this we aim to recruit “Voluntary Participants” whom we will be named “Lab Rats”. The lab rats will be recruited from a diverse range of people, including: selected general public, artists from the surrounding community and Cultural leaders in Denmark.

Workshops:

Throughout the laboratory period there will be a series of performance and live-art workshops led by the artists.

Concluding Exhibition:

The concluding exhibition gathers photos, videos and recordings collected and edited by the artists in collaboration with Michael Dinesen and Allan Henriksen.  The exhibit will serve as the final installment of the laboratory offering spectators an outside perspective into the previous 5 weeks.

Why is this important?

Every art form needs time, space and audience development in order for it to reach its maximum potential. This 6 week laboratory grips the surrounding community, artists and cultural leaders by involving them in the development of the live-art scene through a hands on approach.

A live-art experience can be a life changing event for some people. It is for sure a life changing experience for the artists themselves.

The project is driven with an eagerness to display “vulnerabilities”. What happens when artists place themselves into exposing situations, handing themselves over to spectators? By doing exactly this, we desire to brake down barriers and invoke human contact on the most basic levels.  Bodies are presented in vulnerable contexts where audiences have the choices to fulfill their basic drives; to nurture, take care of, play with or even ignore them.

What we need to achieve this?

In order to achieve this project we have created a fundraising campaign that divides between public and private funds, sponsorship and crowdfunding. 20% of our budget is already secured through public funds and sponsorship. 

This is where we count on YOU TO HELP US GET UP AND RUNNING!

We would now like to raise 10% or more of this projects fund through crowd funding. In the meantime we will continue on our search to raise the rest of the funds through public and private funding.

Please note that every cent counts and with every little you support us this project takes one step further to be possible.

We want to do this project FOR and WITH YOU....

Where your money goes?

  • Art Materials (for 2 of the performance installations)
  • Technical equipment (hiring of equipment)

Any additional funds raised beyond our goal will go towards:

  • Art Materials (for the rest of the performances)

If we do not reach our goal you money will still go towards art materials (in a smaller scale).

I have no money! How can I help?

Spread the word! Let everyone know about this exciting 6 week laboratory coming your way! Get in contact with old buddies and let them know about this campaign. Mention it on Twitter or Facebook or wherever people hang out on the internet nowadays. Be a kind hearted person and distribute the word.

CONCLUSION:

If you are reading this it probably means that you have at some point seen one of our performances, interacted in a previous installation or even just heard about the project through word of mouth.

From this contact you likely have had a glimpse of what we can offer you and now we are expanding the possibilities through this project with your support AND CREATIVE PARTICIPATION!

story:
La procession des 67 drapeaux est une intervention artistique à grand déploiement que je réaliserai en mai 2015 à Montréal, impliquant 67 participants brandissant le même nombre de drapeaux reconfigurés, selon un itinéraire précis à travers la ville, jusqu’au sommet du Mont-Royal. Ce projet d'envergure est l'intervention performative la plus importante que j'aurai réalisée jusqu'à ce jour, et nécessite un budget de 10 000$, pour l’impression et la production des drapeaux reconfigurés en grand format. Si chaque personne qui lit ces lignes donne 5$, je réussirai à atteindre mon objectif!

La procession des 67 drapeaux est le point culminant du projet Reconfigurations, entamé en 2011 et développé à Dare-Dare, Centre de diffusion d'art multidisciplinaire de Montréal, avec la série d'interventions Nouveaux drapeaux pour vieux monuments[1], ainsi qu'à Viva Art Action! la même année avec la réalisation de la performance en espace public Déploiement en règle, sur le toit du bain St-Michel[2], reprise en 2013 dans le cadre de la semaine de la citoyenneté. Dans la série des Reconfigurations, je cherche à reformuler et à réactualiser le drapeau québécois, en altérant ses composantes formelles. Je propose de multiples déclinaisons du fleurdelisé, puisant mes références dans la culture populaire locale, la faune, la flore, l’histoire contemporaine et le folklore québécois. Je tente ainsi d’ouvrir de nouvelles pistes d’interprétation, en présentant des symboles non consensuels, pour repenser la portée des icônes trônant sur le drapeau, en résonance au lieu et à son terroir. 

Reconfigurations comprend une série de 67 nouveaux drapeaux, pour le nombre d'années écoulées depuis l'adoption du fleurdelisé par le gouvernement de Duplessis en 1948, jusqu'à l'achèvement de mon projet en mai 2015. La procession des 67 drapeaux vise à mettre ces nouvelles représentations en mouvement, en proposant une incursion dans l'espace public qui permet la prolifération émancipatrice des déclinaisons du drapeau renouvelé. 

Dans mon travail en dessin, vidéo, photographie, interventions urbaines et performance, j’examine comment l'individu réagit face aux contraintes physiques et sociales qui lui sont présentées. En tenant compte des règles implicites qui sont de mise dans toute aire sociale, je tente de reformuler l'espace potentiel que peut occuper une personne, un groupe, une entité. L'aire publique devient un terrain de jeu pour expérimenter avec les limites qui me sont données et permettre l'émergence de nouveaux espaces poétiques. Je tente d'impliquer le spectateur dans un monde qui est le sien mais qui est autre à la fois, un monde qu'il reconnaît mais qui le surprend, par la résurgence d'éléments intrus.

Depuis 2002, année d’obtention de ma maîtrise en arts visuels et médiatiques au Chelsea College of Art à Londres (Royaume-Uni), je poursuis différents projets en tant qu’artiste et commissaire, adoptant une approche multidisciplinaire et collaborative. J’ai présenté mon travail en Finlande, en Russie, au Danemark, en Colombie, en Grèce, en Autriche, au Pays de Galles, en Espagne, en France, en Équateur, au Royaume-Uni ainsi qu’au Québec et au Canada. En 2011 j’ai présenté une sélection des nouveaux drapeaux tiré de la série Reconfigurations à Dare-Dare, ainsi qu’au festival de performance Viva art action! et à la Maison des Arts de Laval, dans une exposition solo intitulée La peau du bronze. En 2013 on a pu voir mon travail vidéographique à Optica dans une exposition individuelle intitulée Mise en échec ainsi qu'au Studio XX dans le projet collectif Corrections marginales, où je présentais des œuvres issues des interventions urbaines avec les drapeaux reconfigurés. En 2014 j’ai exposé les Reconfigurations à la galerie RDV à Nantes (France) et j’ai effectué une résidence de création et de production pour compléter la maquette de l'ensemble du projet au Centre en art actuel Sagamie à Alma. Je suis l’une des membres fondatrices du collectif L’Araignée, collectif féministe de diffusion en art contemporain. Je vis et travaille à Montréal. 


[1] http://www.dare-dare.org/fr/evenements/noemi-mccomber

[2] http://vivamontreal.org/wp_2011/2011/10/noemie-mccomber-deploiement-en-regle/

http://centresagamie.blogspot.ca/2014/08/noemi-mccomber.html
http://noemi.mccomber.dare-dare.org

à la galerie RDV à Nantes (France) et j’ai effectué une résidence de création

suis l’une des membres fondatrices du collectif L’Araignée, collectif féministe
de diffusion en art contemporain. Je vis et travaille à Montréal. 



[1] http://www.dare-dare.org/fr/evenements/noemi-mccomber



[2] http://vivamontreal.org/wp_2011/2011/10/noemie-mccomber-deploiement-en-regle/


http://centresagamie.blogspot.ca/2014/08/noemi-mccomber.htmlhttp://noemi.mccomber.dare-dare.org

story:
AN UPDATE

Thank you everyone for your overwhelming support!  I still have 12 hours left to raise more money... here are some examples of the small sculptures you will get if you contribute $100 or more:

The Project
My name is Stephanie Jonsson, and I'm an artist and educator.  For this year, I'm an artist in residence at Medalta Potteries in Medicine Hat. I am really excited about my upcoming solo exhibition set for June 2015.  For this exhibition I intend to create a large scale installation growing from the ground and crawling up the gallery walls.  I am inviting you to support this project because it will give me an opportunity to share my latest creations and passion publicly.  I use both my heart and my hands to make these ocean-inspired creations, and I would be honoured if you would partner with me to take this exhibition public. 


What I Need & What You Get

I have launched a campaign for $7,500 to fund my exhibition and studio for the next five months.  The reward, should you choose to partner with me in this exhibition, is that you will be able to purchase a piece of the exhibition and you will have your piece displayed as part of the installation for June 18th through August 8th.  
  • $5 and up: Virtual High Five!
  • $35 and up: A small bowl or urchin (5" diameter)
  • $65 and up: A large bowl (8" - 10" diameter)
  • $100 and up: Your choice of:
                       - three small bowls or
                       - three urchins or 
                       - one small and one large bowl or  
                       - one small sculpture with ceramic and fabric
            • $500 and up: One large extruded piece
            • $1000 and up: A variety of colours of a large extruded piece
            Extra $10 if you want to ship to the US.
            If I don't reach my goal, I will spread the funds evenly across studio and material supplies.  I will limit the scope of the project and you will still get your perks!

            One of the urchin rewards:

            Another one of the urchin rewards:

            Some of the small bowls and larger bowl rewards:

            A detail of those rewards:

            The Impact

            Canada's cultural community will benefit from this exhibition, and locally it will contribute to the art scene in Alberta.  By partnering with me for this exhibition, you are supporting an emerging artist and helping me to put out the best work possible.

            Other Ways You Can Help

            Get the word on out Twitter, Facebook, and any other social networks you can by using the Indiegogo share tools!  Tell your family and friends about the project!

story:
Art in the service of science; science in the service of art! 

And there's also a Huge Freakin' Laser. 

The BM2012 HFL RNG experiment will measure the impact of MINDs on MATTER by showing deviations from the mean output of random number generators.  We'll also use a huge freakin' laser to show deviations from the mean. The laser will shift more to green when the numbers shift away from the mean, and more to red when the numbers remain around the mean. 

This is a collaboration led by Cassi Vieten and Dean Radin at IONS (Institute of Noetic Sciences), the non-profit frontier science outfit featured in Dan Brown's last novel, The Lost Symbol. Tam Hunt, at UC Santa Barbara and Aramis Productions is a co-lead. Arno DeLorme, also at IONS is assisting greatly. Roger Nelson, with the Global Consciousness Project, is part of our awesome team, as is Claudia Welss with the Global Coherence Initiative. Maurizio Benazzo, organizer of the bi-annual Science and Non-Duality (SAND) conference, is also part of our team. Last but not least, David Shearer, PhD, board member of Black Rock Solar, is also assisting. 

Our goal is to combine art and science in a way that will educate, amuse and lead to rigorous science. 

Many past experiments have shown an impact of mass celebrations on the output of random number generators: http://noosphere.princeton.edu/. 

Based on this history, we expect the mass revelry at Burning Man, particularly during the burning of the Man and the Temple, to result in deviations from the mean output of the random number generators. RNGs are electronic devices that output a stream of ones and zeros randomly. Over time, the ones and zeros balance out exactly. But not apparently during mass celebrations, for some unknown reason. 

We anticipate a more significant impact on the RNG output from the mass Burning Man celebrations because the people who attend Burning Man are more spiritually attuned and/or attentive to synchronicities than the population at large. Our experiment will test this hypothesis. 

We're seeking $2,000 in additional funding, to pay for computers, RNGs, lasers, etc., with $500 already pledged by the Global Coherence Initiative. 

The better we do at fundraising the HUGER our freakin' lasers can be! So help us out. Any funds not used this year will go into a revolving fund for future iterations in future years of the Burn.
story_txt:
Art in the service of science; science in the service of art! 
And there's also a Huge Freakin' Laser. 
The BM2012 HFL RNG experiment will measure the impact of MINDs on MATTER by showing deviations from the mean output of random number generators.  We'll also use a huge freakin' laser to show deviations from the mean. The laser will shift more to green when the numbers shift away from the mean, and more to red when the numbers remain around the mean. 
This is a collaboration led by Cassi Vieten and Dean Radin at IONS (Institute of Noetic Sciences), the non-profit frontier science outfit featured in Dan Brown's last novel, The Lost Symbol. Tam Hunt, at UC Santa Barbara and Aramis Productions is a co-lead. Arno DeLorme, also at IONS is assisting greatly. Roger Nelson, with the Global Consciousness Project, is part of our awesome team, as is Claudia Welss with the Global Coherence Initiative. story:
What Is DEFAULT?

DEFAULT is a biennial project which fosters the knowledge and know-how that art and cultural practices can contribute to urban and social regeneration. It focuses on the Masterclass in residence which opens a discussion opportunity for artists, curators, cultural producers, and transnational partners.

The project was born in 2011 at a time when art workers, policy makers and cultural managers have been confronted with mass funding cuts in the public sector. As art communities face the disappearance of cultural regeneration projects, DEFAULT proposes to face the uncertain future of such projects that guarantee the revitalisation of abandoned public spaces and neighborhoods.

It is platform to share ideas and experiences between artists and professionals addressing the role that contemporary art plays in everyday life, not only within elitist segments of society. The Masterclass attempts to boost diversity through project proposals on turban regeneration topics in any form of visual, performing or new media art.

 

 

The new edition, DEFAULT 13, is a collaborative project between European and Asian cultural institutions, focusing on the promotion of knowledge exchange concerning curatorial and artistic practices between the two continents.

Little is known about the flourishing Asian contemporary art scene in Europe where artistic and cultural practices are focused primarily on Western models. Through debates on cultural and artistic production DEFAULT 13 wants to build a bridge between Southern Italy and Asia in order to empower the network of the involved participants as well as broaden the scope and context in which people create public art in urban contexts.

The final aim is to enhance the general knowledge about the respective artistic contexts in order to develop and nurture new collaborations between artists and art professionals coming from Europe and Asia.

What Do We Do? What Are The Results?

For ten days, eighteen creatives and artists (9 from Asia and 9 from Europe), selected through an international open call, will be given the opportunity to be hosted in the town of Lecce (Southern Italy) to discuss the question “What is next in art, cities and regeneration?”

The selected artists will address key topics concerning the role of public art on the regeneration process and its implications on the social/urban context with invited guest curators, artists, cultural producers, transnational partners and local stakeholders.

The participants have been asked to submit a creative/artist proposal addressing the key question: “What is next in art, cities and regeneration?”. The best revised project proposals will be produced after the conclusion of the Masterclass.

During the Masterclass, the artists will visit different spaces in the area of Lecce. They will meet and listen to local communities, international leading curators, international artists, art managers and representatives of cultural and artistic organisations from both Europe and Asia. They will be attending intensive workshops and seminar sessions and develop their proposal and research approach in the public context. The ten days of didactic lectures will be supplemented with complementary activities (e.g. panels and exhibitions) open to the general public with the aim to build public consciousness on the above-mentioned topics.

The works will principally take places at Manifatture Knos.

 

Why Do We Need Your Help?

Your donation will make our goals attainable. You will help us to:

  • contribute to the artists’ flights, fostering international mobility and open a dialogue and exchange between Asia and Europe;
  •  offer training to enhance professional development and collaboration opportunities;
  •  create a think-tank exploring concretely the social and cultural role of art and the artist’s work in everyday life;
  • develop transcultural projects which focus on the debate of urban regeneration and artistic practice;
  •  increase awareness of the general audience on the role of contemporary public art in urban regeneration and on both Asian and European social and cultural backgrounds.

 

Artists and experts participating in DEFAULT 13 will find different stimula that will ultimately impact the art communities they belong to as well as those they connect with in the future. 

These will be addressed through new collaborations and career development opportunities, broadening of individual social networks, enhancement of skills for working with others and communicating ideas, creation and production of new artistic collaborative or personal projects, exposure to alternative art and social scenes, opportunities for research, social engagement and intervention with other professionals, and lastly opportunities to improve skills and creative abilities.

Local communities will be involved during the open events in attempt to increase the participation of the general public in the arts social process. Citizens’ participation will be fostered through active involvement and by providing free access to collateral activities as well as the final artistic exhibition.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Tell folks you know about the campaign and the project, spread the word!

Please like our Facebook page, follow our Tweets...

  • Post our campaign link to your Facebook, Twitter or other social media networks
  • We foster creativity and creative support: we welcome free donations on http://ramdom.net/en/support-us/ 

 

 

Thank You For Helping Art to Regenerate Cities!

 

 

About Us            

 Ramdom is an association working on cultural and artistic design and production, on international mobility and on research and development of new communication languages.

Ramdom aims to promote and diffuse creative and innovative practices in the field of culture and art interacting with citizens and, private and public, national and international, organizations.

 

DEFAULT 13 is organised in collaboration with Arthub Asia (Shanghai, China), Gasworks (UK), Rogue Art Asia (Malaysia), Made in Carcere (Italy), Manifatture Knos (Italy), Cultura21 (Denmark), the School of Critical Engagement (Denmark), PB43 (Denmark), Vessel (Italy), the Region of Apulia (Italy), the Municipality of Lecce (Italy).Media partner: ComunicaMente

DEFAULT 13 project is approved and supported by the program Creative Encounters: Cultural Partnerships between Asia and Europe, promoted by the Asia-Europe Foundation (ASEF) and Arts Network Asia (ANA), in collaboration with Trans Europe Halles (TEH).

The project supports the candidature of “Lecce Capital of Culture 2019" .

 

More information at our webpage www.ramdom.net

Or just contact us at info@ramdom.net  or  +39 320 7061409

story:
Our Story

32° East | Ugandan Arts Trust is a centre for contemporary visual arts in Uganda. 

We recognise there is remarkable untapped and unfostered potential in the Ugandan arts scene. Based in the capital Kampala, the Trust will provide artists with studio and exhibition space, local and international workshops, residencies and artist-led outreach projects.

 

The Impact

We aim to:
  • Provide artists with an exciting and creative working environment
  • Create an exhibition space to encourage experimental practice
  • Attract local and international arts audiences to Uganda
  • Provide an innovative and essential education programme
  • Facilitate international artistic exchanges
  • Promote freedom of artistic expression

 

What We Need 

We need to raise just $6000 to buy and modify a container to house our Art Library

We are waiting to ship thousands of art and design books, publications and dvd's kindly donated by The British Council and shipped for free by Salabed International....all we need is a container to put them in!

What You Get

Donate to us and become part of a groundbreaking organisation that will:

  • Raise the profile of Ugandan art
  • Encourage art for social change
  • Be part of a new movement for East African art

 Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our campaign with your friends and on Facebook. We really appreciate your help in any way possible. Thanks!

story:
Dreaming of a world where women’s bodies are respected and loved…?  
 
Me, too!  Help shift the paradigm! 
 
The Beautiful Cervix Project teaches cervical self-exam and fertility awareness as a revolutionary path of promoting respect, confidence, and health.  We believe that this form of self-empowerment and education will help contradict shame and misinformation around women’s reproductive health and choices, affecting positive change from the personal to global levels. 
 
The Beautiful Cervix Project will be representing Vaginal Love and Cervical Self Exam at the world's largest festival of progressive experiential art and community -- Burning Man 2012.  This year, the theme of the entire weeklong festival is FERTILTY!  A perfect opportunity to join two of the things I am most passionate about: Art and Women's Empowerment!  Help me creatively reach 50,000 open-minded people, so they can take information and inspiration back to their communities.  
 
Our wombs are our creative epicenters – literally and energetically.  Here’s my womb-soul’s creative vision yearning to be born into the world.
 
Funding raised will help buy supplies for, create, and transport the following to Burning Man 2012 (August 27-Sept 3rd):
 
Super Shero Performance Art - Design and sew a Vagina and Cervix Super Shero Costume.  This alter ego of mine wants to speak, sing, and dance sponaneous performance art in the name of celebrating and loving our bodies exactly as they are!  This is an offering of celebration and healing for all who witness.
 
Gift 100 Self-Exam Kits - Each includes a reusable plastic speculum, sample of organic lubricant, hand mirror, small flashlight with batteries, and "How to View your Cervix" instruction sheet.  I will offer personalized guidance to women who want to see their cervix right away, and also gift the kits to those who want to do self-exam later in private.
 
The Cervix Mobile - Buy and decorate a kids' bicycle trailer and equip it with a battery powered microphone and speaker system to educate passersby about the wonders of the cervix and women's anatomy.  This would be stocked with the self-exam kits, diaper wipes, and hand sanitizer for women who are inspired to view thier cervix immediately in thier camps.  I'll offer oil pastels and paper for those who want to draw a Cervical Self-portrait.
 
Large Laminated Cervix Photo Book - Print, bind, and laminate 32 large photos of a cervix throughout an entire menstrual cycle.  Use as a teaching aide and as interactive art.
 
Fun Facts in the Porta Potties - Amazing tidbits about our bodies taped to the inside of the numerous porta potties at Burningman so visiting the loo can be educational, too!
 
The best part….once all this is created, the Super Shero costume and leftoever supplies can & will be re-used in parades, at health fairs, in workshops, etc….
 
Help Fund an Empowerment Ripple Effect!  If you don't have any funds to spare, please share this with other like-minded people or just send me your support!
 
Thank you, fellow visionaries,
O'Nell

story:
If there was anything you would ever want to give me for my birthday, wouldn't you want it to be something that would last forever?  Well, a tattoo is something that I could always think of YOU every time I looked at it!


Tattoos as you may or may not know, depending on what you want to get done can be a bit pricey...but very much worth it.  Though I do not know the exact cost of what I want done, I do know that it will get into the several hundreds category, especially since I want a little color incorporated this time.  This is why I am asking you, my friends to help out if you are able to.  You will be a part of my 33rd (ugh!) birthday present that will last forever!  Though my goal is $500.00, whatever I end up obtaining out of the kindness of your hearts will ALL go towards my tattoo!


So why do I want to put more ink on my body?  Simply put, I like it.  I feel it is an expression of part of who I am artistically, and I fully support the art of tattooing and body modification.
