story:
My mission is to help others find peace, joy and confidence through flow arts, to connect them with their inner self through play and movement, and to give others the amazing gifts that this art has given to me.

With your help I hope to bring the art of spinning fire to Israel and Africa. I intend to stay with the people in the communities I'm teaching in.  This approach allows me to get closer to the culture which I hope will help the art of flow take hold as well as present ways for me to get involved locally.

Your contributions will go directly to a travel fund. The money donated will be used for the expenses involved in flying between countries, transporting my tools between locations, and any unexpected room & board fees. During this journey I intend to keep a verbal and visual diary which I will share with you through periodic updates so you can see the affect your donation has. Your assistance will help me build community, create solutions, and spread the flow.

Other Ways You Can Help

Travel Advice and Connections

Volunteer at Holiday REMIXER in Seattle January 19th

https://www.facebook.com/events/560274880655731...

Volunteer at Imbibe at the Hive in Atlanta Georgia March 9th

https://www.facebook.com/events/439048826156853...

story:
Our Story

Originating in New Orleans, White Linen Night started as a way for local businesses to connect with the community and each other. After Hurricane Katrina devastated New Orleans, several business owners and artists came to the Houston area and set up shops in the Heights. White Linen Night in the Heights founders and local business owners saw an opportunity to bring that same sense of community and entrepreneurship to the Heights to showcase the best the Heights has to offer - wonderful homes, great shops, restaurants, bars, coffee shops, service businesses, hike & bike trails and the general ambiance that has made the Heights one of the most sought after areas to live in Houston. WLNH proceeds benefit the art programming for Houston Art & Culture, a 501(c)3 nonprofit corporation. Their mission is to create & support artistic inspiration in our community through scholarships and mentoring.


The Impact

This year White Linen Night in the Heights has teamed up with Fresh Arts Coalition and Fitzgerald's in a collaborative effort to connect Houston performing and visual artists to the 30,000+ projected attendees of this annual event. Fresh Arts Coalition is a 501(c)3 non-profit collective of the most original and thought-provoking arts groups in Houston - the distinctive organizations that make the city’s arts scene one of the most dynamic in the country. 


What We Need & What You Get

Help us reach our goal of $3000 to support the artists’ fees and production needs to allow us to showcase the arts organizations and local artists that make Houston and the Heights special as well as one of the most appealing places for Artists to live and create. All donations are tax deductible to the full extent of the law.


Other Ways You Can Help

Tell your friends what White Linen Night in the Heights, Houston Art & Culture, Fresh Arts Coalition and Fitzgerald's are up to! Spread the word for #houarts on Twitter and Facebook, and come join us for a day jam packed with Houston arts, music, performances, food and libations!

story:
Kara and Kristen Move to Portland

Kara:
I have lived in Pensacola, FL all of my life. I am a lover of animals, tea, health food, and meditation.  I feel that I need a change of scenery to free my spirit.

Kristen:
Kristen has been living on her own since she was 16!  Since then she has lived in many places.  Kristen loves poetry, cats, and social justice. She occasionally feels the need to move to a new city to stay inspired for her artwork.

Obviously, you are not obligated to help us move to Portland.  We are simply looking for some good Samaritans that might help us pave the way to our new life.

We truly feel that if we achieve our goal, we will flourish in a city where we can become the people we wish to be.

What We Need & What You Get

Where the money is going:

First month of rent
Security deposit
Bicycles
Food for 1 month
Emergency Fund
Public transportation for 1 month

If we don't achieve the entire goal, the money is going to all the same places, we will just take a little extra time to save up the remaining bit and head out.

Le Perks

Any Donation at all
Many well wishes and mentally sending good vibes and karma to you.

$10
We will sing your name.

$50
We will send you a postcard from Portland with something sappy on the back.

$500
We will pass out... when we come to we will send you a rose (as we will now live in the city of roses) and a postcard.

The Impact

1.) sending and receiving

I have learned in my life that it is important to be empathetic and compassionate, but it is also important to be open and receive the empathy and compassion that others give.  I feel that this is an opportunity to try out being on the receiving end of the ripple of good karma.

2.) We will pay it forward.

We are talking about two girls that are full of love and happiness.  We once were asked to be photographed as model representing pain but we just couldn't stop smiling long enough!  We like to give to the world in any way we can and we will certainly be giving these good vibes out again.

Help bring two good vibe generators to a cloudy city! ;)

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help monetarily, that's totlly fine!  Hey, we're broke too! ;)
You can always help by simply sharing the page and helping us spread the word about our campaign

story:
SuaveArt.com

This is Africa's newest print art website. We intend to sell original art and print art to art lovers in Kenya, and all over the world.

Who we are

We are passionate about art and want to sell art prints across Kenya.

What We Need 

We need

  • Funds to buy an Art Printer i.e. HP Design jet Z3200 44" Photo Printer, which costs about $6,000.

Update!

We have got an offer for a Canon iPF8000S Color Wide Format Printer, for $3,500!

What You Get

  • For every donation, you get an Art Print!
  • Additional funds will be used to buy canvas and art paper, archival inks, frames, do deliveries, email and web marketing and advertising.

We have committed 5% of total funds raised in this campaign to Charity towards Little Faces Schools Project in Mombasa, Kenya, for sponsorship of kindergarten children.  


First $50 Perk!
Akinyi - African Lady. Acrylic on Canvas. (Currently in progress) .  Original art for only $50 to the first buyer!! Consequent buyers will get signed print of the same piece.
Second Perk

Third Perk


Fourth Perk!


The Impact

We envision promotion of Kenyan Art to the world. We also want to sell classics and other art from the world over to Kenyans!

  • This project will change & brighten the homes of people in Kenya
  • Income for Kenyan Artists!
  • I have already built the website
  • I need to make it functional. Alone i cannot do it. Together we can.

story_txt:
SuaveArt.com This is Africa's newest print art website. We intend to sell original art and print art to art lovers in Kenya, and all over the world.
Who we are
We are passionate about art and want to sell art prints across Kenya.



What We Need  We need 
Funds to buy an Art Printer i.e. HP Design jet Z3200 44" Photo Printer, which costs about $6,000.


Update!
We have got an offer for a Canon iPF8000S Color Wide Format Printer, for $3,500!


What You Get


For every donation, you get an Art Print! Additional funds will be used to buy canvas and art paper, archival inks, frames, do deliveries, email and web marketing and advertising. 
We have committed 5% of total funds raised in this campaign to Charity towards Little Faces Schools Project in Mombasa, Kenya, for sponsorship of kindergarten children.  


First $50 Perk!Akinyi - African Lady. Acrylic on Canvas. (Currently in progress) .  Original art for only $50 to the first buyer!! Consequent buyers will get signed print of the same piece.

Second Perk


Third Perk





Fourth Perk!





The Impact

 We envision promotion of Kenyan Art to the world. We also want to sell classics and other art from the world over to Kenyans! 
This project will change & brighten the homes of people in Kenya
Income for Kenyan Artists! I have already built the website I need to make it functional. Alone i cannot do it. Together we can.

  If you LOVE Art, kindly support us!

story:
SYNOPSIS: 

The Supreme Ultimate is a large-scale installation by Tom Woodall (aka Rock), bound to live out its lifespan at Burning Man*. This colossal Yin-Yang symbol will rise from the Playa**, solemnly inviting all to slow down, zoom out, and attune to the ineffable magnitude of present reality and its perpetual state of flux. Then at break of dawn on Saturday, a spark will ignite, bloom into destructive flames, and consume the monument, ultimately instantiating the completion of a full cycle of ebb and flow. 

PHILOSOPHY:

In Taoism, Yin and Yang symbolize the duality of the essence from which arises everything as we know it – light/dark, masculine/feminine, sun/moon, good/evil, active/passive… Yin is the side of the valley in umbra, Yang is the illuminated side of the valley. The Yin-Yang symbol represents the balanced unison of complimentary aspects of everything in the universe. It is an all-encompassing holistic dyad: one cannot exist without the other, nothing is ever unilateral - a positive manifests in contrast to a negative. The seed of the one is found in the other - thus the juxtaposition of dots in each component. Like tides and Sun, the Yin and Yang within us are in a constant interplay of rising and setting. It is all one grand, ever-changing, perpetual cycle. All will change in due time.

DESIGN:

Deliberately minimalist stylistically, this monolithic installation appeals to potent primordial undercurrents of human spirit. Not flashy or ornate (there will be a plethora of that at the event) - only rudimentary colors; rays of rising and setting Sun diffusing through carved patterns; and a grounding, fluid, ambient lighting outline. Thresholds of paramount significance need not be complicated. 

INTERACTIVITY:

Deviating from the commonplace notion of interactivity, The Supreme Ultimate ventures beyond physical, material and tactile functions to evoke within us the visceral and ineffable, to help us connect to our outward environment and inner core with profundity and equanimity often lost in the dust amidst all the hustle and bustle. A serene oasis where the serendipity of the Playa manifests itself in ways unique to each individual, this installation is a fulcrum between questions and answers. Intuit, establish and embrace your wholesome equilibrium in its vicinity.

ODE TO PATRONS:

And now you have the opportunity to help make The Supreme Ultimate a beneficial gift for all to partake! Deepest gratitude to those of you who stepped up and showed support for this project in the original campaign. Setbacks happen, so we're trying again! Please take this opportunity to contribute and know that you have helped deliver meaningful and healing art to enhance the Playa experience of upwards of 60 thousand people! Any help that you can give now will make my winter a little less cold and long.

GOODIES! 

So, what do you get if you contribute? Many wonderful thank-you gifts await in the "Perks" section - from original works of art by yours truly, to stickers, pendants and T-shirts. Enjoy with pride!

BUDGET: 

The Supreme Ultimate will be built, transported and burned for ~$3,800:

  • Lumber for framing = $250
  • Plywood sheeting = $640
  • Tools, Materials & Supplies = $570
  • Lighting & Electrical = $660
  • Mandatory Burn Supplies (decomposed granite, cord wood & fuel) = $870
  • Transportation (truck rental, insurance & fuel) = $900
Total = $3,890

I intend to haul the piece to Nevada (600 miles one way) in an old trailer of mine. Surely, several unpredictable expenses are bound to surface last minute. I will shoulder all that is not covered by this campaign.

CONSTRUCTION:

The purchase of materials and supplies has begun, and the construction is about 85% complete (photos under "Gallery"). The frame and outer skin has been assembled and painted. Remaining are the installation of wiring and lighting, and paint detailing. More exciting news? - We are going solar for charging the batteries to run the electrical components!

ONSITE: 

We depart for Black Rock City August 21 and will have it ready when the gates open on the 24th. We have much to do and just enough time to get it done. And with your help, we will get it done as one large team. The installation will go ablaze Saturday, August 30, at 6am. Please join the celebration!

Looking forward to meeting you on the Playa, and thank you for your engagement and generous patronage!

Namaste,

Rock


* Burning Man: an annual alternative art and culture festival held in Nevada in August.

** Playa: the dry lakebed where Black Rock City transiently flourishes.

story:
Why help us transform into a Clay Center?  Well if you love the arts,  love seeing beautiful handmade things, love pottery, love helping young artists succeed, love having master craftsmen in your midst, love giving kids who would never get a chance to make something beautiful, then we think the new District Clay Center could be worthy of your support.

We want to spread the joy of making something with your hands to the entire Washington community. From art lovers, to community students, underserved kids, master craftsmen (and women), young emerging artists, educators, and academics; we want to create a place where this wonderful medium can thrive and grow.  

We need to raise $10,000 to finance our build-out so that ceramic artists in DC have a place to take the next step. Furthermore, we want to create a nationally recognized gallery and also help fund our new Community Clay! program for underserved youth. You can see a specific list of how District Clay will benefit from your donations below and also some great rewards as a thank you for all your support. District Clay will make a one to one match for every dollar raised.  

We have gotten tremendous support from the ceramic community and especially from our own students and community artists at District Clay. They have already put in hundreds of free hours to help our build-out succeed. We have an incredibly committed volunteer base and we are confident that we will be able to raise the money we need to make the Center a financial success.  District Clay has developed a sound business plan that expects the Center will grow at a moderate pace in our new much larger (6,400 square foot) space.  

Here are the some of the specific things we need to finance:

- A second large electric kiln (18.5 cu ft) and a glaze test kiln.

- Four new wheels (including 2 Brent EXs).

- A Raku kiln.

- 6 large warecarts.

- Venting for our gas kiln (very $$$).

- A large Peter Pugger Clay Mixer/Pugger.

- Buildout for our new Gallery Space.

- Help with financing our Community Clay! program.

Please help us transform into something spectacular.  We have already had over 850 students come through District Clay's door over the past 2 1/2 years.

With your help and backing, we will give thousands of additional people from our community the opportunity to make making beautiful things with their own hands.  Please contribute now!

 

OUR REWARDS

story:
Yorick:

Yorick is a Calavera - is a playful rendering in wood of a Mexican sugar skull. 

The original Mexican sugar skulls have an element of ephemera - frequently created to recognize a passed loved one around the Dia de Muertos (Day of the Dead). Colorful, Evocative.  Created for a celebration and then discarded or eaten. 

This piece was created, designed, and built to reflect that ephemera.

Yorick consists of cut plywood in a basic geodesic dome shape, assembled with hinges, maximizing portability, minimizing assembly requirements. 

During the day, the Calavera looks cute but kinda plain:  a 10 ft tall, 10 ft diameter unpainted plywood skull with cut out flowers and a sporty mustache.  At night, though, the skull is lit up from inside.  Projection is used to paint the external surfaces with light.  The photo and video show the crazy colors and designs that can be attained through projection techniques. 

It is going to cost more than expected to get the Calavera to the Playa and burn it safely.  You have to meet certain guidelines before you can burn art at Burning Man.

Yorick is scheduled to burn on Friday night, Saturday morning at 1 am.  You are invited to attend the burning.

About the Calavera Collective:

It takes a village to burn an art piece.  The Collective is the group of people, mostly based in the Austin area, who will get Yorick to the Playa, set him up, light him up,  and burn him down. 

The artist is Prost, Lori Moore is the Project Lead, and Leslye Moore is the LNT lead.  Please join our Collective and help bring Yorick to the Playa.

We need your funding help to:

  • Get it there
  • Install the piece on the playa
  • Light it up at night
  • Project color onto the piece (look at the pictures)
  • Burn on the playa
  • Clean up after the burn

Where the money will go:

  • Gas to get it there.
  • Gas to run the generator to light it all up.
  • Decomposed Crushed Granite to act as blanket to protect the Playa (required by BMorg). 
  • Supplies for the burn team (vests, fire extinguishers, perimeter markers, walkies, first aid kits, etc)
  • Supplies for the cleanup crew - because WE SHALL NOT MOOP!
  • Inexpensive projection equipment:  the playa will eat up the good stuff, so we can't in good conscience borrow friends good stuff and bring it back totally trashed.
  • Perks for you.

Where the money will not go:

    • Burning Man Tickets:  we all have our tickets, this is not a way to get you to pay for them.
    • Our pockets - we are not trying to profit from this campaign.
    We totally understand fiscal limitations may not allow you to help us with money - your assistance in spreading the word is greatly appreciated!

story:
BarCamp 2 - the awesomeness continues!

For those of you who didn't attend last year's BarCamp, you may be asking yourself - what IS BarCamp?  Do I have to visit a tavern?  

Heavens no!  BarCamp is all about giving and getting ideas - one person holds a session on a topic they're passionate about, and others listen and participate. Then, someone else who attends talks about something else, and others listen and contribute.  That's what the event is - you share your idea, and your head is filled with new ones!  Like the photo above says - it's an idea swap meet for the info-curious.  Here's the Prezi for more information: http://prezi.com/5hd4nc6onijm/barcamp-fond-du-lac/#

We're all set to hold our 2nd annual event - now we need your help!

What We Need & What You Get

Unfortunately, everything costs money.  We've been SO lucky to have our venue donated thanks to Marian University, but we're still looking for donations for lunch/snacks/beverages for participants, which will run us about $600.  There are always incidentals (paper towels, utensils, napkins, cups, plates, etc.) that we also would need.  It may not sound like much, but we want everyone who wants to attend to be able to, regardless of ability to pay.  If we exceed our goal, we may be able to provide breakfast.

We have some fun perks for you if you donate at certain levels, but those are just guidelines.  You can donate ANY amount from $1 - $500 - we'll take it all!  :D 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that it's hard for some folks to donate monetarily.  But we'd love it if you spread the word about our campaign!  Share this page on all social media - we'll be so grateful for your help!  

Thanks so much to all of you for your support!

BarCamp Fond du Lac is a fiscally sponsored project of the School Factory, Inc. a 501(c)3 non-profit corporation.

story:
On November 8, 2013, the strongest wind ever recorded, Typhoon Haiyan, blew through the Philippines leaving over 5,000 dead and over 1 million homeless. 

In response to this disaster, The Peace Project designed a house that could be built in less than a day for about $500 in building materials and then we got busy. We engaged dozens of organizations and hundreds of individuals to provide funding and simultaneously went to work with the citizens of Tabunok, a community on Bantayan Island where over 65% of the homes were destroyed. The citizens of the community worked beside us every step of the way starting with a massive community clean-up, numerous planning sessions about what they'd like to see in their community, clearing the land and finally, working hand-in-hand to help us build (and paint!) the houses. On November 8, 2014, we completed the final house -- check out this awesome :30 video that chronicles the build, http://youtu.be/bf_5Tfgh-n4


The transformation of Tabunok from an overgrown lot filled with tents and broken dreams to a vibrant community of homes with a bright future continues with The Peace Center which will serve as the epicenter of this community’s transformation -- we'll expand the co-operative that we started, a weekly Farmer's market will take place selling (amongst other things) organic fruits and vegetables that are being grown in the community, vocational training will be brought in, the center will host arts and cultural programs, and micro-lending will begin -- all designed to turn a terrible tragedy into an enormous opportunity for abundance and prosperity.

Our work in Tabunok serves a purpose that will touch lives far outside of the Philippines, however.  Our goal is to refine this community building model and then apply it here in the United States as part of The Peace Project's most ambitious program yet, the Veterans Independence Project, an initiative to put 1,000 homeless Los Angeles Veterans in houses by July 4, 2017.

Your support is not only appreciated by us, it will help change the lives of people who, not so long ago, thought their lives might be over.  PLUS: it will give us much needed momentum to launch our Veterans program and give a hand up to those who gave so much and in many cases, got so little in return.

So lean forward, select a perk that has been lovingly created and generously donated by one of the many artists and organizations whose support has made it possible for us to change tens of thousands of lives in only four years, and join us on this incredible ride where through the power of the people, dedication, lots of work and a little magic, we continue to prove that:

"Through creativity and community, we can change the world."

$50 PERK:  "We Must Stop Believing the Problems are Too Big" Women's T


$50 PERK:  "We Must Stop Believing the Problems are Too Big" Men's T

$50 PERK:  Moon & Star Earrings

$50 PERK:  Inspire Print by Kaleo Sallas, 18" x 14"


$50 PERK:  Peace Necklace

$50 PERK:  Patti Meyer's 8" x 8" Heart Painting on Canvas

$75 PERK:  Sterling & Tanzanite Cluster Earrings

$100 PERK:  All the Love in the World by Jesse Hunter, 12" x 12" on Wood

$150 PERK:  Date Chocolate WeWood Watch


$150 PERK:  Photo from Adam Rose Photography, 20" x 16" with matte

$125 PERK:  Prismacolor Pencils

$500 PERK:  2 night stay at Lake Arrowhead Resort & Spa

story:
Hi my name is Cliff and what you see above is my current Artist Alley table display. It works and I am grateful for what I have, I just feel I can do better. In fact, I know I can. I'd like to have a booth that represents my art as well as I feel it should. 
I've thought about it for a while now, and i know how I would like my booth to look, but with kids at home and the expenses of running an art business, I just don't have the room in my budget to accomplish the booth setup I'd like to have. 
That's where you come in! With your help, we can build a really kick-ass display that will showcase more of my art in a much better format that fits with the look and feel of the artist alley booth styling. In return, you get some of my art (my heart and soul) and a lot of genuine gratitude. How awesome is that?!
Here's a breakdown of the booth components that I'd like to purchase with your help:
The basics:
  • Banner and stand 
  • Wire storage cubes
  • Print inventory 
  • Tablecloth
  • Binder clips
  •  LED lights
The Upgrade*

story_txt:
Hi my name is Cliff and what you see above is my current Artist Alley table display. It works and I am grateful for what I have, I just feel I can do better. In fact, I know I can. I'd like to have a booth that represents my art as well as I feel it should. I've thought about it for a while now, and i know how I would like my booth to look, but with kids at home and the expenses of running an art business, I just don't have the room in my budget to accomplish the booth setup I'd like to have. That's where you come in! With your help, we can build a really kick-ass display that will showcase more of my art in a much better format that fits with the look and feel of the artist alley booth styling. In return, you get some of my art (my heart and soul) and a lot of genuine gratitude. How awesome is that?!Here's a breakdown of the booth components that I'd like to purchase with your help:
The basics:


Banner and stand 
Wire storage cubes
Print inventory 
Tablecloth
Binder clips
 LED lights

The Upgrade*
Aspen 8ft Curved Pop Up Display  Full Fabric
* Should the campaign do well, I'd really like to upgrade from storage cubes and wire racking to a more robust display option
Should the campaign do extremely well, any additional funds will be used toward bettering my online presence and professional appeal for shows.

story:
About me:

Hello! If you do not know me already, my name is Shiela Diolosa and I am an artist residing in San Francisco, California. I attend the San Francisco Art Institute for my BFA in Painting and currently work at Exploratorium, the best interactive museum that combines both science and art practices. I also tutor children in Math and English at a local, low-income elementary school. I strive to make the best of each day and believe that staying positive is the best thing you can do for yourself. I love living here in the Bay Area and have met so many fun and amazing people. 

However, not every one means well. I have recently become the victim of a scam (from an "art dealer") and want to bring awareness to these issues. It is both devastating and emotionally draining and I would not wish for anyone else to be put in this situation. I was assigned to be a personal assistant and was given a check to cash, including the money for my "weekly salary." The job descriptions stated that I would be doing in-home purchasing and mailing to various art collectors on a warehouse level. Then I got a phone call saying that I needed to take some of the money and wire it because his "art materials seller" needed to make a last minute purchase and it was urgent. The bank had cleared the funds after two days so I thought everything was okay and I had been talking to this man for 3 weeks before anything was even sent. ALL BAD! Then, before I knew it, the bank had returned the check and it was too late for me to get anything back. 

I want myself and others to learn from mistakes like these and know that for every evil person out there, there are three times as many of those who are really genuine. 

The Impact:

I know this may be a longshot but I want to restore faith in the random act of human kindness. Maybe someone out there who is hurting in a similiar sense will see this know that everything will be okay. Getting scammed is embarassing and difficult to talk about but the first step is knowing that you are not alone. My hope is that someday there will be a relief fund and community for those who are in the same situation. The more we publicize, the closer we are to getting people aware and finding those committing the crimes. 

Let's work together!

My campaign is ONLY for the $2500 that was lost, nothing more. By helping out, I am giving the gift of my passions. Depending on the amount, you will get drawings, limited edition screen prints, watercolor paintings, and even a dinner made by me! This is a great opportunity to be able to bounce back from a heavy blow in a way that is creative and fun. Just know that I am forever thankful and by donating, you will leave away with a tangible piece of my gratitude.

Other Ways You Can Help:

Talk about it! Share my story. Raising awareness is always the first step.

story:
We are the 2013 Guelph Poetry Slam Team — Lisa B., Rafay, Truth Is ..., Meme, and David James Hudson. We were voted (via poetry slam — more on that in a minute) to represent Guelph, Ontario at the 2013 Canadian Festival of Spoken Word in Montreal in November.

We're a unique cluster of poets bound by a love of words and a profound urge to expose the systemic violence that shapes lives around the world, as well as the deep roots of connection, hope, and resilience through which we resist, form community, and care for one another. We bring a rich and versatile voice to the stage, combining frenetic rhythms, evocative stories, flavourful rhymes, and lush imagery. With over 40 years combined experience in spoken word, we are ready and willing  to move you.
 
Now we need your help to get to Montreal in November.

So what are you doing? What's a poetry slam?

Slam poetry is a form of competitive spoken word that originated in Chicago during the '80s. Random judges are chosen from the audience to score each poem from 1 to 10. Poets are given a three-minute time limit and a few general rules to cast their spell from the microphone (all original poems, no props, no costumes, no musical accompaniment, no assaulting low-scoring judges).

What We Need & What You Get

In order to make it to nationals, we have to pay for:

  • Registration
  • Travel from Guelph to Montreal and home again
  • Five days accommodation in Montreal
  • Food while we're there
We're raising money through performances, but we're also aiming for at least $1500 in donations on top of this. 
 
Besides our sincere appreciation, feel free to claim one of our perks along with your donation — have a peek at the list on the right!

The Impact

While attending CFSW, the team will be attending panels and workshops to improve as writers, performers, and community organizers. Members of the Guelph Poetry Slam Team already put in a lot of work to the community through teaching, workshopping, and community action.  Participating in CFSW will add fuel to our fire.

Other Ways You Can Help

Attend our local poetry slam in Guelph on the third saturday of every month at the eBar! Catch us at other shows, including SlamTario and the Hillside Festival in July, and the Eden Mills Writers' Festival in September!

Also, share this link on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, etc.: http://igg.me/at/GPS13toMontreal

Thank you!

Love & guts,

Lisa, Meme, David, Truth, and Rafay

MERCHANDISE LIST:

  • New Eyes On Old Messes poetry chapbook by Meme
  • Truth Is ...  CD by Truth Is ...
  • Salvaged Music CD by Lisa B.
  • FreeJason CD by Rafay (a.k.a. YBSFrack)
  • Skeleton Krew t-shirt or hat (Skeleton Krew is Rafay’s hip-hop crew: http://www.reverbnation.com/theskeletonkrew)

story:
Short Summary

My name is SzeYun Lo and I'm an Artist and Graphic Designer in Vancouver, BC and I have been studying art since the age of 11 and Art has been a part of my life ever since. I specialize in two traditional styles of art, one is Oriental watercolor and the other is carbon powder art. The style of Oriental watercolor painting I specialize in is called Lingnan, it's origins from china it was created as a fusion of art from the North and South of the Orient. Myself being a Canadian, a lot of my art today is a fusion of the East and West.

I am currently planning to hold my first solo art exhibition 'Release the Butterflies' open to the public, On July 13, 2013 in downtown Vancouver. I am doing so for a number of reasons. One, it is one of my life goals to hold my own art show, but more importantly I have decided to host my own exhibition due to the fact that I may be one of the youngest remaining Lingnan artists in the Greater Vancouver area. Although a lot of parents may put their children into art classes, a large percentage of them after graduating high school cease to continue the art due to the lack of time they have to devote to the art. During the years I must confess that even I have stopped once and a while, but I still practice time to time pushing the art style onto different mediums and even products. Over the last few years I've been exposing a lot of myself and my art onto social media to draw attention and peak interests to this dying art style. This art show will be a large milestone in my life, it will be my first official art show and it will be showcasing artwork I've done throughout my artistic life.

For more information about 'Release the Butterflies' and about me and my art history, you can visit: www.syloarts.com

 

What We Need & What You Get

I have already personally set aside funds to cover my events, venue, and location staff services, but it's not enough for everything. I am seeking help to raise $2500, minimum to help fund much need materials and supplies to make the art show happen.

It will be going to help pay for:

  • ($1200)  Materials for mounting and framing over 100 pieces of artwork.
  • ($1000)  Building supplies / the purchasing of frames and art easels.
  • ($100)    Supplies for art pieces still needed to be created for the show.
  • ($1500-2000) Venue rental.
  • ($150)    Shipping and costs for all deliveries necessary
  • (???)      IndieGoGo and Paypal Fees

 

The Perks

All perks given to contributors are going to be originals. I have not yet dove into the world of creating prints. So everything thing people receive from me are going to be one of a kind and hand made.

 

Depending on your pledge level, you'll receive...

  • Eternal Gratitude
  • One Original Doodle Postcard with much love from the artist
  • One Handmade Thank You Card
  • One Small Original Butterfly Painting, 4"x6" or 5"x7",  mounted, unframed
  • One Small Original Butterfly Painting, (4"x6" / 5"x7"), mounted and framed that will be on display at the day of the event
  • One Original Artwork - Doodle / Drawing - 4"x6", ink on paper, unframed. Artwork will be video time lapsed and placed onto YouTube.
  • One Original Doodle / Drawing artwork - 8.5”x11”, unframed, ink on paper, Video time lapsed and placed on youtube.
  • One Commissioned Artwork - 8”x11”, unframed, (medium and canvas can be discussed) ( video time lapse and placed on YouTube an option and digital copy can be provided).
  • One Commissioned Custom Artwork - 11" x 17", framed  (video time lapse placed on Yout an option) ( video time lapse and placed on YouTube an option and digital copy can be provided).
  • One Original Painting - (Estimated Size- 16"x24"), mounted, framed. ( Painting will be on display day of event )
  • Special Thanks Via YouTube, Twitter, and Facebook
  • Name / Company Name Listed on, Facebook event page, sponsor & support page on personal website.
  • Day of Event:
    • Name / Company logo printed on sponsor & support poster.
    • Name / Company logo shown on projector (scrolling throughout event)
    • Name / Company logo will be printed on Photography backdrop.

 

If we over-fund, the funds will go towards paying for such things as the venue rental, other materials and supplies or services needed to make the show happen. If there is more than enough, the funds will most likely be equally distributed to the foundations and charities that 'Release The Butterflies' has agreed to show support for. You can check out the foundations and charities that 'Release the Butterflies' is supporting, feel free to at the following link:
http://www.syloarts.com/in-support-of

If we under-fund, the show will go on.

 

The Impact

Many Canadians feel that it is difficult to hold on to our roots as we integrate and live in a multicultural society. I simply believe it is exposure. It is not because there is a lack of interest, but there is a lack of availability. Many times, there are certain barriers. Many older generations believe that the younger generations are losing touch and lack knowledge of their own heritage and cultural roots. Many today don't know how to speak, read, or write their mother tongue, even I cannot read or write Chinese very well, because of the fact that I've been - how some will say, 'Westernized'. However I am still knowledgeable in other ways and have been educated in my cultures art and this is my way of holding on to my roots, heritage and culture.  I want to assure older generations that there are still those of us out there that are young and knowledgeable of our traditions. We are simply facing a new generation of difficulties and now must seek out innovative solutions to evolve ourselves to adapt.

In 2006 - I became very aware of the cultural loss in the arts community as I was participating in various art shows around the city of Vancouver. I realized that fewer and fewer younger generations were studying and learning the traditional Oriental arts that I've come to fall in love with. In the Spring of 2006 I took a large leap of faith and entered the Arts Institute of Vancouver to study graphic design so that I may have the skills to push the art that I practiced and knew to the next level. I learned the skills and knowledge to try to expose the art in different ways and to superimpose the art onto items and products in the form of graphics. I did so successfully in 2008 when I was approached by a stainless steel water bottle company seeking artwork . I did two designs for them in the style of traditional Oriental watercolor painting which became their top selling designs.

At my art show, I hope to inspire younger generations and make those of my generation aware of our dying culture in the arts. I want to also introduce to the world a group of people who are also my dear friends (Desi Method) that have come together over the years to support one another in the arts. Individually we all have different specializations in the Arts: Fine arts, Music, Music  Production, Photography, Interactive Arts, Graphic Arts and even Martial Arts. We are young and we exist, and are promoting our culture, heritage and roots through what we do.

Perhaps my event will open up the minds of traditional thinkers and encourage the idea about the application of a traditional arts onto different mediums to bring the traditional art style of Oriental watercolor to the next level. Maybe one day I will have the opportunity to teach and educate the public and future generations, but at the moment I simply want to share with you and the world my art.

This is only the first stepping stone to building a path to which I hope will lead to many more.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I'm well aware that not everyone can contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • SPREAD THE WORD!

  • Please feel free to share my campaign! Lets make this happen together!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

 

Keep up with Artist SzeYun Lo (Syloarts)

If you've enjoyed finding out about me and want to keep tabs of the ongoings of everything. You are free to follow me on Facebook, Youtube and Twitter. I even blog too.

story: The senior illustration class of the Hartford Art School is seeking donations for their Senior Show "No Need for Words." We would greatly appreciate any donations to help our show be a great success.
story_txt: The senior illustration class of the Hartford Art School is seeking donations for their Senior Show "No Need for Words." We would greatly appreciate any donations to help our show be a great success.

story:
Thanks For the View!

Propulsion Magazine is a fully interactive digital and print medium dedicated to showcasing the darker side of art, music, culture, and fashion. We offer a unique service in networking creatives from all media (including photographers, designers, models, bloggers, musicians, entertainers, videographers, and more), and share their works to a global audience. Propulsion is also dedicated to showcasing your interests. 

Propulsion Magazine is a joint project by Tony Hoskie and Jessica Hess. Two individuals deeply involved in the art, fashion, and music industries. We believe in showcasing underground artists that would otherwise be looked over by more mainstream publications.

Tony Hoskie, who is currently seeking a BS in Advertising with a background and area of interest in music and music business will act as Music Director.

Jessica Hess, with a background in photography, design, and artist promotion will act as Cheif Editor. 

We are not only dedicated to this cause, we are passionate about it. 

 

 

This is Where You Come in!

In order to get the Magazine on it's way, we have a multitude of expenses we're looking at, and we need your help! We are asking for $800 to help us reach our goal of promoting underground artists.

Here is a breakdown of expenses:

  • $100 - Licenses and fees
  • $200 - Promotional goods
  • $250 - Advertising
  • $250 - To go towards our Propulsion Mag. "Living Magazine" event.

Our Living Magazine event will be held in Louisville, KY on August 3rd. The event will showcase a number of musical performances, artist performances, photoshoots, and more. It will take you through a tour of everything the magazine is all about, and a special event issue will be released with photos from/of the artists and attendants at said event. 

What You Get!

For $1 you get:

  • A sincere thank you from the Propulsion Magazine staff.

For $5 you get:

  • A Propulsion Magazine sticker shipped to your door!

For $10 you get:

  • Digital copy of Issue 2.

For $25 you get:

  • Digital copy of Issue 2.
  • Propulsion Magazine sticker pack. (three stickers)

For $50 you get:

  • Digital copy of Issue 2. 
  • Propulsion Magazine sticker pack. (three stickers)
  • FREE Vip pass to our Living Magazine event.

For $100 you get:

  • Digital copy of Issue 2.
  • Print copy of issue 2.
  • Propulsion Magazine sticker pack. (three stickers)
  • FREE Vip pass to our Living Magazine event.
  • 11x17 Propulsion Magazine poster.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Spread the word about the cause. Use the convenient share tools located at the bottom of this page.
  • Submit to be featured in the magazine! We're always looking to showcase underground artists! Please check out submission info. below.

Want to Submit to Be Featured?

Artists, model, photographers, writers and more send samples and high resolution photos to submissions@propulsionmag.com

Musicians, artists, and the like send photos and mp3s or mp4s to music@propulsionmag.com

See more submission info on our website, http://propulsionmag.com
story_txt:
Thanks For the View!
Propulsion Magazine is a fully interactive digital and print medium dedicated to showcasing the darker side of art, music, culture, and fashion. We offer a unique service in networking creatives from all media (including photographers, designers, models, bloggers, musicians, entertainers, videographers, and more), and share their works to a global audience. Propulsion is also dedicated to showcasing your interests. 
Propulsion Magazine is a joint project by Tony Hoskie and Jessica Hess. Two individuals deeply involved in the art, fashion, and music industries. We believe in showcasing underground artists that would otherwise be looked over by more mainstream publications.
Tony Hoskie, who is currently seeking a BS in Advertising with a background and area of interest in music and music business will act as Music Director.
Jessica Hess, with a background in photography, design, and artist promotion will act as Cheif Editor. 
We are not only dedicated to this cause, we are passionate about it. 
 
 


This is Where You Come in!
In order to get the Magazine on it's way, we have a multitude of expenses we're looking at, and we need your help! We are asking for $800 to help us reach our goal of promoting underground artists.
Here is a breakdown of expenses:

$100 - Licenses and fees
$200 - Promotional goods
$250 - Advertising
$250 - To go towards our Propulsion Mag. "Living Magazine" event.

Our Living Magazine event will be held in Louisville, KY on August 3rd. The event will showcase a number of musical performances, artist performances, photoshoots, and more. It will take you through a tour of everything the magazine is all about, and a special event issue will be released with photos from/of the artists and attendants at said event. 


What You Get!
For $1 you get:

A sincere thank you from the Propulsion Magazine staff.

For $5 you get:

A Propulsion Magazine sticker shipped to your door!

For $10 you get:

Digital copy of Issue 2.

For $25 you get:

Digital copy of Issue 2.
Propulsion Magazine sticker pack. (three stickers)

For $50 you get:

Digital copy of Issue 2. 
Propulsion Magazine sticker pack. (three stickers)
FREE Vip pass to our Living Magazine event.

For $100 you get:

Digital copy of Issue 2.
Print copy of issue 2.
Propulsion Magazine sticker pack. (three stickers)
FREE Vip pass to our Living Magazine event.
11x17 Propulsion Magazine poster.



Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

Spread the word about the cause. Use the convenient share tools located at the bottom of this page.
Submit to be featured in the magazine! We're always looking to showcase underground artists! Please check out submission info. below.

Want to Submit to Be Featured?
Artists, model, photographers, writers and more send samples and high resolution photos to submissions@propulsionmag.com
Musicians, artists, and the like send photos and mp3s or mp4s to music@propulsionmag.com
See more submission info on our website, http://propulsionmag.com

story:
About The Project

Hello! Thanks so much for checking out my project. The idea is very simple. As a designer (and as the dude who started this whole logo design project craze), I love creating logos. And after completing three successful logo projects on Kickstarter, I thought it would be fun to see what might happen one more time on Indiegogo. The concept for the project is easy; I'll design a whole bunch of different logos, for a whole bunch of different people. That's it. Each contributer will receive a unique, custom and professionally designed logo. It could be a personal logo for their name, or a logo for their business, band, website, Facebook, Twitter, blog, etc. Pretty much anything (nothing obscene or inappropriate though ... and let's go ahead and avoid anything that promotes Satan or things that Satan may like as well ... Trust me, I've been asked to design some crazy things in the past). Then, all of the logos will be displayed at alotmorelogos.com. Why display them? Because each logo will then link to a specific URL that the contributer gets to choose... It could be their own Facebook page, Twitter account, website, etc. (again, nothing obscene or inappropriate). Depending on the number of backers, this project could be pretty huge. In the end, I think it would be so cool to see hundreds of logos displayed on the site. You can check out the results from my previous three design projects to get a better idea of what I'm talking about:

namelogodirectory.com

thelogodirectory.net

abunchoflogos.com

About The Logos

After the funding period, I'll reach out to each contributer and ask that they submit detailed information about the logo they'd like to have designed. Please note that there is one reward level ($150) that includes a round of revisions based on the contributer's feedback. Let's face it, $25 is really, really cheap for a logo. Therefore, revisions aren't included in those lower levels of funding. With that in mind, you may want to go for the $150 level if think you'd like to have revisions. Again, at the lower levels of funding, once the logo is finished and sent, that's it.  No re-do's. However, at each contribution level I am absolutely committed to designing unique and quality logos that serve the needs of the contributer. In addition, I refuse to produce anything that I wouldn't want my name attached to. Plus, so far, I've had A LOT of satisfied contributers who've been happy with the logo they received. If you have any questions about the design process then just let me know.

Also, in the event that this project actually takes off and receives a lot of contributers, I want to let everyone know in advance that the number of hours spent on each individual logo may be limited. Just imagine if for some crazy reason hundreds of people contributed to this project ... It could potentially take a pretty long time (maybe longer than October) to finish them all. However, that would be pretty awesome, and a lot of fun. I think that's where the really interesting part of these projects comes into play ... Designing consistently good logos in a limited amount of time. As always, I'm excited to push my inspiration and creativity to new limits.

About The Funding

Overall, you can think of it this way; contributers get a unique, custom designed logo, while I get a really sweet design project.

Since funds from just one contributer directly cover the production of one logo, I simply set the funding level at $50. If there is just two backers at the $25 level, or one backer at the $50 level, then I'll consider the project a success. 

Backing For Multiple Logos

In the past, I've had numerous people contribute for multiple logos. For example, if they want two $25 logos, then they've pledged $50 in the $25 category. Please feel free to do so.

A Creative And Unique Gift

In the past, I've had many contributers give a logo as a gift to a friend or loved one. A logo might just be the perfect gift for that special someone in your life :) And that’s all there is to it.

Thank You

If you want to learn more about me and my design skills, please visit brandoneck.com. Again, a super huge thanks for taking the time to read this. I'm excited to see what we can do!

story:
From Creator & Director, Michele Chillook:

Emergence of Spirit came into being because I had a dream when I came to the city of Dubuque. I had no idea at the time what it exactly looked like but I just knew that my passion for living needed a way to be shared with the world. I've always been interested in theater and music but never really had a particular niche to pursue. After graduating from Capri in 2002 and working in the field for almost ten years, I wasn't finding the fulfillment of my dream until I was approached by a local artist about applying for a grant for a project idea...and about nine months later, I had formed a vision for a runway show that involved styrofoam take-out boxes, avante gard hair, & people interested in a different art form than what we've seen in this area. I did not receive the grant, but the flame had been ignited and my dream was beginning to play out in reality. I planned the event with what little resources I had, and put on an outrageous show in three weeks time.

What We Need & What You Get

First year, I did the costumes myself and got a few other cosmetologists to join me in presenting models as works of art to a live audience. We generated enough money to cover our costs for the project, and that was about it. The next year, we set out to win the grant again, but once again walked away without the cash and depended on the money coming in through the door in order to pay everyone for their time, efforts, & supplies. Though the crowd was double the size of year one, and the price was brought up, we also had more people working with the project [including 2 costume designers & 3 makeup artists] and still only managed to pay the primary designers a minimal amount for all the energy they contributed to the show & ended up with 80% of those involved volunteering their time.

Your contribution would allow our artists to be compensated for their involvement, and reimbursed for their materials. Every little bit counts, and will be dispersed in percentages depending on their expenses & time accounted for. However, meeting our goal means we can get more things in advance and make our show even more elaborate, since we aren't needing to pull expenses out of our own pockets.

Costumes: material, supplies, shoes

Models: Makeup. Hair products.

Set: glue, printing & supply costs.

Programs: graphic designing & printing costs.

Lighting & sound equipment rentals & technicians.

Video documentation: Hiring a professional ensures that we will receive a finished product in hand. 

Catering: appetizers for our guests, finger food for our green room. Hiring a passionate food artist who utilizes local ingredients and provides hypoallergenic snacks is important in today's world of allergies & sensitivities.

Advertising and promotional costs: printing, etc.

The Impact

In our first year, we had a total of 150 in attendance.  Second year we doubled the audience.  I'm hoping to do the same in this, our third year! People LOVE this show!  Seeing the crazy styles inspires everyone present.  Having local shows like this keeps really creative souls in the area, and paying them reminds them that their talents are appreciated & needed in our community.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you would like to offer your services in other ways, let us know how you can help.

Use the Indiegogo share tools to help us spread the word & raise the funds to meet our goal!

story:
When people have seen too much of each other, they typically say they need their own space. Well, so do we. However, in this case, it’s not a figure of speech. Young art students in Yerevan, Armenia need space to continue their art projects. We are a free art school called Medialab and have been providing high school kids the opportunity, knowledge and tools to create art since 2008. In order for us to keep this program going, sizeable rented space is needed for continued classes and equipment storage. Please help us get the space we need!

What is Medialab?

Medialab is a free art school established in 2008 by Utopiana NGO in Yerevan, Armenia. Our free six-month educational program invites high school students to learn the theory and practice of contemporary art. This program helps students to develop individual artistic skills and critical attitude towards technology. Our teachers are young local professionals who are volunteers with the program.


Students learn about:

• history and theory of photography
• creative writing
• traditional, digital and experimental photography
• film composition skills
• camera operator skills
• script preparation and creation
• video and photo editing software 
• creation and presentation of artistic projects

Participants can obtain specialized literature and video materials from Utopiana’s library and other necessary tools from its technical laboratory.

Why Support

Armenia’s current art schools (colleges, fine arts institutes, universities, etc.) exclusively teach the traditional means of art with Soviet methodology. Due to this, there has been an unfortunate stall in the field’s modernizing culture and technological advancement. As a way to challenge that, supporting this project will open doors for Armenia’s youth to participate in not only the growing arts, but the social progress that enhances society’s knowledge of this vast discipline.

Through Medialab, our students will have the chance to familiarize themselves with the local and global contexts of art and meet with local and foreign artists, photographers, camera operators, critics and curators.

For a country like Armenia, it is absolutely a one of a kind opportunity for its youth.

We've already had four groups of students. Here are the photos from the last graduation ceremony in May 2013.

This project is valuable to the world because it will broaden the international artistic pool with talent that can introduce new ideas and contribute to this creative field. After all, Medialab is an example of how a small motivated group can work together and achieve great results.


Thank you, 
Utopiana/Medialab Team

story:
The Lantern Company is a vibrant Liverpool-based arts company who have acquired a local and international reputation for delivering great cultural events and projects. We are passionate about our work that ranges from small scale theatrical experiences to spectacular outdoor shows; community arts workshops and specialist training.

We are seeking funds for our flagship event, which has established itself as one of the highlights of Liverpool’s cultural events calendar over the last 11 years. We have just three months to raise money for the new Lantern Carnival in February next year.  Like our traditional Halloween event, it will bring the community together in an uplifting creative celebration. 

We hope to create a new model for the Lantern Carnival for future years and are planning a three day festival of light during the Spring February half term 2016.

The event will be a culmination of lantern art work created by community groups and young people, alongside giant puppets, lanterns and other amazing creations of our professional artist team as part of a stunning theatrical event that includes hundreds of performers in a spectacular site-specific event. We are also relocating to a new  location in Liverpool - the beautiful  Festival Gardens site near Otters Pool park, Liverpool.

The event will be ticketed and held over 3 nights - the 18th 19th and 20th February 2016.

   

The grounds of the park will be transformed into an extraordinary and strange land, where what is usually hidden beneath the lake beds and woodland floors creep, crawl and belch up to the surface to astonish, challenge, delight and even horrify our audiences. The event will be open for four hours each night, and audiences will be free to roam the route at their own pace, where they will witness strange yet beautiful sights and encounter thought-provoking theatrical interactions.

Working with both professional and community partners to stage the event, unforgettable and spectacular experiences will be created for audiences of all ages. It will feature illuminated, sculptural and sound-based installations with walkabout theatre and puppetry performance, created by local and nationally based artists and companies.

A change of location brings a great opportunity to re-imagine the event for both the company and our audiences alike, and we are excited to bring a new vision and develop the event and our audience's experience.

Mass arts engagement, community cohesion and celebration retains central importance to our ethos and work. We will engage hundreds of local people through community workshops, creating lanterns and luminous accessories, which they will carry at the event. The large scale parade of previous years will not feature, instead audiences will become part of the spectacle, lighting their way around the route, using handmade lanterns.


 
We are trying  lots of different ways to raise the additional funds needed to benefit all aspects of the project, ranging from the community workshops to stewarding of the event. For this campaign we hope to raise £10,000. All of our perks are related directly to the contributors enjoyment of the event.
Please join us in helping to make the new event happen - we have fantastic plans that we know will create a wonderful Lantern Festival for everyone to enjoy!

Here's a little documentary about an exhibition we created for our 10 year anniversary, take a look to get a feel for the kind of thing we do, if you're not already familiar with our work...

story:
I’m Phillip T. Nails: your local performance poet. I see you. I recognize a poetry fire ablaze somewhere in your life.

This is an invitation to turn up the poetry volume. We’re calling all cars, switching on the bat signal, building a blazing inferno & we need your help to bring this EVIDENCE to light!

EVIDENCE is a passion project I’m blazing with Carly & Daniel DeMento, James Shaff, Iju Chang and Dorothy Meghan Friend. Jared Miller & Liz Nails are also on the team, and if we get beyond our goal the miraculous Matt Walker will direct a new film for us.

We’ve been conspiring, recording, and obsessing over the new work together: a new vinyl record titled EVIDENCE!

Our goal of $6,500 will PRINT a thousand old school records, PAY artists who’ve devoted time, IGNITE marketing in sales efforts, and BUFFER real costs for delivering perks. Check the perks out! Explosive performances & tantalizing art installations unique to our poetic landscape. Contribute and I’ll show up with some amazing poets to your home, your event, or party and type personalized poems for the masses on vintage typewriters! Enjoy a private performance by yours truly. To keep it simple, should we not reach our goal we’ll print fewer records and they’ll be of lesser quality. Note; a high quality digital version of Evidence will be made available online to all.

To create a record is madness. But I know many, and a growing number of you continue to listen to records, put the sleeves on your walls, or listen to DJ’s spin them in your favorite bar. It takes a lot of work to sell records. Back in the day, entire departments at record companies were devoted to just the marketing of records. But in today’s shamalama world, you, my supporters and collaborators are better than music executives because you are in it for the love. 

The greatest risk and challenge may be that you don’t share this campaign or want to support this project. But I’m willing to take that risk, because I love what I do and I can’t seem to stop.

Will you tell your friend about this project when you’re drinking the evening whiskey tonight? 

Your support, your sharing, your encouragement, your strength to say YES to poetry, YES to madness, and YES to EVIDENCE are what keep me going, keep my heart beating, keep my mind exploding with love and enthusiasm. Thank you for reading. Please help gather EVIDENCE today!

It takes a lot of work to sell records. Back in the day, entire departments at record companies were devoted to just the marketing of records. But in today’s shamalama world, you, my supporters and collaborators are better than music executives because you are in it for the love. 
The greatest risk and challenge may be that you don’t share this campaign or want to support this project. But I’m willing to take that risk, because I love what I do and I can’t seem to stop.
Will you tell your friend about this project when you’re drinking the evening whiskey tonight? 
Your support, your sharing, your encouragement, your strength to say YES to poetry, YES to madness, and YES to EVIDENCE are what keep me going, keep my heart beating, keep my mind exploding with love and enthusiasm. Thank you for reading. Please help gather EVIDENCE today!

story:
Was wird sein, so lautet die Frage ... von jetzt an? Wie gehen KünstlerInnen mit dieser grundlegenden Unsicherheit in Hinsicht auf die Zukunft um, wie sehen ihre Antworten auf die sich damit einstellenden, drängenden Fragen aus?

Wir stecken bereits mitten in den Vorbereitungen - die Künstler*innen arbeiten an Ihren Ausstellungsobjekten, das Büro wird eingerichtet, Poster werden gestaltet und gedruckt...

Unser Projekt wird finanziell zu großen Teilen durch Mittel der Kunststiftung Sachsen Anhalt sowie der Lotto-Toto-Stiftung Sachsen Anhalt unterstützt, wobei wir lediglich ein Drittel der beantragten Summe erhalten haben. Da wir auch keinen Eintritt nehmen werden, sind wir verstärkt auf Eure Spende (insgesamt 6000€, rund 6600$) angewiesen, die wir auf möglichst viele Schultern verteilen wollen.

Euer Geld werden wir für unsere Helfer und Aufsichtskräfte nutzen, damit diese auch eine kleine Entschädigung erhalten sowie für den Transport der Kunst. Unser Ziel ist es jede Stunde der Helfer mit 5€/h zu entschädigen, wobei wir momentan bei lediglich 2€/h sind. Zudem wird der Transport der Kunst hiermit bezahlt, sowie der Kuratorenassistent. Wir haben bereits die Hälfter der Spenden zusammen und würden die restliche Summe gern mit dieser Kampagne aufbringen.

Ihr könnt uns dabei helfen! Tragt einen kleinen Teil dazu bei, dass unsere Ausstellung ein Erfolg werden kann und spendet einen der vorgeschlagenen Beträge!

Wir bedanken uns bereits jetzt für eure Mithilfe und laden euch ein unsere Ausstellung in Halberstadt zu besuchen.

Euer MKH-Team

 

P.S. Spenden sind auch ohne eigenes Paypal-Konto möglich. Paypal bietet auch das Spenden per Kreditkarte an.

---------

Right from the inception of the first Biennale in 2014, the intention was to hold this art exhibition in Halberstadt every two years. And now, it is almost time again: on 26 August 2016 the II. MKH Biennale will open its doors for a whole month. For 2016, we are planning a group exhibition with 13 artists from Germany, Belgium, Bulgaria and Austria. The exhibition will deal with the future and its possibilities – also the future of art.

What will be… from now on? That is the question. How do artists cope with this basic insecurity regarding the future? What are their answers to this urgent question?

We are currently in the middle of preparations – the artists are preparing their works for the exhibition, the office is being furnished, posters are being designed and printed…

Our project is mainly funded by the Kunststiftung Sachsen Anhalt and the Lotto-Toto-Stiftung Sachsen Anhalt; however, we have received only one third of the amount requested. We are not going to charge an entrance fee, so we are even more dependent on your donation. We are asking for 6000€ in total, about 6600$ and we are trying to spread this across as many as shoulders as possible. You can help us with this! Make a contribution to the success of our exhibition by donating one of the suggested amounts.

We would like to thank you in advance for your support and we look forward to welcoming you to Halberstadt!

Your MKH-Team

story:
Growth/Proliferation

My name is Jeff Sheridan, a Portland, Oregon-based artist. I have been invited by SPACE Gallery in Portland, Maine, to paint a mural installation. Over 5 days in late August, I will be working on-site in Maine. In addition to this, I am participating in a group show at Nahcotta Gallery in Portsmouth, New Hampshire during that same week. These are my first major out-of-state shows, and I need your help getting me there and making them happen. 
  My work largely consists of drawings on paper, marks that populate a page to suggest abstract forms. These textures explore the invisible connections between parallels in our perception of the universe and psychological processes. From my statement: The natural world is comprised of objects in motion. Affected by elemental conditions, their organization is not crystalline, or inorganic. Water erosion sculpts mountains, and life populates those exposed fertile pockets. Thematic and fluid, these natural, self-organizing symmetries are accentuated and encouraged by meditations, an automatic repetition creating a texture comprised of groups of thoughts, influenced by- and forming- a structure in negative space. 

Essentially, I emulate forms from the natural world, which can seem pleasant or challenging depending on the level of scrutiny the viewer employs.

I'm seeking to fund-raise $2000 to cover the cost of travel, transportation, food, lodging, materials, etc. I'm selling my work at affordable prices in order to show my appreciation for your contribution!

What I seek/What you get

I am seeking to raise $2000 to cover the cost of art materials, travel, transportation, food, lodging, etc. Any additional costs will go towards future projects and administrative maintenance. 

Here's my budget breakdown: 
-$700 airfare
-$300 materials (paint, brushes, markers, paper, etc.)
-$400 food
-$600 lodging and transportation

Essentially this is a fundraiser art sale. It goes to a good cause! More art for you, more art made by me, in new and exciting places. Your contribution is met with art perks in the form of prints, original art, and if you're local, the potential for a wall drawing at your home or office. 

If I for some reason don't meet this goal, the money raised is still offsetting the cost of these projects, and you of course still receive your perks.

Why
Art is art. I wouldn't do this work if I didn't believe in it. Art is healing. If I can explore the relationship between the cosmos and my personal psyche, then that means that you can, too. I don't seek to be put on a pedestal, to seek fame. However I'm humbled at the opportunity to show my work to new people, in the hopes that they will explore their perspective as well. Or at the very least, explore mine.  Sharing is caring. 
In 2013 my first crowd-funding art project, a 70-foot mural installation at The Vestibule inside Disjecta Contemporary Art Center called You Only Live Twice, was a success. We raised the appropriate amount of money and I made my most ambitious work to date. Now I'm seeking more support, and am eager to meet that support with original and printed works. 

You Can Help

I don't expect everyone to be able to contribute. But if you are interested in the concept, or want to explore my work further, please, don't hesitate to check out my work on these various platforms: 
Website: www.jeff-sheridan.com
Instagram: @jeffsheridan
Facebook: www.facebook.com/jeff.sheridan.artwork
Feel free to share this project!

Or drop me a line: 
mr.jeffsheridan@gmail.com

story:
Hey there! Dennis Dannel, Jr. here. Everyone who knows me, knows that I'm an actor and a singer. What most people don't know is that I'm also a fine artist. I was born in New Orleans, and moved to NYC about 20 years ago to pursue my acting career. I've done some really cool things in my life. For one thing, I graduated law school and then promptly left it behind, for a life in the Arts. For another, I've acted in over 40 shows on the off-off Broadway and Off Broadway stage; and I've produced over 100 plays on the NY Stage. In fact, my picture was on the front cover of the New York Times Arts Section, when they reviewed the Off Broadway hit, "Icarus & Aria," which I produced and had the leading role in.

Despite all of this, exhibiting at The McKenna Museum would be my biggest accomplishment by far. First off, it'll be my triumphant homecoming after 20 years living and working in NYC. But more importantly, I'll get to introduce myself the Art Community and show the world what I've done and can do. Up until now, only my friends and family have enjoyed my drawings and paintings. This is my chance to be seen and heard in the Art World, and my chance to finally be recognized as a fine artist.

Please help give me a stepping stone into this amazing world. I'm so excited to share the talent I've worked all these years to build. Thank you to the McKenna family for giving me this once in a lifetime opportunity. And thank you to you for helping me to achieve what has always seemed like an unattainable dream!

View My Artwork:

At the moment, my portfolio is strictly private, and no one can see it before the exhibition. As a potential sponsor, I'm giving you the unique opportunity to view my work before anyone else. I want you to be able to see what you'll be supporting!

  • Visit: http://www.dennisdannel.com/#!artwork/c1tg3
  • Password: Art


I Need $5250 To Make This Dream A Reality

Expenses:
  • Shipping all of my work from NYC to New Orleans
  • Professionally Framing 7 pieces
  • Museum Rental & Security for the Opening Ceremony
  • Opening Ceremony Catering (300 people)
  • Printing of Invitations
  • Mailing of Invitations
  • Publicity

If for some reason, I don't reach my entire funding goal, I'll be forced to frame my work in an unprofessional fashion, and risk being perceived as unprofessional by the Arts Community. I will also be unable to cater the Opening Ceremony, and again risk appearing ill-prepared for this opportunity. It's important for me to be taken seriously. Please help me to reach my funding goal!


You're Perks For Helping

I have some amazing perks to give in return for your generous support:

  • For $5, you'll get a big heartfelt Dennis hug.
  • For $10, you'll get a 4x6 commemorative postcard.
  • For $25, you'll get a 3x5 magnet of one of my favorite pieces.
  • For $75, you'll get a full size print of one of my favorite pieces.
  • For $250, you'll get a limited edition, signed print of my work.
  • For $500, you'll get a full sized canvas print of my work.
  • For $1000, you'll get a limited edition print of my work.

Other Ways You Can Help 

Just because you can't contribute, doesn't mean you can't help!
  • Please help me spread the word about my campaign!                            -Facebook, email, Twitter, etc... Tell the world!!!
  • And don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thanks for reading this far; and thanks in advance for your support!

story:
Short Summary

WE CAN DO THIS TOGETHER!

 

For 13 years, Celebrate México Now Festival has been New York City's 1st— and only —annual festival of contemporary Mexican art and culture. We have been a platform for over 300 talented visual artists, musicians, dancers, authors, chefs and filmmakers to showcase their work in over 50 cultural organizations in the grand city of New York. We are also very proud to have presented renowned performances and many World Premieres.

This year Celebrate México Now will once again showcase contemporary Mexican culture and the arts in major venues across New York City. 

We invite you to join us for outstanding events including photo exhibits, film screenings, concerts, culinary programs, panels, and performances.

Funding for the arts is very scarce and even more so for international projects. Although we have been able to secure backing from our longtime supporters and partner venues, we still need additional funding to bring this festival to you.

 

OUR IMPACT

For over a decade, Celebrate México Now has highlighted the creativity, ingenuity, heritage, and heart that contemporary Mexican artists bring to every arts discipline and creative industry. Venturing into to the cutting edge of contemporary expression, Celebrate México Now  will bring New Yorkers an exclusive glimpse into how today’s Mexican artists reflect on and reshape Mexican identity in an evolving global context. The Festival’s multi-disciplinary nature yields a comprehensive cultural picture of the passions and concerns that make today’s Mexico so complex and fascinating.

Celebrate México Now Festival has successfully completed Indiegogo campaigns in past years to secure the support needed to continue this citywide cultural festival. 

Help us reach our goal in 2016! Check out the awesome perks we're offering and give now.

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Please tell your family and friends about this campaign and Celebrate México Now. Follow us on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram to stay up to date on everything happening behind the scenes too!  

Use hashtag #fundmxnow to be in the loop of all things Celebrate Mexico Now Festival's Annual Fundraising Campaign 2016 in social media.

 

START HERE!

Donate and share our annual crowdfunding campaign on social media using hashtag #fundmxnow.
