story:
Lesser Beasts is 56 pages of lovingly watercolor painted scenery and story, following a young girl through a world of swamp creatures and animal spirits on an unconventional and occasionally dark coming-of-age journey.

There is no dialogue or narration, which places added emphasis on the quality and detail of the paintings themselves.The visuals are heavily influenced by nature, specifically swamps and the small creatures that inhabit them. The artist grew up in the forest living near a swamp, and spent many an afternoon collecting frogs and whistling back to birds. The story parallels the struggles with self-worth and feeling 'different' that many people face, with the inherent plight of being a small animal. There are twists, too! You'll have to grab a copy to find out what happens.

Thanks to support from the Saskatchewan Arts Board, the art for the book is already complete. This is just a pre-order campaign, and does not go to fund any part of the art creation.

The goal of this campaign is to produce a small print run of Lesser Beasts to help it reach a wider audience, and to reward some super helpful backers! Since this is my first full-length graphic novel, it is important to me that it be sold not just as an e-book, but also in physical form.

Since this campaign is only a pre-order, there is no risk at all aside from the slight possibility things taking a little longer to ship to me. I have already thoroughly researched a POD service and am confident in ordering the books and producing the rewards in a timely manner.

If we don't meet our financial goal backers will still receive their books and rewards. Similarly, if we get overfunded, I will simply produce more books!

By pre-ordering your copy, you'll be helping me:

  • Get real, physical copies of my first full-length graphic novel
  • Help to support the graphic arts in Canada and Saskatchewan
  • Ensure that I will be able to make Lesser Beasts more widely available 
  • Help me create new artworks and books in the coming months


Campaign (May 1st - 14th) - During this time you will be able to pre-order the book via IndieGoGo and pre-pay for shipping.

E-content distributed (May 31st) - On May 31st I will make available all of the e-content (e-book copies, bonuses) to backers which selected and paid for them.

Book ordering / Printing (May 18th - July) - I will order the books fairly promptly after the pre-order period ends, and it will take approximately 6-9 weeks from this time for me to receive the books and rewards. 

Shipping out Rewards (Mid July - Early August) - After recieving the physical books and rewards they will be mailed out or made available for pickup by backers as needed, as soon as possible. At this point you will have your complete copy of Lesser Beasts and the campaign will be totally complete!

This time-schedule is very conservative and it is possible that the books will be recieved and shipped out sooner than this, I just don't want to surprise anyone!

Will I be able to purchase the book elsewhere?

The short answer is definitely not for awhile! Depending upon the success of the pre-order, I may produce a small run of additional comics that I will sell at events. But, if you know you'd like a copy I highly recommend pre-ordering to guarantee that you'll be able to get one.

We're all funded!
Thanks so much everyone for helping Lesser Beasts' print run become OVER 100% funded, I couldn't be happier! 
As a little 'thank you' to everyone ALL contributors who have purchased a physical copy of the book, or a physical copy + art cards will receive 2 EXCLUSIVE lesser beasts buttons to decorate your bag to show that you were part of the original Indiegogo. You don't need to do anything special to get your buttons, they will be delivered with your books.  Again, thanks so much everyone! 
This is a flexible funding campaign, so you can continue to order copies right up until the May 14th deadline. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to pre-order the book now, don't fret! You can always support me by following my social media accounts, commenting on my blog posts and sharing my work that you enjoy. Every bit helps me, and I really appreciate it!

My Facebook Fan Page

Twitter

Instagram

Website / Portfolio / Blog

My Etsy Shop

E-content distributed (May 31st) - On May 31st I will make available all of the e-content (e-book copies, bonuses) to backers which selected and paid for them.
Book ordering / Printing (May 18th - July) - I will order the books fairly promptly after the pre-order period ends, and it will take approximately 6-9 weeks from this time for me to receive the books and rewards. 
Shipping out Rewards (Mid July - Early August) - After recieving the physical books and rewards they will be mailed out or made available for pickup by backers as needed, as soon as possible. At this point you will have your complete copy of Lesser Beasts and the campaign will be totally complete!
This time-schedule is very conservative and it is possible that the books will be recieved and shipped out sooner than this, I just don't want to surprise anyone!



Will I be able to purchase the book elsewhere?
The short answer is definitely not for awhile! Depending upon the success of the pre-order, I may produce a small run of additional comics that I will sell at events. But, if you know you'd like a copy I highly recommend pre-ordering to guarantee that you'll be able to get one.


We're all funded!

Thanks so much everyone for helping Lesser Beasts' print run become OVER 100% funded, I couldn't be happier! 
As a little 'thank you' to everyone ALL contributors who have purchased a physical copy of the book, or a physical copy + art cards will receive 2 EXCLUSIVE lesser beasts buttons to decorate your bag to show that you were part of the original Indiegogo. You don't need to do anything special to get your buttons, they will be delivered with your books.  Again, thanks so much everyone! 
This is a flexible funding campaign, so you can continue to order copies right up until the May 14th deadline. 


    Other Ways You Can Help If you aren't able to pre-order the book now, don't fret! You can always support me by following my social media accounts, commenting on my blog posts and sharing my work that you enjoy. Every bit helps me, and I really appreciate it!
My Facebook Fan Page
Twitter
Instagram
Website / Portfolio / Blog
My Etsy Shop

story:
I've been photographing  diverse subjects for over 30 years--from slaughter houses to Occupy Wall Street protests to the  patterns on a  pine branch or a windswept landscape. I like to capture the moment, form, light and sublime essence of whatever subject I'm documenting.

 My work has been published and collected worldwide (New York Times, New York Post, Times of London, Arena Magazine, Truthdig.com, the Huffington Post and other International magazines ). I've been dreaming of creating a compilation of my photographs as an art book.






 I greatly appreciate your help funding this project and sharing my work with the world.

You can see some of my work on my website   www.jeffpappas.com

story:
Who is Spec Ung?

  • Spec Ung is our boss and the founder of Spec body art (Tattoo&Piercing). He became a tattoo artist after he resigned from Singapore Air Force. His 1st tattoo shop was established in Angeles City, Philippines 1989. Unfortunately, on the year of 1991 Mount Minatubo erupted and he had no choice but to give up his 1st tattoo shop. After that, he's has been a travelling tattoo artist for 13years from 1991 to 2004 until he open his 2nd tattoo shop in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia which is currently still operating by us.

-Spec Ung under Singapore Air Force in (Philippines Clark Air Force base on Luzon) -


-Spec Ung 1st tattoo shop in Angeles City Philippines 1989-


-Spec Ung travelling and tattooing- 


-Spec Ung 2nd tattoo shop in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia which is currently still operating by us now-


-New location that we plan to move in soon-


Support Us and help us to relocate our Tattoo Shop

  • Spec Ung is planning to retire soon. Our current Landlord insist to take back our current shop lot so we have to move to a new and better location. Therefore, we are planning to carry on Spec Body Art (Tattoo&Piercing) and we are going to relocate to this shop. The 3 of us, which is Ronny, Ck, and Olivia are doing Stickers, T-shirt printing to raise fund to relocate to the new shop.


Custom hand-drawn stickers design by us =)


Custom die cut Mirrorcoat matt lamination STICKERS design by us and size for the stickers is approximately 10cm x 12cm each. Comes in a pack consist of 3 different stickers. 

T-shirt design sample for 'Rabbittoo'. T-shirt color available (Black, White, Grey) and size from (S, M, L, XL, 2XL, 3XL, 4XL, and 5XL!!!). 100% cotton, 190grams t-shirt. 

T-shirt design sample for 'Comfort'. T-shirt color available (Black, White, Grey) and size from (S, M, L, XL, 2XL, 3XL, 4XL, and 5XL!!!). 100% cotton, 190grams t-shirt. 


T-shirt design sample for 'War Goose'. T-shirt color available (White, Grey) and size from (S, M, L, XL, 2XL, 3XL, 4XL, and 5XL!!!). 100% cotton, 190grams t-shirt.  


T-shirt design sample for 'The Crow'. T-shirt color available (White, Grey) and size from (S, M, L, XL, 2XL, 3XL, 4XL, and 5XL!!!). 100% cotton, 190grams t-shirt. 


T-shirt design sample for 'Finally'. T-shirt color available (Black, White, Grey) and size from (S, M, L, XL, 2XL, 3XL, 4XL, and 5XL!!!). 100% cotton, 190grams t-shirt. 




Please check your t-shirt size here *Measurements are in Centimeter(CM). (4XL  Length:82, Chest :63) (5XL Length:84, Chest :65)

  • To keep you update on our new shop progress or any inquiry, please click and like our Facebook page at the link below. 
  • Please let us know your T-shirt color and size so we will do the job. T-shirt color may be vary in every design, please check properly before you make payment.



Other way you can help

Spread your words around and help us to share, share, and SHARE...Wooohoo!!!


 

We really appreciate your help and feel amazingly thankful for all your kind contributions.

story:
WHO:

Greetings,

My name is Alex Simmons.  I’m an award-winning author, teaching artist, speaker, and creative arts consultant.

WHAT:

For over 30 years much of my work has been dedicated to using the creative arts to empower people young people, and to building bridges between our world societies. My efforts have taken me from the US to Ireland, Africa, the Netherlands, the West Indies, Russia and India.

WHERE & WHEN:

Now I've been invited to speak at the Balkan’s Festival for Young Artists, from June 28th – July 1st, 2018.

I've also been asked to speak with educators and young people to help develop creative arts programming in the West Indies in August 2018.

WHY:

I've lived and worked believing two things ... 

1) If a child can't imagine what they want to be and do in their future, then they see little value in learning present day academic and ethical lessons.

2) If they believe people who are different from them, are the enemy then they're less inclined to seek ways to cooperate and build better communities.

In the past my workshops and speaking engagements have been supported by various sources including the US State Department’s Speakers Program.

This time is a little different. The organizers can handle my accommodations once I am there, but they do not have the funds to cover my airfare and incidentals.

HOW MUCH:

Therefore, I’m asking for your help to raise $2500.00 to cover airfare and incidentals. I have approximately 12 days to make this happen.

If you can’t donate, please spread the word, or suggest an alternative means for me to obtain the airfare. 

These invites are both an honor as well as an opportunity to continue my efforts to champion the arts as a more creative and collaborative means of global communication.

I truly welcome any help you can give.

Thanks for listening.

Sincerely,
Alex Simmons

Kids Comic Con
Alex In Russia
KCC in Africa

story:
What is 'The Intersection'?

Placing 'The Intersection', such a familiar for the urban eye installation into the foreign landscape of the Playa, we aim to conjure a feeling of a mirage in the desert, as two realities overlap each other and travelling between them is made possible. The most usual thing – the intersection – might be the last object you would expect to see at Burning man. It contradicts with other art objects, enhancing the feeling of you being in another reality. 

But this particular intersection is also much more than a mundane street a person knows from their everyday life. Upon closer inspection, the intersection seems to have appeared from a parallel universe. The universe where Burning Man expanded beyond the trash fence, found a way into the urban realm, and modified it. In this Burning Man modified world, unicorns can be found side by side with robots and the city interacts with its inhabitants in a casual way. In this world, the green man on pedestrian crossing lights does not just indicate when one can safely cross the road, but suggests that activities such as meditation or hugging a stranger next to you as well as unicorns are rightful participants of the traffic.

Why are we bringing 'The Intersection X'? (*A story of our last years' fail) 

We have already brought 'The Intersection' to the Playa in 2018. Its story is glorious, funny and cautionary. We have been producing the artwork in Russia for a few months, then packed in a container and shipped by sea to California 2,5 months before the Burn. Due to the fact that we shipped it a little later, then we have originally planed, and a couple of unfortunate events that have been out of our control, two weeks before the on-playa construction was supposed to start we realised that our Intersection won't make it to the US on time...

We faced a very difficult decision: should we just move the set up of our art to the next year or should we try and remake everything once again in the remaining couple of weeks? We chose the second option. We initiated an internal crowdfunding campaign and collected the needed $12000 among our campmates. We rebuilt everything we have been working for months in Moscow in the US in a couple of weeks. And we managed to bring 'The Intersection' to the Burn last year. It was very hard but very satisfying. Unfortunately, some things didn't work as they were supposed to, for instance, our awesome traffic lights gifs didn't play on the screens, instead the traffic lights showed just random stripes.

The original Intersection arrived to Los Angeles in a sea container in the last days of August 2018. We questioned ourselves 'what shall we do with it?'. Of course we don't want to just trow it away, and we also want to show off our wonderful traffic lights gifs and other nice things that didn't work as planned on the rushed Intersection 2018. So we decided we will use it for our 2019 art project, and thats how 'The Intersection X' has started.

What will be new in 2019 version?

According to this year's theme we decided that The Intersection should be metamorphosed. And thats what you'll see changed in this years version of it compared to last year: on place of one of the light posts appeared a large tree. If you look closer, you'll see that the trunk resembles the lanterns, the trees' fruits look familiar too, they took after the traffic lights. Part of the asphalt surface turned into a green carpet of grass and little fluorescent mushrooms can be found hiding under the tree. Some giant creature made a nest on top of the bus stop. 

Is it interactive?

Like we did last year, we want to make 'The Intersection X' a place of attraction for burners’ activities, the bus stop – a meeting point, and the lineups schedule will help to plan the day. On the intersection, burners will be able to send mail or post an ad about interesting activities in their camps (last year our unicorn family was lucky to witness a beautiful wedding on our intersection, and it was one of the most memorable moments of the burn for many of us). We will also invite music, food and art projects to be guests on our intersection. 

Who we are?

We are Invisible Pink Unicorns camp. BM 2019 is going to be our 3rd burn as a camp (some of us have been attending Burning Man before, with different camps). In 2018 we brought to the playa our first version of The Intersection art. In 2017 we created a cycling workout class in deep playa.  

We are also famous for running around the playa in our fluffiest faux fur coats, group-hugging random strangers. We meet on the intersection every other sunrise to do this, and everyone is welcome to join.  

You can follow us on Instagram & Facebook

Why do we need your support?

'The Intersection X' is a Honoraria project, meaning that we received a grant from Burning Man, which covers about a half of our expenses, needed to bring the 'basic' version of the artwork to the burn. The other half we contribute ourselves as a camp. This basic version includes the tree, the bus-stop, lanterns, posts, traffic-lights, road signs and asphalt. And of course one of the biggest parts of our budget goes towards the logistics of the tree from Russia to USA. But we have many ideas what else we can add to 'The Intersection X' to make it even more interesting. Little fluorescent mushrooms hiding underneath the tree. A climbable nest on top of a bus-stop. A few kid road signs growing under the big one. More lights for the night. And many other nice things. Each of your contributions will go towards making our artwork more detailed and attractive.  

At this moment we have already finished the production of the tree. You can see first pictures below:

What will you get from this?

By contributing to our project you will:

1. Make the world more playful, funny and interesting place.

2. Support the '10 principles', help bring them further and help implement them into the world beyond Burning Man. (If you are not familiar with the 10 principles, please check 'burningman.org')

3. Become a co-creator of the art piece and support independent art that rely only on its creators and supporters, not brands and companies.

4. Become a part of our pink unicorn family.

5. Get our amazing perks!

story:
Chameleon Fineliners have a patented dual ink system, with ink in the pen and in the cap!
 

 

To instantly blend colors, all you have to do is switch the cap, or hop the top to another pen, leave it a few seconds and make vibrant color to color blends!


 

 

 

The newest addition to the Chameleon family, Chameleon Fineliner, was elegantly crafted to incorporate the same Chameleon color blending technology, but in the form of an ergonomic, fine point Japanese precision 0.3mm metal clad tip. 

We tested our Fineliners and each one can do over 32,000 inches that's a 1/2 mile of color! 

 

We can’t thank you enough for checking out our project and helping us make our Fineliner Pens a reality. 

We know not everyone will be able to support us with a pledge, but if you’re a supporter of Chameleon Art Products, you can help us spread the word on Twitter, Facebook, Reddit, Instagram and anywhere else you can think of!

As one of the first crowdfunding marketing agencies, Enventys Partners has brought more than 750 crowdfunding projects to life through lead generation, campaign page creation, public relations, email marketing, Facebook Advertising, campaign management and more.

story:
Short Summary

Hello, I'm Vyles (Vyles17 on the internet), and I'm raising this campaign to spread a message: We can be the difference. And if all it takes is sharing art, I'm all for it.

Not many people know that my mother lost her life after a long battle against a brain tumor in 2016, but here we are, two years later, still trying to find a cure to this awful disease that takes away with it so many people every day.

I want to make the differece, even if in a small part, and with your help I'm sure we can go far.

By buying one of my self published comicbooks, by requesting me a sketch or just by giving money for the cause, you'll help my donation for AIRC (Italian reasearch against cancer), which will be 100% of the profits. My goal of 500 euros might seem small, but every donation can be the decisive one to move foward on this research.

And the best is yet to come: One random person from all the people that will support this project will get a chance to win my 2017 sketchbook that features lots of fanarts, experiments with different techinques and the original pages from my Twenty One Pilots' comicbook "Bellum".

 

Join my cause or just share it: Every little help is appreciated!

story:
***PLEASE SEE UPDATE #1 BEFORE DONATING***


My Story

My name is Cheryl Johnson and my goal here is to travel to Mongolia to create a collection of thoughtful and expressive sketches and publish those sketches in a book. I was born and raised just outside of Washington D.C. and I currently live in the beautiful state of Utah. I make art for a living in a variety of disciplines (design, photography, animation) and I also make art for fun (like on the weekendz). Whether I'm travelling or at home, I prefer to "see" the world through the pencil and sketchbook in my hand.


I love photography and I believe it has its place, but I feel I learn more about an area through standing still and sketching for 30 minutes than I ever would snapping photo after photo.



"No changing of place at a hundred miles an hour will make us one whit stronger, happier, or wiser. There was always more in the world than men could see, walked they ever so slowly; they will see it no better for going fast."

-John Ruskin


So Why Mongolia?


I lived in Mongolia from December 2006 to May of 2008 while serving a mission for my church. I was there long enough to go beyond sampling the more readily visible aspects of Mongolian culture and developed a deep appreciation for the Mongolian way of life. I made lasting friendships and learned to speak fluent Mongolian. As a volunteer missionary and English teacher, however, my time was (willingly) not my own and I had little to no opportunity to break out my sketchbook and capture what I was seeing and feeling. I was able to do a few sketches the times I have been back to visit, but there are still hundreds of moments, people, and places that I have longed to sit down and capture on paper.



In addition to being personally meaningful to me, Mongolia remains somewhat of a mystery to the world at large. Most people think of grassy steppes full of livestock and little round yurts when they think of Mongolia, and most of what I have seen in films, documentaries, photographs, and articles about Mongolia do little to expand on that limited view. They gloss so many subtle but unique stories and focus on those things that seem the most "foreign" or exotic to Westerners. Mongolia certainly has a vibrant and exciting culture, but there is so much more to it than what you would see on a postcard. There are things both stranger and more familiar than you would imagine. I hope to convey some of those feelings, subtleties, and stories with my drawings, and give those who view my book the opportunity to replace some of that distant, foreign mystery with a more meaningful look at life in the land of the Eternal Blue Sky.


The Book

After spending three months searching out and sketching the people, scenes, and stories of Mongolia I will be able to organize and compile those sketches into book format which will then be printed and distributed to all you fine people. Some of the sketches will be presented in their raw, journal-like format and some will be scanned and colored. My hope is that in reading and viewing the book you will feel like you were able to travel with me, see what I saw, and experience what I experienced while in Mongolia.


What I Need Your Help With

In addition to printing and shipping the final book I will need to cover some other costs in order to make this project happen. I have been researching costs and have contacted friends in Mongolia who are on board to help me find housing. Here is a basic list of expenses that your helpful donations will cover:

  • Round trip flight to Mongolia- Around $1,700 USD with taxes and fees
  • Housing in Mongolia for 3 months- $1,500 USD (around $500/mo)
  • Food expenses (hoping to stay a well-fed artist here)- $250 (around $75/mo)
  • Art supplies (pretty simple- just lots of sketchbooks and pens/pencils!)- $150
  • Printing 100 copies of the book- $1,400 USD (I'd love to print more if more people contribute!)
These are all fairly conservative estimates. If we reach the goal amount I'll still be personally covering the cost of furnishing my apartment and any other monthly living expenses. I also hope to pursue some exciting stretch goals that will allow me to upgrade my equipment and expand my travel capabilities in Mongolia.

Perks

The perks for donating to this project include copies of the actual book, prints of my sketches, postcard set, oil paintings based off of my sketches, and more. Obviously I haven't made any of the artwork specific to this project yet, so I hope use the examples of my previous work that I have shared as an indication of what you'll be seeing. Take a look at all of the options as lined out in the perk descriptions and find something that appeals to you as a souvenir for taking this journey with me.
After returning from Mongolia at the end of this year it will take me a couple of months to put the book and the other perk items together. I will send out updates to inform you of my progress but I anticipate shipping all of the physical items in late spring/early summer 2017.
The cost of shipping within the U.S. is included in the donation amount. Due to unpredictable and widely varying costs for international shipping, I will be contacting international donors closer to the time of shipment to request individual payments.

The Impact

I'm not trying to bring about world peace with a book of pretty pictures, but...um, maybe? It doesn't matter where you're from, every person is in danger of seeing their own way of life as the only way to live. I traveled halfway around the globe to a people and culture that to all initial appearances have little in common with my own. I didn't come away from it thinking Mongolia was a strange, exotic place, I came away with the realization that I now felt just as at home on the other side of the world as I do in my own hometown. I like the idea of taking foreign things and turning them into familiar ones. The world becomes less of a scary place the more "homes" you have. For those of you who aren't planning on hopping on a plane and spending a few months in Mongolia, maybe taking a look at the book will help you to see how Mongolia could be part of your home.

In addition to all those lofty goals, I also just hope to make something that looks real nice. Not everyone can make art for a living, but most people do enjoy living more with healthy doses of art, regular and often. I feel better when I have access to beautiful things, so I hope to put something beautiful in people's hands.


Risks & Challenges

There is a fair amount of risk with any artistic venture. I've tried to think things through and I've gone back and forth between thinking 3 months is way too much and way too little time to spend just drawing. It will require endurance and discipline on my part to keep up a good drawing pace, but I also hope that I will have enough time to draw everything I want to. U.S. citizens can stay in Mongolia for up to 90 days without acquiring a visa. There is a possibility of extending my stay for 30 extra days but I have to wait until I'm in the country to apply and pay a fee. Campaign funds will determine whether or not that is an option.

While I hope to go beyond my goal of $5,000, there is also a risk of not even reaching it. I can modify the project to only go for two months in Mongolia or even just one, but if that is the case I will most likely seek out some other methods of fundraising.

I have estimated the amount of time it will take me to compile the sketches and create the book when I return, but I may find it to be more complicated than I expected. That and the logistics of shipping the book and other perks around the world may take more time than anticipated and I hope you all will be patient with me as I figure these things out as I go.

Lastly, traveling to and living on the other side of the world adds an extra level of risk to every aspect of the project. It makes it harder to predict how much everything will cost, how long it will take, what resources I will have access to when I get there. I have already and will continue to reach out to my friends in Mongolia to try to make sure everything runs as smoothly as possible, but I'm not super great at seeing the future and have to just hope that I will be able to deal with problems as they come up.
story_txt:
***PLEASE SEE UPDATE #1 BEFORE DONATING***

My Story 

My name is Cheryl Johnson and my goal here is to travel to Mongolia to create a collection of thoughtful and expressive sketches and publish those sketches in a book. I was born and raised just outside of Washington D.C. and I currently live in the beautiful state of Utah. I make art for a living in a variety of disciplines (design, photography, animation) and I also make art for fun (like on the weekendz). Whether I'm travelling or at home, I prefer to "see" the world through the pencil and sketchbook in my hand.






I love photography and I believe it has its place, but I feel I learn more about an area through standing still and sketching for 30 minutes than I ever would snapping photo after photo.







"No changing of place at a hundred miles an hour will make us one whit stronger, happier, or wiser. There was always more in the world than men could see, walked they ever so slowly; they will see it no better for going fast."
-John Ruskin


So Why Mongolia?


I lived in Mongolia from December 2006 to May of 2008 while serving a mission for my church. I was there long enough to go beyond sampling the more readily visible aspects of Mongolian culture and developed a deep appreciation for the Mongolian way of life. I made lasting friendships and learned to speak fluent Mongolian. As a volunteer missionary and English teacher, however, my time was (willingly) not my own and I had little to no opportunity to break out my sketchbook and capture what I was seeing and feeling. I was able to do a few sketches the times I have been back to visit, but there are still hundreds of moments, people, and places that I have longed to sit down and capture on paper.



In addition to being personally meaningful to me, Mongolia remains somewhat of a mystery to the world at large. Most people think of grassy steppes full of livestock and little round yurts when they think of Mongolia, and most of what I have seen in films, documentaries, photographs, and articles about Mongolia do little to expand on that limited view. story:
About the Project

The Transcending Gender project began as a photographic celebration of the lives of transgender and gender non-conforming humans. My passion to capture and celebrate diverse lives came from the belief that one of the reasons transgender and gender non-conforming individuals are not embraced in our society is because of our deeply-rooted cultural gender expectations. Gender expectations that are so engrained into the way we interact with one another they drive many of the decisions we make, including; what we wear, what color our phone case is, how we treat each other, and how we show our emotions. 

After capturing stories around the nation, I realized it’s not just transgender and gender non-conforming people who suffer from these expectations: it’s all of us. We should all feel free to be who we want to be, whether it’s how we dress or how we show emotion and affection toward one another. So over the past six months this project has evolved into a photographic series where transgender individuals, and also individuals who are not transgender – literally, everyone and anyone – show we are more than just our gender.

What We Need & What You Get

We have been able to capture more than 35 portraits across the US, but we still have so many more stories to tell and portraits to make! Help us tell more stories and make more portraits across the United States. 

The Impact

While the mission of this project is to shift the way people think about gender, these portraits are not actually about gender at all. They are about people, living their lives – an experience we all share. I believe that if we can shift the way we think about, talk about and understand gender in our mainstream society we will see more acceptance for everyone to freely express themselves without fear of judgment, discrimination or violence.

story:
Short Summary

In Search of Yemenja, a collaboration between Opal Palmer Adisa, an award-winning, Jamaican-born poet, and Nikki Thompson, a widely collected book artist, is a flag book, an accordion style book with “flags” attached to the accordion, developed by Hedi Kyle, with a sewn signature. The book is a photographic and poetic documentation of Adisa's journey to Brazil to study the African ocean goddess, Yemenja. Text is letterpress printed from photopolymer plates; photographs are pigment inkjet prints. 

In Search Yemenja examines and explores ritual and roles in Brazil. The book portrays the woman-centered traditions surrounding the Yoruban ocean goddess, Yemenja. The process of developing the book showcases a partnership between Adisa, a poet exploring a new representation for her work — the artist’s book — and Nikki Thompson, a book artist. Opal Palmer Adisa’s strong, vibrant poetry and prose relates her journey in 2006 to study and participate in the major Brazilian celebration surrounding a Yoruban Goddess from Nigeria who protects women, children, and fishermen. Just as the women who take part in the celebration bring gifts to the sea, we are bringing this book about the celebration of Yemenja to you.


About us:

Diverse, innovative and multi-genre, Opal Palmer Adisa is an exceptional talent, nurtured on cane-sap and the oceanic breeze of Jamaica. Charismatic and informed, Adisa’s concerns span the gamut from children to the environment, and as such there is hardly any topic that she has not written about either in poetry, prose or essay. A highly sought-after motivational speaker, Opal Palmer Adisa has lectured and read her work throughout the United States, Europe, South Africa, South American, and the Caribbean. An award-winning poet and prose writer Dr. Adisa has fourteen titles to her credit, including the novel, It Begins With Tears (1997), proclaimed by Rick Ayers as one of the most motivational works for young adults.

Nikki Thompson enjoys obscure, innovative literature and the fine craftsmanship of outdated technologies and "women's work." She likes the craft even better if it has a cantankerous Union history. She uses these crafts to make artist's books that investigate structure, material, and image in terms of poetry, both hers and that of poets she likes. Her work frequently uses metaphors of science and architecture to explore isolation and relationships.


The Impact

We are planning to do an edition of 50 books, each filled with the poignant photographs and the celebratory poem by Opal Palmer Adisa. The innovative book structure will delight the viewer with the sound of a flagbook opening and will visually thrill with the photographic flags. The book will be shown widely and collected by libraries, hopefully around the US and beyond. Opal is an award-winning poet with fourteen books to her name, while Nikki Thompson has been a book artist for fourteen years, represented by Vamp and Tramp, Seager Gray Gallery, and others. Her books have been collected by libraries throughout the US, including Scripps College and Otis College of Art and Design.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our campaign with your friends. Tweet about it, Facebook about it, or any other word that shouldn't be a verb but is. Or let people know about our campaign the old fashioned way, in a postcard or face to face.

story:
Shortly after she passed away on December 30, 2012, Gordana’s students gathered to make Loving and Leaving: Tracing Passages of the Heart—a performance collectively developed to celebrate her life, teaching and art. This project was made possible in part by the support of the Edmonton Arts Council. 

Now, a year after the performance, we gathered again to collectively curate Gordana’s retrospective exhibition, Passages of the Kino Eye. 

WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT

Your donation will help fund the making of this exhibition. All contributing artists have donated their time and work, so funds will be going directly towards production costs. Specficially:  

  • Equipment purchases
  • Printing of the catalogue
  • Installation supplies

The catalogue is the biggest expense we're facing. Gordana touched the lives of many people and we want to ensure that we can sell the catalogue at an affordable price so that everyone can take one home. It is a lasting object in which we have inserted traces of her presence in the minds and works of those whose life she touched – individual and collaborative work produced by students and colleagues, interviews, artifacts from past performances, work she started that other hands finished, and a short biography written by her husband, Marko Zivkovic.  

KINO EYE

Passages of the Kino Eye displays a selection of work from the last seven years of Gordana’s life culminating in her ‘cinematic cycle’ where she explored convergences between film and painting. The kino eye was both a camera and a projector for Gordana. For us it is a window through which we catch a glimpse into the movie theatre of her mind.

AFTERLIFE

Alongside Gordana’s own, we are presenting work that reveals the ways in which Gordana persists in our art and in our lives. We are conduits, we are passages. We are floating dandelion seeds. We are her afterlife.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Spread the word! Invite your friends to the exhibition. 

Share this campaign!

story:
Its pretty straightforward: we need a rental vehicle to take us on tour!

Dash will be playing 2 weeks of dates as Curtains, and Rae is coming along to perform live video accompaniment and hawk some homemade zines! We don't have much gear, so we'll get the tiniest, most fuel efficient thing they have on the lot and not waste a dollar.

Unfortunately, we don't live in a country that is very supportive of artists, nor of car-free travel. We know many of you that we are asking to help have had similar problems and face similar financial woes. We ask you for a small contribution to make this happen in support of a strong arts community for all of us. We want to participate in and contribute to our community however we can, and your contribution will be remembered.

story:
The Velvet Painting Series

What started as one nude art book, evolved into a series of books influenced by the black velvet paintings of the 70's.

I've been shooting a nude series for a little over 8 years & I want to to publish a collection of fine art books derived from the work. My "Velvet Painting Series" is designed to be beautifully arousing... celebrating the sexual potency and freedom of wonderfully diverse women. The work started as one book... but has evolved into a series of books.

I am now raising money to print the premier book of the series (and namesake), "The Velvet Painting".

After submitting my books to some art book publishers, I was told that they were unable to find a place for these types of projects in their book schedule. And the closing of many bookstores (local and major chains) along with book purchasing being on the decline doesn't make it any easier to find an art book publisher for The Velvet Painting Series. With the help of crowd-funding, it's powerful community, family, friends and art lovers, I hope to eliminate the middle man and self-publish these books for all to enjoy.

Indiegogo is a wonderful and very secure site, where you can make a credit card or PayPal contribution to help me print and ship the first of this series of books.

Every bit helps so please give what you can, even if it's just a dollar.

You can raise your pledge amount at a later date if you would like to. And if you know someone who might like this type of art work please send them a link to this page.

Book Specs

  • 8" x 10"
  • 144 pages
  • Full color
  • Hardcover
  • First edition: 1000 signed copies
The funding will help cover printing fees & shipping costs. The more money raised, the more books we can print! :)

Behind The Camera

As a photographer, I strive to capture the true essence of my models. While I have given the work very serious thought, I wouldn't consider it too calculated. Although I set the stage, I like my shoots to be organic, free-flowing collaborations between the subject & I. The ideas constantly evolve & the resultant images are reflective of our shared energy.

 shoots to be organic, free-flowing collaborations between the subject 
& I. The ideas constantly evolve & the resultant images are 
reflective of our shared energy.

story:
As most of Upper Egypt underprivileged cities, El Minia is ignored from hosting major cultural or artistic events. Our project aims to change that fact by organizing an annual international art show for students in collaboration with faculty of fine arts – El Minia university .The show has been a great opportunity to introduce the students and the public of El Minia to a wide array of contemporary artworks from all over the world and to introduce our young artists to the world. Year after year our project grows to connect us to new corners of the world and create bonds among the exhibiting artists regardless of the geographical, political or cultural barriers. That artistic interaction can represent a platform for young artists and the public of various cultural backgrounds to engage in a cultural dialog, exchange ideas and have a better understanding of the “other”. We believe in the world of today , it is absolutely imperative to enhance that sort of cultural interaction. Your contribution to SIPS 15 Camping will help in covering the cost of framing of the artworks , Catalogue publication , customs & postal services , cash awards and the website of the show . We appreciate your contribution .

www.studentsprintshow.com

story:
(Update) We are keeping it local, Thanks to you!

You are amazing! Thank you so much for helping us print and publish the book. The extra $ raised is going to help with the design fees, the cost of printing posters and the limited edition prints – all being produced here in Pittsburgh as well. The folks at the Pittsburgh Center for the Arts and Pittsburgh Filmmakers also want to thank everyone for their contribution. It is deeply appreciated!


Keeping it local

I'm Ron Donoughe, a regional landscape painter of western Pennsylvania for the last 30 years. Last year I visited and painted in each neighborhood of Pittsburgh, all 90 in fact. This is my home and this project is my visual love letter to people of Pittsburgh.

The  paintings will be exhibited at the Pittsburgh Center for  the Arts (PCA) May 15th - August 2015. In collaboration with the PCA, I am publishing a book about the project. It is full color, 130 pages, and features all 90 paintings.  We want to have it printed here in Pittsburgh, not overseas.  It just makes sense to source it locally.

See the paintings and stories behind them on my tumblr.


We are almost there

We have raised $36, 297. That's all from local foundations and private individuals that believe in this project. The cost to print locally is $42,000 for 3000 copies.


Can you contribute?

Every little bit helps, even $5. If you contribute more we will send you some perks!

A postcard, the signed book, a poster from the exhibition, a signed print of your favorite neighborhood, or even a real original painting---------------------->>

There are lots of options for the Pittsburgh lover in you!

16x20 print
Pick your favorite neighborhood!

The exhibition poster includes all
90 neighborhood paintings


We have done this before and it was a success.

The Pittsburgh Center for the Arts published "Essence of Pittsburgh" in 2006. That book has recently sold out. The $29 book now fetches more than $200. Who knows what this one could be worth someday?

This collection of work is an important time capsule for the city of Pittsburgh. It will be a handsome gift for any Pittsburgh native.


Can you help us get the word out?

Please share with family and friends: http://igg.me/at/90neighborhoods

story:
Dans la nuit du 16 au 17 janvier 2015, le local abritant LA PETITE BOITE NOIRE a été la proie des flammes, détruisant près de 4 ans de travail passionné de son équipe de bénévoles. Plus que jamais, LA PETITE BOITE NOIRE est décidée à poursuivre sa mission et à promouvoir la culture indépendante à Sherbrooke. Pour ce faire, LA PETITE BOITE NOIRE compte sur le support de la population de Sherbrooke et des environs et sollicite son appui financier pour assurer le maintien de ses activités. 

En effet, bien que couvert par des assurances, il appert que le produit des assurances est insuffisant pour voir au redémarrage de l'organisme. Votre contribution est donc essentielle à la relance de cette pierre angulaire de la culture émergente à Sherbrooke que représente LA PETITE BOITE NOIRE.

LA PETITE BOITE NOIRE, C'EST :

  • un organisme sans but lucratif (OSBL);
  • une salle de spectacle et de diffusion artistique où se produisent gratuitement les artistes de la région et les artistes de passage;
  • un lieu de rassemblement pour les passionnés de musique et ceux qui désirent découvrir de nouveaux talents;
  • un tremplin pour les artiste émergents;
  • une équipe de bénévoles passionnés et dévoués;

Sur une campagne globale de 50 000, nous avons présentement 35 000 $, soit 70% de l'objectif initial!  

D'autres activités de financement auront lieu et nous visons ici : un montant de 5000 via la plateforme indiegogo. 

La Petite Boite Noire vous prépare d'autres activités de financement! Restez connectez à notre page Facebook!  

Vous pouvez aussi nous encourager en devenant Partenaire de La Petite Boite Noire!  https://www.dropbox.com/s/f9105lxfb1444fu/Dossi...

Partagez la bonne nouvelle: #LPBN

Pour toute question, écrivez-nous à info@lapetiteboitenoire.org

This is what I am trying to do

I want to establish a center which will be a protective home for every Arabic comic or children's book ever-published. This center will house my collection, with additional material purchased all over the world. It will hold at least one copy of each publication. Eventually, the Center's collections will be digitized and made accessible online.
Arabic publications for children started in the late 19th century, followed a few decades later by the first Arabic comic books.
I have worked for years in the Arab comics industry. I am a collector/historian of comics and I have authored  books and held exhibitions about Arabic comics

What I Need

I need one hundred thousand dollars to rent a suitable flat, buy computers,  scanners, printers, desks, tables, unpretentious furniture and, most importantly, buy old comics, children books and original artwork  and subscribe to current publications.

Contributors will receive unique perks, pdf and paper books and comics. I have duplicates. See details.

If I don’t reach my entire goal, the funds will go for the production of new monographs and the holding of exhibitions about comics and children's books.

The Impact

Not a single university or institution in the Arab world has established a center to preserve Arabic comics and children publications. A few centers in the West and a recent comics museum in India cater only for publications in their language.
By digitizing and preserving these publications, and by making them accessible to researchers and pleasure-readers alike, I will be preserving a major cultural heritage. Every year, countless old publications fritter away in old damp attics or are trashed and destroyed. It is a destruction of collective memory!
Eventually, my center will lead to the establishment of other centers in other countries and languages. It would become the spearhead of a world-wide preservation effort

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but

  • They can look around them for old comics and children books that they can contribute
  • They can spread the word about this campaign

story:
WHAT IS "FEMME FANTASY"

On Friday, March 14, we will gather the area’s best female artists to show you their fantasies.  Expect a provocative, intriguing, and sensually charged evening of feminine creativity. 

FEMME FANTASY will cover the entirety of our 1,500 sq. ft. gallery with depictions of female fantasies in mediums including photography, drawing, painting, sculpture and painted live models.

Soft Water Studio artists collaborate on an experience into the Female psyche and bring you "Femme Fantasy", where women examine and exhibit their fantasies for the world to see.  A MUST-SEE for both Men and Women, "Femme Fantasy" is an all-female, visual, musical and performance art exhibit that you will not want to miss.  Traditionally, art has been all about male fantasy.  Let us show you the female perspective.  It may surprise you.....

Expect an Unforgettable Event.

The Femme Fantasy includes:

·  Juried art show that revolves around the FEMALE FANTASY 

·   Live Musical performance by Kasondra Rose

·  Food trucks from Maggie on the Move and CA Café.

·  Henna designs by Jen’s Henna

·  Tarot Card Readings by Courtney Crouch

·   Female acrobats including Marla Mae and Fire Dancers

·   Living Art Display with Painted Live models.


While you feast your eyes on the inner-workings of the female mind, enjoy beverages for a donation that benefits local non-profits, female owned food trucks and entertainment.  The show will be photographed by Downtown Carol Photography.

To kick off a show of this magnitude, we need a little help with funding, in return we are putting on a fantastic event that will also benefit 3 of our local community non-profits, The Warehouse Arts District, the Grand Central District and Keep St Pete Local.  We also have set up several perks for donors listed below:

Perks Include: Artist Signed Postcards, Prints and Tattoos by Carrie Jadus & Femily Killer



THE IMPACT

The artwork featured in Femme Fantasy gives insight into the minds of real women of all ages. This Femme Centered Show celebrates women, embraces men & exemplifies that St. Pete FL is an Arts Destination!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you LOVE our idea but you can't contribute financially,

 you can still help us make this show spectacular.  

Please spread the word so we can meet our goals!

story:
Hey, welcome to our Indiegogo campaign. If you enjoy building things, and shooting
things- you will love PAPER SHOOTERS™ Construction Kits! Our blasters are supplied in kit form and are made from a specially treated cardboard for durability with a plastic internal shooting mechanism 'skeleton'. They feature ejecting shells and fire paper ammo rounds which you make yourself from ordinary paper, up to 75 feet. There are two models, each with four camo's, which are all interchangeable with the same internal 'skeleton.'

                                   The Original 'Digital Op's' design is back!

PAPER SHOOTERS™ has been brought to life by a very small group. As a young entrepreneurial team we are committed to developing a fantastic product unlike anything that has been seen before. We’ve dedicated 2 years to make this concept a reality, but now need your help in bringing the product to market. 

We’ll use your Indiegogo funds towards: 

  • 1. Product: Final testing and the initial production run
  • 2. Promotion: Marketing and creating public awareness.

Please join us to help launch these ultra cool awesome looking products into the market!

  • PAPER SHOOTERS™ is highly innovative and provides an entirely new build and play experience unlike anything else. Our shooters are more accurate than other blasters, and you don't need to collect your ammo afterwards- you make it yourself in seconds using ordinary paper! (Make 60 rounds in 45 seconds.)
  • Awesome interchangeable camo's, real triggers, and ejecting shells.
  • Ultra safe and unique mess free 100% biodegradable ammo.
  • More accurate than other ammo types such as foam darts and rubber bands, and also design and print your own camo's.
  • The problem with designing and building things is that individuals are limited by ability and skill, but not with our construction kits- anybody can produce an awesome looking blaster that shoots really well.
  • Open source design allows for modding of internals.

 

We understand that it will be difficult not to be grouped into the 'toy blaster' category of products. I know what your thinking- why cardboard? Why not plastic? Why not foam darts or rubber band ammo? We would answer those with:

PAPER SHOOTERS™ is not aimed at the typical blaster market, where rate of fire and ammo capacity is key- lets be honest NERF owns this space and no others really come close. We are positioned to a different audience, where the construction experience, awesome designs and camo's similar to Call Of Duty, combined with the 'marksman' accuracy element of play is valued. The ammo sticks to the target to prove accuracy, and you can make 60 rounds of ammo in less than a minute- so you never need to run out or purchase more!

We are very different to anything that has been seen before. Firstly, we are a highly detailed model kit which has to be built from scratch with all the components pieced together such as the air chamber, springs, trigger mechanism etc. The mechanism is then covered with an awesome looking specially treated cardboard exterior- again built from scratch, with properties similar to laminated paper, which looks ultra cool, whilst retaining durability.

PAPER SHOOTERS™ has been nearly two years in the making, during which time we have conducted extensive research. We found that there are lots of people who like us, also love building and shooting! That was the basis for creating such a product as there is nothing like PAPER SHOOTERS™ on the market currently.

Our ammo is ULTRA SAFE and 100% BIODEGRADABLE! It can be made in seconds from ordinary paper using the mould provided. It shoots more accurately than other toy ammo types such as foam darts which tend to veer off, and the 'rubber band' type ammo isn't very accurate at all over any distance. Also, for you wimps out there the ammo will not hurt if you are hit with it.

   Make the ammo in seconds from ordinary paper using the mould included!

The PAPER SHOOTERS™ designs are much more sophisticated than toy blasters and are definitely geared towards the gamer Call of Duty/ Halo/ Battlefield fan. We wanted to create products that are fun to build, shoot great, and look awesome displayed on a shelf or wall. We spent a lot of time designing awesome camo's and the finished product really turns heads. The two models: 'AVENGER' and 'TACTICIAN' are available in four camo's: Aqua Ops, Zombie Slayer, Vandal, and the Limited Edition- Golden Touch! Our shooters are very accurate when compared with other toy blasters but like we say- we are very different.

We have worked with a great team of ex Hasbro designers to produce PAPER SHOOTERS™. The team includes designers who previously worked on numerous Nerf and Star Wars products over 12 years.

We are creating the PAPER SHOOTERS™ clan within our website where you can design your own camo's, clan tag badges, calling cards, vote for new models, download blueprints, sketches and much, much more!

We would appreciate your support!  If you like our idea and project, please spread the word and visit us at  www.PaperShooters.com 

Please Like Us on Facebook and Follow us on Twitter

I also guarantee that if you help back this project- you will 100% receive your perk before these products hit retailers! 

Fortunately our team has a huge amount of experience in taking an idea from a concept, an idea in someone’s head- to a product on a shelf in a store. We understand that there are always unforeseen challenges that occur, and have built a really solid plan with that in mind.

Our design is based on a tried and tested method of shooting projectiles- we haven't tried to reinvent the wheel. We have taken the concept and engineered it into a brand new design which is both fun to build and works really well.

Our team consists of ex Nerf and Star Wars designers, so we understand every step of the way in making a fantastic product and placing it into the hands of the consumer. We have been working on this product for over 18 months and it has been quite a journey- starting with sketches, models, prototypes, until we have what you see here: A fantastic quality product that is both fun to build, looks great and performs really well.

The production line is ready to go, we simply need the funds for some final elements of the testing and the initial orders.

It would be great to have you on board with us and thank you for your interest in PAPER SHOOTERS™

story:
Jerk Church Cathedral in Black Rock City

Jerk Church was formed on the communal comfort from singing our worries away as we pass a cup and share a laugh with friends. The First Church of the Jerk has grown over the years and now spans chapters across the US and Canada.

The Jerk Church Cathedral is built on the shifting dust of the Black Rock Desert; a quick-build, low cost, fun-sized country church with weddings, bars, birthday funerals, and sustainable jackassery all week long. 

What we need:

Your contributions will allow us to make needed repairs, pay for rent on our container in Gerlach, provide power for the Build Crew, create new interactive experiences, and pay for the transportation necessary to bring the pre-built Cathedral back to the playa. In turn, you get your ass down to the cathedral and come have a great time with us. We'll be having weddings again, birthday funerals, and guest nights for bands to rock out during the week. For those with the means to give generously, we have a set of valuable perks listed below.

The Cathedral is designed by Phil Mitchell (aka Boyfriend). Click here to watch Boyfriend's one minute design video, without pants. 

We estimate our material, transport, storage and upgrade costs will be around $3,500 We've already raised some of it but could really use your help!

Why? Is this an art project?

We love to make music. We love to sing. We especially love it when others join in, hoisting drinks and lifting voices. Everyone is welcome, all are encouraged to tithe. If art is living out loud, sure - it's an art project.

Get the word out on the street.

Blues Brothers style. With this favor from you, we'll put on a hell of a show in kind. Tweet this link, tell your friends, and come visit us in Black Rock City and enjoy the perks we have for various donation levels.
story_txt: Jerk Church Cathedral in Black Rock CityJerk Church was formed on the communal comfort from singing our worries away as we pass a cup and share a laugh with friends. The First Church of the Jerk has grown over the years and now spans chapters across the US and Canada.The Jerk Church Cathedral is built on the shifting dust of the Black Rock Desert; a quick-build, low cost, fun-sized country church with weddings, bars, birthday funerals, and sustainable jackassery all week long. What we need:Your contributions will allow us to make needed repairs, pay for rent on our container in Gerlach, provide power for the Build Crew, create new interactive experiences, and pay for the transportation necessary to bring the pre-built Cathedral back to the playa. In turn, you get your ass down to the cathedral and come have a great time with us. We'll be having weddings again, birthday funerals, and guest nights for bands to rock out during the week. For those with the means to give generously, we have a set of valuable perks listed below.The Cathedral is designed by Phil Mitchell (aka Boyfriend). Click here to watch Boyfriend's one minute design video, without pants. We estimate our material, transport, storage and upgrade costs will be around $3,500 We've already raised some of it but could really use your help!Why? Is this an art project?We love to make music. We love to sing. We especially love it when others join in, hoisting drinks and lifting voices. Everyone is welcome, all are encouraged to tithe. If art is living out loud, sure - it's an art project.Get the word out on the street.Blues Brothers style. With this favor from you, we'll put on a hell of a show in kind. Tweet this link, tell your friends, and come visit us in Black Rock City and enjoy the perks we have for various donation levels.

story:
About the Studio & Founder

Hyden Studio will be a mixed use studio providing classes in Ballroom Dance, Yoga, Zumba, Cabaret Arts, and FlirtyGirl Fitness. The studio is the brain child of Jacqueline Hyde, an international entertainer, veteran professional of Ballroom and Latin dance. Jacqueline Hyde has taught the ballroom and cabaret arts professionally since 1999, having added Zumba in 2014, Yoga and FlirtyGirl Fitness in 2015 to her skill set.

Jacqueline Hyde has a Masters of Business Administration in Marketing and in Project Management. She also has placed as a top teacher in the Puget Sound Region and teaches not only face to face classes but online. Her day job touches the lives of millions in the technology industry as an Instructional Designer / Senior Content Editor for a major software company. Art has always been her passion, and the movement arts is where she wants to spend the rest of her adult career pursuing.

Studio Mission & Vision

The purpose of this mixed use studio is to give rising star professional yoga and movement artists to have the opportunity to leverage a respectful, positive and clean studio space. A place that allows those who come to learn or practice a space to feel the appreciation of art, creativity and inner strength and self-discovery. This will be done by offering a diverse course offering of Yoga classes, Ballroom dance programs, Zumba and FlirtyGirl Fitness, as well as Cabaret Arts (Such as Cabaret Dance and Performer Development).

The Plan

It is the plan to secure a studio space at in the Mountlake Terrace Neighborhood. A space being negotiated was selected because of its proximity to a transit center hub and centralization within a community. It also is a great opportunity to create a space as needed, rather than to fit the space to the needs. And to do this within the later part of the 2015 calendar year.


What We Need & What You Get

Why not a loan? The purpose of this fundraiser is to get the pre-purchase of the product to those who are interested in it. We decided against a loan, not because of fear of failure, but rather a real expectation of getting this idea to people like you, the ones who are interested!

What Hyden Studio requires is the start up funding to bring the course offerings to the community. In total we are looking to raise $45,000. 

The perks for your donation are:

  • $10.00 - Special Box of Hyden Studio - Victorian Rose Chocolate Tea
  • $25.00 - Signed Photo from Jacqueline Hyde
  • $50.00 - Ballroom Intro Package (3 - 30 min privates and 2 group classes)
  • $75.00 - Package of 5 Yoga
  • $80.00 - Private Lesson With Jacqueline Hyde
  • $120.00 - Zumba or FlirtyGirl Fitness Package - 10 

Risks & Challenges

Our limits right now is just the funding. Our obstacles are that of limited funding to set up the studio, like flooring, equipment, licenses and insurance. It is tough getting people in that front door, so marketing is critical and key, and a major challenge for any organization.

Final Thoughts

It is the heart felt intention of Hyden Studio to create the safe space for feeling positive about one's self. This is accomplished through great honest teaching, individualized personalized programs, and open heart felt environment. This mission of love and positivity will continue to be the foundation of the growth of this studio.

Much Sincerity,

Jacqueline Hyde

story:
CLIQUER ICI POUR LA VERSION EN FRANÇAIS

 

 

Pesot | Creative Organization initiates, promotes and supports visual arts projects locally and abroad. It puts the artist at the center of the artistic phenomenon and offers a collaborative space which makes the artist a leading player in the various aspects of his work.

As part of the collective exhibition In a Post-World : Post-Punk Art Now, we would like to create a printed work that will explore the integration of literature and visual arts, where photographs, drawings and texts intermingle. The outcome will be an oversized publication, and the aesthetic will be influenced by punk as much as it will question its influence in current artistic practices. 

Post-Punk Art Now will be the printed counterpart to the exhibition that will be held at The Invisible Dog in Brooklyn from October 27 to November 6, 2016.

Post-Punk Art Now will discuss the attitude, energy, aesthetics and the legacy of punk culture in the arts today.

Post-Punk Art Now will bring together artists and writers from:

 

  • New York: Todd Bienvenu, Michael David, Mina Pam Dick, Paul D'Agostino, Claudia Beauchesne Eve, Mandy Lyn Ford (other New Yorkers to be confirmed).
  • Quebec: Annie Baillargeon, Sylvain Bouthillette, Julie Andrée T., Sebastien Pesot, Marc-Antoine K. Phaneuf, Jacinthe Loranger, Mathieu Valade, David Clerson and Anouk Pennel / FEED.
  • And Philippe Nassif, from France.

 

 

 Courtesy of The Invisible Dog

 

What we need 

We need a minimum of $ 5000 US to complete the financing of the project.

  • $ 2,000 to supplement the cost of printing.
  • $ 1,500 for editing and translation.
  • $ 1,500 to distribute and post publications in the New York area. 
Post-Punk Art Now will be distributed for free, to over one hundred addresses, serving as a main tool for communication among cultural organizations, galleries, journalists and bloggers.

     

     

     

    Courtesy of Life on Mars Gallery

     

    What you get in return for your donation

      • 30 $ - One copy of the publication.
      • 50$ - In addition to the publication get one t-shirt.

      • 100 $ - Get the LAST one of the five hybrid works by Mathieu Valade and Marc-Antoine K. Phaneuf. Phaneuf will do literary intervention on each of the five photographs of Expressionism Concret from Valade.
      • 100 $ or more - Receive a limited edition of the publication (25 copies), numbered and autographed by authors and artists. A collector's item!

       

      Where to collect your perks (october 2016)

      • In Montreal, at Dominique Bouffard Gallery
      • In Québec City, at Galerie 3
      • In Chicoutimi, at Point de suspention bookstore.

       

       

      The Invisible Dog "Glass House"

       

      Urban Art

      We want to use one of the rooms of The Invisible Dog Gallery - a sort of DIY artistic greenhouse – exclusively for the purposes of presenting the publication and turning it into an art installation. 

      • The individual pages will cover all the windows, creating a gallery of glass and paper. 
      • As this room overlooks Bergen street - three doors next to the main gallery - the public and passerby will be able to witness the paper installation, reminiscent of punk concert posters.
      • At the exhibition in Brooklyn, Post Punk Art Now will have its rightful place in the midst of the exhibited works: the publication will engulf or entirely surround the exhibition as well as it will be part of it – the fusion and fission of unstable aesthetic matter.
      • The making and distribution of the book will be an inspiring post- gesture and an inspiring punk gesture in itself.

       

       

      Courtesy of Life on Mars Gallery

       

      I have no money! How can I help?

      • Spread the word! People need to know about this campaign. 
      • Love, comment and share the news on Twitter, Instagram or Facebook.
      • Thank you for your help and your support!

       

      Courtesy of Life on Mars Gallery

       

      We attach the utmost importance to the publication and this artistic gesture may lead to theoretical questions regarding current impacts or residual influences of one of the most important movements of the 20th century.

      http://pesot.ca/en/

       

      Courtesy of Dominique Bouffard Gallery

       
       

        VERSION EN FRANÇAIS

         

        Pesot | Organisme de création initie et soutient des projets en arts visuels et contribue à leur rayonnement au pays et à l’étranger. Il met l’artiste au centre du phénomène artistique et lui offre un espace collaboratif qui le positionne comme acteur prépondérant dans la maîtrise des divers aspects reliés à son travail.  

         

         

        Dans le cadre de l’exposition In a Post-World : Post-Punk Art Now, nous souhaitons produire une œuvre hybride, à la fois littéraire et graphique, une publication surdimensionnée où dessins, photographies et textes s’inspirent de l’esthétique punk et réfléchissent à son influence sur les pratiques artistiques actuelles. 

         

         

        Post-Punk Art Now est le pendant imprimé de l'exposition collective qui aura lieu à la galerie The Invisible Dog à Brooklyn du 27 octobre au 6 novembre 2016. 

        Post-Punk Art Now évoquera l’attitude, l’énergie, l'esthétique ou le leg de la culture punk dans les arts d'aujourd'hui.

        Post-Punk Art Now regroupera des artistes et des auteurs ...

        • Du Québec : Annie Baillargeon, Sylvain Bouthillette, Julie-Andrée T., Sébastien Pesot, Marc-Antoine K. Phaneuf, Jacinthe Loranger, Mathieu Valade, David Clerson et Anouk Pennel / FEED.
        • De New York : Todd Bienvenu, Michael David, Mina Pam Dick, Paul D'Agostino, Claudia Ève Beauchesne, Mandy Lyn Ford (d'autres New-Yorkais restent à confirmer).
        • Et Philippe Nassif, de la France. 

         

         

        Courtoisie de The Invisible Dog 

         

        Ce dont nous avons besoin

        Nous avons besoin d'un minimum de 5000$ U.S. pour terminer le financement.  

        • 2000$ pour compléter les coûts l'impression.
        • 1500$ pour la correction et la traduction des textes.
        • 1500$ pour distribuer et poster les publications sur le territoire new-yorkais.
        Post Punk Art Now sera distribuée gratuitement à plus d'une centaine d'adresses, faisant office d'outil principal de communication auprès des organismes culturels, galeries, journalistes et blogueurs.

        Avec plus de 5000$, nous pourrions...

        • Imprimer plus de copies!
        • Distribuer au Canada et aux États-Unis plus de copies!
        • Et même engager un relationniste de presse...

        Si nous n'atteignons pas notre objectif, nous imprimerons quand même la publication, mais avec moins de couleurs, moins de pages et en moins de copies.

         

        Courtoisie de la Galerie D'Este

         

        Ce que vous obtenez en contrepartie d'un don

        Tous les donateurs seront mentionnés à l'intérieur de la publication  (vous pouvez aussi rester anonyme).

        • 20$ Une des 100 affiches numérotées.

         

          • 30$ Un exemplaire de la publication.
          • 50$ En plus de la publication, recevez un t-shirt.

          • 50$ En plus de la publication, recevez un t-shirt.
          • 50$ Recevez l'une des 5 sérigraphies de Jacinthe Loranger.
          • 75$ Recevez l'une des 5 oeuvres hybrides de Mathieu Valade et Marc-Antoine K. Phaneuf. Phaneuf effectuera une intervention littéraire sur chacune des 5 photographies d'Expressionisme concret de Valade.
          • 100$ et plus, recevez une des 50 éditions limitées, numérotées et autographiées par les auteurs et artistes. Un objet de collection!
          • 500$ Signifiez votre engagement, avec un espace d'un quart de page dans la publication, mis en valeur par Anouk Pennel / FEED.
          • 1500$ Accrochez dans votre bureau, l'une des trois éditions de Crash #5, de Sébastien Pesot, à côté d'une sérigraphie de Jacinthe Loranger et d'une des oeuvres hybrides de Mathieu Valade et Marc-Antoine K. Phaneuf !

           

          Récupérer votre contrepartie en octobre 2016

          • À Brooklyn, lors de l'exposition à la galerie The Invisible Dog
          • À Brooklyn, à la galerie Life On Mars   
          • À Montréal, à la Galerie Dominique Bouffard
          • À Chicoutimi, à la libraire Point de suspention
          • Vous ne pouvez pas vous rendre sur place? Contactez : info @ pesot.ca pour un arrangement postal. Des coûts supplémentaires pourront vous être facturés.
           

             

            The Invisible Dog "Glass house"

             

            Art urbain

            Notre désir est d'utiliser entièrement la petite salle de la galerie The Invisible Dog - une sorte de serre DIY - pour l'installation de la publication. 

            • Les feuilles recouvriront l'ensemble des vitres du « glass house », offrant ainsi au public une galerie de verre et de papier. 
            • Comme cette salle donne sur la rue Bergen – trois portes à côté de la galerie principale – le public et les passants pourront assister à cette installation de papier rappelant les affiches de concert punk.
            • Lors de l'exposition à Brooklyn, Post-Punk Art Now prendra la place qui lui revient au milieu des œuvres exposées : la publication contiendra l’exposition en même temps qu’elle en fera partie – fusion et fission d’une matière esthétique instable.
            • La création et la diffusion de l’ouvrage seront un geste post- et un geste d'inspiration punk à part entière.

             

             

            Courtoisie de Julie-Andrée T.

             

            Je n'ai pas d'argent. Comment puis-je aider?

            • Passez le mot! Le monde doit entendre parler de cette campagne.
            • Aimer, commenter et partager la nouvelle sur Twitter, Instagram ou Facebook. 
            • Merci de votre aide et de votre support!

             

             

            Courtoisie de la Galerie Trois Points

             

            Nous accordons une très grande importance à cette publication, pensée comme un geste artistique pouvant jeter les bases d’un questionnement théorique sur l’influence résiduelle ou actuelle de ce mouvement marquant du 20e siècle.  

            http://pesot.ca

story:
Cuadro por Danza, festival de video y fotografía de danza, está dirigido y producido por Karla Medina y Bernardette Rodriguez, a través de la labor que realiza la Asociación Civil Cuadro por Danza, sin fines de lucro. Cuadro por Danza es el primer y único festival venezolano que convoca a este tipo de creadores y de contenido, que en su primera edición, en el año 2017, logró una receptividad muy positiva tanto en el público espectador como en los participantes.

Cuadro por Danza busca generar una plataforma en Venezuela para la proyección, promoción y difusión de material fotográfico y audiovisual relacionado con la danza con un alcance nacional e internacional. Nos interesa el desarrollo de espacios de aprendizaje e investigación para la formación de realizadores y espectadores en torno al video y fotografía de danza, y de esta manera incentivar el interés en comunidades y colectivos artísticos.

Para nosotras es importante y dependemos del apoyo que puedan ofrecernos en esta oportunidad.  Estamos comprometidas con el proyecto de una forma muy personal y nos dirigimos a ustedes como artistas, específicamente de la danza que es de donde surgieron las primeras iniciativas para crear este espacio, con el deseo de impulsar nuevas propuestas para ver, disfrutar y hacer danza.

En 2017, llevamos acabo la proyección de videos y de fotografías, para esta próxima edición, deseamos concretar el montaje de la exposición fotográfica, y darle el valor que las fotos merecen. Para ello necesitamos lo siguiente:

  • Impresión de cada fotografía seleccionada.
  • Curaduría para el montaje.
  • Marcos y paspartú.
  • Material de papelería.
  • Pintura para la pared de la sala de exposiciones.
  • Bombillos.
  • Impresiones de textos para cada foto.
  • Materiales para montaje; clavos, alambre, guayas de acero, mecatillo.
  • Rotulado
  • Diseño de flyer 

Ya nos hemos comprometido a forjar este nuevo espacio, ahora nos toca hacerlo con la mayor dedicación para que suceda con calidad y reconociendo las verdaderas necesidades de nuestra comunidad.

Hay un importante número de fotógrafos venezolanos que mantienen el entusiasmo por capturar la danza que ocurre en nuestro país. A esta comunidad la hemos invitado a este espacio para compartir aquello por lo cual sigue apostando y queremos que suceda de la manera más idónea como hemos logrado que ocurra con la Categoría de Video. Necesitamos imprimir cada copia de fotografía seleccionada, queremos lograr nuestra exposición fotográfica en Cuadro por Danza.

Si no llegamos a lograr el 100 % de los fondos que precisamos, ajustaríamos la exposición a una menor cantidad de fotografías o nos limitaríamos a lo más esencial  para el montaje con respecto a materiales de construcción y papelería. Pero de cualquier manera, con lo que alcancemos, llevaríamos a cabo la exhibición, ya que el festival no podría reemplazar el espacio de fotografía de ninguna manera . Por otro lado, si se llegara a superar la cantidad esperada, aprovecharíamos el remanente para fondos de imprevistos que amerita la producción del evento.

Si no puedes contribuir con nosotras de esta manera, estamos seguras que encontrarás otras formas de ayudar, y de igual manera te lo agradeceremos.

Tenemos poco tiempo,¿qué tal si nos ayudas a correr la voz?

¡Recuerda usar las herramientas de compartir de Indiegogo!
story_txt:
Cuadro por Danza, festival de video y fotografía de danza, está dirigido y producido por Karla Medina y Bernardette Rodriguez, a través de la labor que realiza la Asociación Civil Cuadro por Danza, sin fines de lucro. Cuadro por Danza es el primer y único festival venezolano que convoca a este tipo de creadores y de contenido, que en su primera edición, en el año 2017, logró una receptividad muy positiva tanto en el público espectador como en los participantes.
Cuadro por Danza busca generar una plataforma en Venezuela para la proyección, promoción y difusión de material fotográfico y audiovisual relacionado con la danza con un alcance nacional e internacional. Nos interesa el desarrollo de espacios de aprendizaje e investigación para la formación de realizadores y espectadores en torno al video y fotografía de danza, y de esta manera incentivar el interés en comunidades y colectivos artísticos.
Para nosotras es importante y dependemos del apoyo que puedan ofrecernos en esta oportunidad.  Estamos comprometidas con el proyecto de una forma muy personal y nos dirigimos a ustedes como artistas, específicamente de la danza que es de donde surgieron las primeras iniciativas para crear este espacio, con el deseo de impulsar nuevas propuestas para ver, disfrutar y hacer danza.
