Impresión de cada fotografía seleccionada.
Curaduría para el montaje.
Marcos y paspartú.
Material de papelería.
Pintura para la pared de la sala de exposiciones.
Bombillos.
Impresiones de textos para cada foto.
Materiales para montaje; clavos, alambre, guayas de acero, mecatillo.
Rotulado
Diseño de flyer 

Ya nos hemos comprometido a forjar este nuevo espacio, ahora nos toca hacerlo con la mayor dedicación para que suceda con calidad y reconociendo las verdaderas necesidades de nuestra comunidad.
Hay un importante número de fotógrafos venezolanos que mantienen el entusiasmo por capturar la danza que ocurre en nuestro país. Necesitamos imprimir cada copia de fotografía seleccionada, queremos lograr nuestra exposición fotográfica en Cuadro por Danza.
Si no llegamos a lograr el 100 % de los fondos que precisamos, ajustaríamos la exposición a una menor cantidad de fotografías o nos limitaríamos a lo más esencial  para el montaje con respecto a materiales de construcción y papelería. Pero de cualquier manera, con lo que alcancemos, llevaríamos a cabo la exhibición, ya que el festival no podría reemplazar el espacio de fotografía de ninguna manera . Por otro lado, si se llegara a superar la cantidad esperada, aprovecharíamos el remanente para fondos de imprevistos que amerita la producción del evento.
Si no puedes contribuir con nosotras de esta manera, estamos seguras que encontrarás otras formas de ayudar, y de igual manera te lo agradeceremos.
Tenemos poco tiempo,¿qué tal si nos ayudas a correr la voz?
¡Recuerda usar las herramientas de compartir de Indiegogo!

story:
About The Fair

Presented by Saatchi Art, The Other Art Fair will take place in the heart of Dallas at Dallas Market Hall this September 19-22, 2019. Over the past eight years, The Other Art Fair has led the way in uncovering and nurturing new and innovative creative talent, allowing artists to forge direct relationships with potential buyers and gallerists. I am thrilled for this exciting opportunity to present my work alongside the best emerging artists today.

Campaign Breakdown

The $1,994 raised from this campaign will be put toward:

  •  A gallery quality booth measuring 16 linear ft. with overhead lighting = $1,680 + sales tax = $1,818.60
  • General Liability Insurance for the duration of the fair = $175 

How You Can Help

I am filled with so much gratitude towards my family, friends, collectors and supporters. I could not do what I do everyday without you all cheering me on! For this campaign, I will be seeking tiered contributions which will be matched with the equivalent print or painting in exchange. 

A $30-$50 contribution will receive a signed fine art print of your choice from my online store (www.kristinmooreart.com/shop). 

  • $30 - 8x8in fine art print, signed and dated 
  • $40 - 10x10in fine art print, signed and dated
  •  $50 - 12x12in fine art print, signed and dated

(All campaign print orders will be mailed within 2 weeks after the campaign has concluded. I'll send over an email after your contribution has posted to get your print selection. US shipping & handling included in print pricing.)

A $250 contribution will receive a custom 8x8x2in painting on wood panel (only three available).

A $390 contribution will receive a custom 12x12x2in painting on wood panel (only two available).

(*For custom painting orders I will reach out directly to set up a commission consultation & questionnaire via email. Please allow 1-2 months after the campaign has concluded to receive your painting. It could be less than that, but (in all transparancy) I will be completely focused on prepping for the fair in July/August. Feel free to email me at kristinmooreart@gmail.com for any questions at all!*)

Other Ways You Can Help

I would be immensely grateful for any support you can offer, whether you want to claim one of the tiered options, chip in a few dollars, or even just share my campaign to your friends, family,  or social media. Anything and everything is appreciated! Thank you SO much for being awesome and supportive!

story:
WE ARE A TEAM OF ARTISTS, CREATIVES, ACTIVISTS & CONCERNED CITIZENS 
that believe the fate of our nation depends on the outcome of the upcoming election.
Trump's words are divisive and filling our country with hate. This is the 1st
nationally organized activist and protest art initiative ever attempted.

 

We are gathering 50 ARTISTS in 50 STATES to uniquely interpret President Donald J. Trump's
divisive words, outrageous quotes and incomprehensible tweets. Our goal is to raise awareness
on the severity of what is at stake in this upcoming election. 

With public art we will be encouraging community and public participation as a means
of bringing about social change. We hope to strike up dialogue, raise consciousness,
and empower individuals and communities. We want it to encourage everyone that can,
to vote and tell others to vote as well. The three main medias that will be used are
mural/street art, 3D projection mapping (on landmarks) and digital billboard trucks.

 

 

 

 

 

HUMBLE  I  Richmond, Virginia

 

 

 

JENNY ROESEL USTICK  I  Cincinnati, Ohio

 

 

All artwork will be unveiled on OCTOBER 24th DURING FREE SPEECH WEEK as many
of our supporters will gather at our Nation’s Capital to protest Trump's words and actions.
The March For All intends to bring all people of all backgrounds together in a solidarity
march against this President. Individuals and groups marching will be comprised of environmentalists, grassroots organizations, women’s rights activists, people against
police brutality & racial injustice, people fighting for LGBTQ equality, immigration rights
activists, concerned citizens, teachers’ rights groups and many more. If you are against
this president, his administration and want to see someone else in office, we want you there.

 

 

 

 

 

This is a giant undertaking and includes risks and challenges such as reaching our target goal, artist's scheduling/booking conflicts & logistics, securing locations and the possibility of march changes.*

The minimum amount to compensate artists, project manage the campaign, secure locations, purchase art supplies, equipment, hire vendors, pull permits, etc. and have the whole project up and running by October 24th is 3,000,000.00 U.S.D.

 

 

Imagine if Trump wins again. Think we are divided now? Imagine what another four years will
do to this country. We need to overfund this project to make the largest impact and to continue to be able to fight for social injustice in our future projects. We need to win this November in a landslide and make sure the world hears our message. The citizens of these United States will no longer sit in silence. WE WILL BE LOUDER THAN HATE. 

 

Spread the word about the Louder Than Hate cause, 
vote this November & encourage others to VOTE!

Please use the INDIEGOGO share tools to help everyone become LOUDER THAN HATE. 

 

 

* Due to Covid-19, we will have updates if an alternative solution(s) is required.

story:
My story 

 

Hi, my name is Bart Zwaard. I am a Dutch graphic designer. For almost 20 years I have worked, with great passion, as an Art & Graphic Design professor at a high school in Rotterdam, The Netherlands.

Two years ago my wife and I made a big decision: After years of doubts we decided to follow our hearts and make our big dream reality. We found the courage to move to Italy, to start a new life with our two kids, in the country of our dreams. A big risk, giving up all our certainties, but we figured ' if your dreams do not scare you, they are not big enough.'

The past two years were amazing. We learned the language, adapted to the culture and made new friends. I give Art & English lessons to children now and I have organised a summercamp 'Art is Fun.' We also developed ourselves big time. Finally we had the opportunity to really explore what we value in life and we discovered numerous talents within ourselves.

My love for art and graphic design sticked with me and made me realize: I want to work as an independent graphic designer/artist. You can help me realize that dream!

 

Every day I draw. At the dinner table, on the train, in a park, during long, exhausting meetings. I always end up with tiny, cute 'chibi style' characters. 'These Tiny Bastardz keep on popping up!' Even when I am drawing something completely different. But I love to draw them,  to create new characters and from the love for these cute, little figures the Tiny Bastardz Art Collection was born.

 

I hope you will adore them, just as much as I do. I have designed a big set of backgrounds to support them. All in a clean, modern style. Ready to be framed. Designs to make you feel happy!

Artwork you will enjoy every day! 

 

NOW is the time to show my art collection to the world! 

To really get my business started I need my artwork printed and displayed in counter top displays in shops. I also need a website with an integrated webshop to sell and promote my art collection. And I need funding for the marketing of the brand.

 

You can help me achieve these goals! 

Support my project, buy a perk and get my artwork. Tell everybody about my project by sharing on social and by word-of-mouth. 

Your support will help my Tiny Bastardz get out of their computer folder and into the world! :)

Together we can make this happen!!

What I Need & What You Get 

 

I have already invested a lot of money and time in this Start Up, but to really kickstart this business I need to raise an additional €12.500,-. This amount is needed to set up a range of artprints presented in a professional way. The funds will be spend on:

  • Printing of the artwork 
  • Website with webshop
  • Marketing
  • Counter top displays
  • Development of the brand 
  • Perks
  • Shipping and packing material 
  • 5% fee Indiegogo and 5% payment system fee

 

Perks: gifts to say 'thank you!' 

 

I have created all sorts of nice looking perks. Gifts to thank you for your support! Such as digital wallpaper backgrounds for your phone, a signed 'thank you' postcard, printed artwork in different sizes, paintings and original drawings.

You even have the possibility to get your own personalized artwork I will design especially for you! Just tell me your wishes and I will work my magic!

Just click on the different perks to check out what is included. 

Scroll down to see all the available artwork for this campaign. Pick a size, pick the quantity, donate and the artwork will be coming your way. I will email you to get your choice of artwork and send you a professionally produced print on good quality paper in a cardboard envelop to protect it. 

Of course I will keep you updated during the campaign and after. 

 

Timeline

The Impact 

 

Your contribution will make a huge difference!

It will mean I can get my artwork printed, displayed in counter top displays in shops and presented online in a professional webshop.

And it will allow me to continue working as an independent artist and support my family. It will allow me to create more art, more graphic designs and products. All to build a strong brand: the Tiny Bastardz Art Collection.

 

 'It is so colorful and these Tiny Bastardz just look so adorable! It makes me happy!'

 

Comments like this motivate me every day. I want to make artwork and graphic designs that will cheer you up, every day! Artwork that will look great in every room of your house, whether it is a big painting in the living room or a smaller print in a frame for the kids room.

Donate and let my Tiny Bastardz cheer up your days!

 

Ambition

After my Tiny Bastardz are availabIe in shops and online I want to expend the collection with not only new artwork, but also all kinds of merchandising like books, diaries, backpacks, coloring books, notebooks, dolls and so on. 

I am currently designing a set of themed backgrounds for all major cities in Europe. Themed pieces of artwork, that will be sold in tourist hotspots throughout Europe, like Venice, London, Verona, Paris, Barcelona etc..  As a nice memory for travellers to take home. The artwork will be sold sealed in plastic foil and protected by cardboard backing. Easy to take with you in a suitcase. 

Risks & Challenges 

All of my artwork is done, print ready. I already have a trusted partner for the printing of the artwork. So there will be no obstacle to produce the perks on time. We already discussed a timetable for the proofing, printing and the post-processing of the artwork as well as for the counter top displays. I can't guarantee it 100% of course, but I don't foresee delays in the development and producing of your precious perks! ;)

There is always a small risk of delay when shipping products overseas. I will notify you when this is the case and keep you updated via email. I will ship your perks in cardboard envelops to protect your artwork. Bigger artwork will be send in protective cardboard tubes. 

If I do not reach my entire goal I will first get my artwork printed. It will mean the website and webshop will be build later and the marketing budget will be smaller. It will mean a serious delay in starting up the business, however it will not mean any delay in the delivery of your perks. Your support means the world to me, so I will make sure your gifts come first.

Other Ways You Can Help 

 

I understand that not everyone is able to financially support my project, so help me get the word out! Tell friends and family about this project, share on social, make some noise. The more people I can reach, the greater the chance of success!

 

I will be truly grateful for your support!

 

THANK YOU SO MUCH!

 

Bart Zwaard  

The artwork

 

Pick a size, pick the quantity, donate and the artwork will be coming your way. I will email you to get your choice of artwork and send you a professionally produced print on good quality paper in a cardboard envelop to protect it. 

Additional video

Your support means the world to me, so I will make sure your gifts come first.


Other Ways You Can Help 
 
I understand that not everyone is able to financially support my project, so help me get the word out! Tell friends and family about this project, share on social, make some noise. The more people I can reach, the greater the chance of success!
 
I will be truly grateful for your support!
 
THANK YOU SO MUCH!
 
Bart Zwaard  

The artwork
 




Pick a size, pick the quantity, donate and the artwork will be coming your way. I will email you to get your choice of artwork and send you a professionally produced print on good quality paper in a cardboard envelop to protect it. 

Additional video

story:
The Basics

Looking for awesome art of all kinds? Order a pre-release copy of the new magazine "An Artist's Inspiration Guide" today! What is it? A.A.I.G. is an Indie Art Magazine created by the art community for everyone in need of inspiration, regardless of their "art" background.

Hello! My name is Juliet and I am an enthusiastic artist looking to bring the world together for an epic and exciting collision of all art forms. It's frustrating as an artist to lose inspiration. With this magazine, that will no longer be a problem!

All we need is $500 to pay for the bare minimum cost of editing,  formatting and general promotion of this magazine's launch. After that, any extra funds will go toward further promotion and/or next year's AAIG copy.

If we don't reach our goal? All of the money goes right back to our sponsors (you) and we don't publish. SO PLEASE SPONSOR US BY ORDERING A PRE-RELEASE COPY OR AN AD IN THE BACK OF THE MAGAZINE! (Both can be found in this campaign's "Perks" section.)

Artists Of All Kinds

Please keep reading if you are an artist of any kind!!

Collector? Poet? Beauty Artist? Digital Artist? Architect? Art is all around us! Please share your work with the world by publishing it on our pages! Our BIGGEST goal is trying to find a wide variety of art styles/types.

Submitting your work for publication requires just a few short steps...

  • E-mail contactaaig@gmail.com with your publication name (real or stage), a blurb of your work, high resolution images (if applicable), and contact information for readers to get in touch with you about your work.
  • Please also mention if you are (or aren't) open to an interview.
  • All accepted artists will be sent a policy agreement to read and review before publication. Although we cannot offer cash rewards at this point, we hope to open doors for you through exposure of your work and direct contact information that will be available to all readers/interested parties. That said, if this year's magazine launch is a success, we hope to offer more to our artists next year.

The Impact

With your help (and only with your help) we will be able to give exposure to well deserved artists who otherwise may not get discovered. The art community is a competitive one. It's hard to get the attention one needs to continue their work. Without this support and recognition, it's easy to lose hope and especially inspiration.

Getting published will make a HUGE difference to many many artists. Please support them by making a contribution and/or ordering a pre-release copy of the magazine.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please e-mail contactaaig@gmail.com if you are interested in reviewing a pre-release copy of the magazine.
  • AND PLEASE USE THE INDIEGOGO SHARE TOOLS!! We need all of the help we can get in publishing this magazine!

Thank you so much for your time and attention!
